author: Jonathan Feldschuh
title: Easiest and Best way to renew your Norton Subscription
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This review is just about the process of renewing your Norton subscription using a product key after purchasing the Digital Download.  I have been using Norton for a few years, and I am reasonably satisfied with the product, but I have not compared it with competing products lately.  Thirty days before the 1-year license expires, Norton starts popping up ever more intrusive reminders to renew, pointing you to their site, where they want $79.99 for a year.  Renewing with this product on Amazon is half the price, and the renewal process is super simple.  Immediately after purchasing the digital content, click on the "Your Games and Software Library Link", and activate the product.  Then copy the (long) key shown.  Then in Norton security, click on Renew my subscription, then click on "I have a key" and enter the new key.  Sign into your Norton account to activate the new key, and you will have 366 more days.  One slightly annoying thing is that it does not give you credit for any remaining days on your old subscription, but considering that the renewal is half-off this is not a big deal.  There is no need to actually download anything or uninstall any old versions.

author: California Shopper
title: WARNING - FRAUD ALERT ATTACHED TO THIS PRODUCT!!!!!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Be very careful with this product.  I am not sure what happened, but when we downloaded this file and attempted to install it on our computer, we got a fictitious warning from someone posing as a Norton representative saying that our software could not be installed because our network had been hacked and we had 16 unauthorized users on our account from a URL somewhere in Ohio.  What ensued was a 3 hour scramble to clean our network and install a 3rd party anti-hacking program to protect our network....  and the whole thing turned out to be a scam.  We verified with Norton direct that it was a scam, the individual we talked to was not employed by Norton, and his phone # was connected to a fraud ring in China.  If you get a pop up warning like this - ignore it and call Norton direct using their bona fide phone # (found online) and not the fake one on the pop up.  Note for Amazon - check this out because somehow, some way, the scammers used this software to gain access to my computer and potentially all my passwords and accounts.  I have had to put a freeze on all my accounts with the credit bureaus, all my bank accounts, cancel credit cards, the works.

author: Tony NYC
title: SLOWS UP YOUR COMPUTER ~ BAD PERFORMANCE WITH WINDOWS 10
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: HORRIBLE FOR WINDOWS 10I originally gave this product a 3 star review. I am now retracting that review and rating to 1 star.In a matter of days, this product slowed my computer down considerably.I build, repair and maintain computers for a living,I, of course, uninstalled my previous security suite, did a cleanup and made sure that my operating system was up to date and in tip top shape. I also checked my internet speed before, during and after to rule out networking and ISP issues. My speed was consistently high throughout.I then called Symantec for a refund after only a week of use.They directed me to a form on their web site that was pathetic to fill out. That form ALSO had to be printed out and MAILED to them via the USPS. THEN they told me it would take about SIX WEEKS to get my refund,. ,Can you imagine that a company that is an INTERNET COMPANY requires a form be sent to them via SNAIL MAIL?I, and millions of others who return this product are in essence giving them an interest free loan for six weeks.SO, the product SLOWS down your computer and they will make you jump through hoops to get a refund,Thank God that bought it through AMAZON where they just gave me a refund in a matter of one minute on the phone with them.KUDO's TO AMAZON ! ! !

author: Kindle Customer
title: Norton Security Deluxe 5 Devices
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Note you have to go to the Norton Site to complete this install with your code key from Amazon. Pretty straightforward.  If you don't have an account with Norton already you will have to set one up as well as enter a credit card to set up for auto renew when this subscription runs out. You can deselect the auto renew at anytime in your Norton account after you get it set up. This is my fourth year with Norton Anti virus and am very satisfied with the products performance over the years. Recommend it highly. Have not set it up on my android yet so can not speak to that. Also have put on 2 other computers, very easy to do.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I like Norton but....
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I like Norton but....I already had Norton on my pc and when I clicked the renew button, it didn't give me the best price. Then I went to Amazon and bought it. The problem with buying it from Amazon it that it didn't add a year to my existing time like it would have if I had used the renew button on the program. If you do what I did, I suggest you wait until the last day of your currrent plan before you buy the new version.Shame on Norton for not offering existing customers the best price.Cheers to Amazon for offering the best price!

author: T. Legge
title: Norton Safe Search censors opinions about Norton!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Censored search results - not safety related! I could not disable/hide the huge Safe Search toolbar which was taking up too much screen space. I got frustrated and tried to search "I hate Norton toolbar". Norton censored my search results inappropriately! I know because I did the same search on Google and other browsers came up with all kinds of helpful results -  which is how I figured out how to disable the toolbar.Originally I just wanted to reduce the space the tool bar took up, but now I don't want Norton censoring out opinions about Norton - or any other item Norton decides it doesn't care for.PS - Norton's own solution - Right-clicking the Norton button - did not work for me to take care of the screen problem. On Firefox, the tools - extension - got rid of the toolbar. Or the SafeSearch toolbar can be hidden, but still function. Before the censoring, I would have just hidden the toolbar. Also, tons of adverts show up when using Norton Safe Search.

author: Primo
title: Didn't want to install on 5 devices and Norton's Advertising is getting out of hand...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This is probably the last time I use Norton. First of all this product would not install on 5 devices. It kept insisting that this was only a 3 license product. Got on chat with a support agent that had difficulty communicating clearly, but after some time we got it fixed. They changed the product internally and I just had to reactivate on all my machines.While annoying, this by itself would not have made me dump Norton. Its their constant advertising and scare tactics. I don't want to use lifelock, it had a terrible reputation before Symantec bought it. I also already have a different better password manager. Stop bugging me about your IDsafe. Norton's used to break every time Firefox updated forcing me to buy a different product. I'm sure its gotten better, but why change from something I'm already very satisfied with? Besides the regular advertising (my PC is not a TV !) scare tactics like with the Krack vulnerability really annoys me. This vulnerability affects wifi, but if you are on a wired network at home, guess what it doesn't affect you. Not everything is vulnerable to this. Also many products have patches for this vulnerability. This is all about pushing their products and I've got other things to do then be distracted by advertising.

author: Michael Secour
title: When it is good, it is very, very good; when it is bad it is horrid
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have used Norton for several years and have been relatively happy. I paid for a 2 year subscription two years ago -- before upgrading my computer to Windows 10. After upgrading my computer to Windows 10, Norton updated my software from the old Norton 360 to Security Premium. It worked smoothly but coverage for 10 devices with added protection for families with children was simply overkill for a retired couple. I decided to save money by switching to the more affordable Norton Security Deluxe. I chatted online with a Norton agent in order to receive advice on the best way to remove Premium and install deluxe. The helpful agent offered to do it for me by taking control of my computer. That was probably my big mistake. After the Norton agent removed Premium and installed Deluxe on my desktop computer I chose to do the same by myself on my laptop computer. The laptop has no issues but the Deluxe installation performed by the Norton rep has some serious problems. I returned to Norton support. Three different technicians spent a combined 3 hours and 15 minutes on my computer and have been unable to leave me with a successful installation. Their final solution was to tell me I would have to create a new User account on my computer and delete my old one. I started that process but have run into some serious challenges in creating an alternate account that will successfully handle our Outlook accounts and successfully network with my other computer. I've decided that Norton is the tail trying to wag the dog. I am currently looking at alternative products. Very disappointed with Norton after many good years.

author: lamar
title: Disappointed in Norton anti-virus coverage  which I ordered from Amazon
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I paid Amazon  for a one year subscription with Norton Internet Security for 5 PC's.  I have used Norton anti-virus protection for at least 20 years and am well pleased with this product.  I liked the price about $35 which Amazon was promoting to cover 5 PC's for a year.  However, after I used it on 2 PC's I tried unsuccessfully to install this program on a third PC and received an error message from Norton that there were no more subscriptions available on this subscription for the remaining 3 PC's.  I contacted Norton and they confirmed that the first two PC's were covered but no more coverage was available for me on the Amazon subscription.  I explained the situation to them and they were very apologetic.  Norton told me that I could get one year coverage on 10 PC's for $49.99 and that as a matter of good faith on their part, they would sell me this coverage for only $25.00.  I personally checked the two PC's on which the Amazon Norton anti-virus system had been installed and determined that they were  functioning properly.  In summary, I was disappointed in Amazon and will deal directly with Norton for future subscriptions.

author: Ashley C.
title: iOS Owners Beware
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Buyer Beware.  It says "secures up to 5 PCs, Macs, iOS & Android devices."  This does not include iOS devices.  A family member and I purchased one for each of us (because we have a mac and 2 iOS devices each) thinking that we would need 3 devices to protect our devices and we come to find out we can only use the program on one device (the Mac).  I contacted Norton directly and was told they only offer contact back-up and anti-theft protection on iOS devices only and that is described on their website.  The Amazon description does not tell any of this in fact it states that it does secure my iOS device.

author: John Lipton
title: Norton spams you with their own popups to get you to install plugins that let them track you.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: On mac Norton shows a spammy pop-up to force you to install their safe search browser plugins. there is no way to disable to pop-up but if you install the browser plugin it overrides your search settings and lets Norton track you. This is very anti-consumer behavior, I regret my purchase because of this.

author: Cara Blotzer
title: at best. Even with the optimization options
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Want to supposedly be protected & safe? Then be prepared to surf & shop at dial-up speeds, at best. Even with the optimization options, my PC locked up 75% of the time. As much as I want and need security & protection, this software was a completely obstructionist nightmare. I am shocked and disgusted that this is what it takes to secure my information. So I'm out my $40ish, and annoyed af (no refunds! buyer beware)......there MUST be a better option. Just to reiterate, this made me want to throw my laptop out into the street.

author: Sasha Q.
title: Norton is the BEST!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have used several different virus protection products over the last 5 years or so. These have included McAfee, Avast (both free and premium), and, most recently, Kaspersky. I haven't used a Norton product for probably about 10 years or so. I am so happy that I decided to switch up this year, as I was not happy with both McAfee and Kaspersky in the last few years because they both really bogged down my machines and made them run slow. They both had a lot of unwanted "features" that didn't even work correctly (such as functions that keep your other software "up to date"--forget it--neither of them could figure out when my browsers and other software were up to date and I kept getting blasted with bogus warnings!).My problem with Avast was that the free version didn't catch all the malware, and the premium version also bogged my system down. Plus, I had to go through hoops just to cancel "automatic" renewal with Avast. It was a mess.I am so happy with Norton. They really run a very, very thorough full scan. The most thorough out of all the other products mentioned above. Their software does not slow down my system at all. This product was easy to install, and runs like a dream. I highly recommend this product for complete computer security.

author: JPnJessie
title: Useless if you travel overseas.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I purchased this product and traveled a few days later.  "Your Norton product activation failed because the product key that you used is not valid for the geographical region that you are trying to activate it in. This issue can occur when products are distributed to you outside of the region they are intended for. Symantec recommends that you return the incorrect product to the retailer where you purchased it from and request a refund" is what Norton tells me.  I am in Ecuador, South America for a minimum of 6 months.  I purchased an item which is useless for me.  I downloaded it in the USA and simply can not use it.

author: Rob L.
title: So secure it blocks all connections completely
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Installing Norton on my brand new computer ruins all the DNS settings to the point where the internet is unusable (in Chrome, Firefox, or Edge). Manually setting the DNS on my NIC to another non Norton non DHCP setting allows the internet to be used, but all access to the router is still blocked. It literally says your Access is Blocked to my own router.I went through the whole Chat Support and Forum Support process to figure this out, set network trust to full, uninstalled Norton, reinstalled Norton, all to no avail. I have to uninstall or stop the program just to get onto my own router, which I need to do from time to time.I've seen other forum posts on their site complaining about Lenovo computers and this software, so I'm likely just going to call this a complete loss of money and go back to the other AV I've used for 7 years which may or may not be a front for the CIA or Russian Government.EDIT: Updating review, after about two and a half hours with a tech from Norton and a Supervisor we got it working today, in the most odd way I've ever seen (hand editing a device driver location in Regedit), I'm bumping it up because the techs ended up being quite helpful and skilled, however I'm keeping it at 3 because nobody would ever be able to figure that out through casual use and it took almost three hours of my day to get resolved, after a few days of hunting down other solutions.

author: Road Warrior
title: Great software but they never seem to fess up when there are known problems
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've had Norton security for nearly 20 years and it works very well. That said, many of us in recent days, weeks and even years have periodically encountered a screen "Coming soon -- last scan 8 seconds ago" when we check properties and status. On my own, I rebooted my PC and sure enough, Norton worked fine for a day and then lapsed into this nonsense again. So I checked the Norton customer forum and other web sites and found this has been a problem for several years. And all Norton seems to be able to tell customers is: (1) We're looking into it. (2) Please send us a screen shot so we can better identify the problem. or (3) You need to uninstall the product and then reinstall it. I finally did the last, in conjunction with an on-line chat person at the Norton service center to whom I gave access to my computer. I would have done it myself, except years ago when a number of us had to do an "uninstall/reinstall," the uninstall left pieces of the old Norton software in hidden places on our PC's and it took Norton engineers two hours or more (I'm not joking) to go through my PC to find the undesired remaining pieces of the old version since the replacement version wouldn't install until these pieces were found.Again, it's terrific protection against viruses, malware and the like. It works wonderfully on my PC, tablet and mobile phone. Unlike years past, it doesn't slow down any of my regular processes. But like too many companies, when Norton/Symantec has a problem that it knows about, the company still has a culture of hiding it rather than fessing up. What would I prefer? That they send a weekly or similar alert: "We've been seeing this sort of problem from a number of subscribers. If you encounter it, here's what you should do . . . . " That's a company to which I'd happily give five stars.

author: BoBo
title: No longer a happy Norton user
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have used Norton packages for years and have trusted them to give full protection without any issues.  I have been using this and previous versions, but could not finish installation of a Norton update when using this.  When I contacted their support for help, they said it was because I had used Ask.com as a search engine.  Also, I might have malware or a phishing app on my machine as a result.  They recommended a $200 consulting fee/protection plan to search and clean the machine to fix the problem (which I fell for).  When I asked what they found, it didn’t sound like anything significant.  I think just deleting Ask as a search engine would have solved the problem.  I thought this is what I bought originally, that the Norton package with it’s periodic scans would search and remove such things.  My confidence in Norton to protect me after this incident is pretty low now.  Norton evidently uses independent contractors for their Help Desk who are on a commission, using the same techniques as those who make spam calls trying to tell you your WINDOWS LICENSE HAS EXPIRED so they can make a quick buck.

author: Ralph Stevens
title: WARNING - When purchased as renewal your 2015 subscription is NOT extended by one year.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Purchasing this as a renewal of your 2015 subscription?Hold on before you submit the code to RENEW. It does NOT extend your subscription by one year. RENEW will give you one year from the day you submit the product code. You LOSE the days remaining on your 2015 subscription.Shame on Amazon, Norton and Symantec for continuing this deceptive practice. RENEW a subscription is commonly understood to mean extend the term of a subscription. RENEW here means LOSING the remaining days on your active subscription.WAIT until your 2015 subscription is actually expiring before you purchase and submit the product code for renewal. That's the only way to not lose what you've paid for and get an honest renewal.

author: Tommy
title: Norton Security Deluxe installation is FLAWED !!!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I am absolutely sorry I ever ordered this product!  I have ordered multi-machine Symantec AV products for years from Amazon and this one totally sucks.  I bought the 5-machine Norton Security Deluxe (NSD) b/c I had heard it provided better protection vs. NAV.I have these machines:1 XPpro Workstation1 Win7 Laptop1 Win7 Desktop1 Win8 LaptopFor several of these, the installation was problematic b/c I was never prompted for Activation.  Hence, while it appeared that the installation went OK, the NSD was not working.  After several attempts to get it working, I called Norton "tech support" and got an off-shore guy who was useless.  The call lasted close to an hour during which he had to take control of my PC and do what I could have done (but shouldn't have had to).  After much pain and hassle, that machine seems to be protected.On my Win7 Laptop, NSD "was" working OK for a couple weeks and then the Norton icon window raised its ugly head and told me my subscription had expired !!!  Ugghhh !!!!  So, I just uninstalled my NSD and reinstalled NSD from my download exe and same message:Your subscription has expired !!I wish Norton had an English-speaking American who could talk me through this.  Better yet, I wish Norton made a stable product that installed as easily as ALL the earlier versions of NAV I've installed.And now, it seems that Amazon cannot even refund me.  Busted.

author: Bob
title: Product Scam
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I purchased a 5 unit subscription Key for Norton Security Deluxe and installed it on my primary computer.  It seemed to work correctly for 30 days except I continued to get notices from Norton saying my subscription had expired.  After 30 days, Norton posted a notice that my subscription had expired. I tried to install the Norton software using the Key that I had purchased and each try failed.  I called the Norton Help desk and was informed that the key that Amazon sent me was already registered to someone else.  So the Amazon sale was fraudulent.  Since Amazon does not allow software returns, I was unable to recover my purchase costs for the sale from Amazon.  Apparently  I had somehow installed a free 30 day  subscription and not a valid copy of the subscription that I had tried to purchase. So I am not sure that I can trust any future Amazon software sales.

author: Foreman
title: Bad Auto-Renewal  Good Norton Customer Service
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Have used Norton successfully for many years with only one failure to detect a rootkit virus.I have always renewed with new subscription but ran into problems this year.  I could not enter the product key to renew this year (2019) without getting directed to Norton site which indicated I needed to enter billing information for auto-renew with this product key.  Unlike in the  past I could not seem to avoid or skip the auto-renewal step for this year's product key no matter what route I tried (Norton account or using "I have product key" from Norton desktop window.  Although the product information this year does indicate that billing information was required I didn't anticipate this since none of the recent 2019 reviews for this product mentioned that entering billing/auto-renewal was really mandatory or offered a clear way to not do this.The good news is that I called Norton support and they activated the product code without billing information or activating auto-renewal and even added on the remaining 7 days for my subscription.  While I am happy with this resolution and with Norton Security I hope that Norton (and Amazon) will please consider offering a NS renewal product that doesn't require billing information or auto-renewal.Thanks.

author: Widgeted
title: Don't buy software from Amazon
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Ordered this got information to get it  downloaded from Norton.  After several attempts the download did not work and kept taking me to an old account I had.  I had a person "Chris C" come on line Chat and send me instructions and ask if any questions while I was typing the person terminated the chat and not to be heard from since.  About the 7th attempt I got an error message MK4647B and to call 844-383-8998, a person  called who did not speak English very well I told him so and he  told me "That's your problem."  I did make out that he wanted control of my computer - no way I told him he hung up.  Now someone who can't speak English want's control of my computer, I get at least 1 call like that a day!  The guy called back and rudely made some comments, I hung up on him.  Now I got no software and Amazon says no refunds in their add for software.Amazon has indicated that I will get credit for the purchase, but still will never buy Norton due to their customer service.

author: Becca
title: Run, don't walk from this Product
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: While the product is okay it doesn't make up for the incredibly LOUSY, INCOMPETENT support.  Their chat support is obviously from offshore.  Asked the same questions EIGHT (8) TIMES and they kept typing unrelated crap.  Oh and the worse?  Currently NORTON does NOT work on Android phone.  Play Store gag's when you try to use the link from Norton.  Asked in chat simply the name of the App (actually asked 8 times) and they would never answer.BTW - NO / ZERO EMAIL SUPPORT (no email address available period)

author: PB2008
title: Product is great; BEWARE on renewals!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton Security Deluxe is a very good protection suite. It provides protection with minimal processor impact on the computer or phone. Note that if you use an iPhone many experts say ANY protection suite provides little benefit due to the iPhone's native compartmentalization of apps and iOS operating system. I use Norton on desktop and laptop computers, and on Android smartphones, but not on iPhones.The only real nuisance I've seen is the reminders and ads that appeared on an Android phone, that I could not block. It is tolerable.BEWARE come renewal time. When you setup your Norton account it will likely enable automatic renewal which would be done directly with Norton. Their renewal price may be much higher than purchasing a new license from Amazon. For example, I was offered a renewal price of $89.99 + tax when Amazon was selling it at $24.99 + tax. Yes - the exact same product!There are two options: (1) Call Norton and see if they will price match the renewal. (2) Buy a new license from Amazon. If you buy the new license note the wording in the product description. The new license does NOT add onto your current subscription. So you should activate it shortly before your current subscription ends and reinstall the software with the new activation codes.For either (1) or (2) you probably need to deactivate automatic renewal on the soon-to-expire account. Be prepared - Norton will take you through about five "are you really sure?" screens.So I recommend the product. Just be aware and alert when renewal time arrives.

author: Joe Klobucher
title: VERY VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have had numerous problems with this product since I ordered it a few months ago.  Their Customer Service is so bad it is not tolerable.  I made about 6 calls on one problem went to level 2 twice and it is still not working.  They make numerous commitments (I think just to get rid of you) and have not made a single one of them.  The last one was three hours ago when they said they would have level two get back to me within the hour - it's now 2 1/2 hours and no call.  Last time I waited six hours for a one hour commitment then went to bed-no call missed over night.  I have spent between 3 and 4 hours on line with them.  I am now uninstalling Norton on all five of my devices and installing Mcafee and asking for my money back from Norton but I know that is going to happen.

author: Jazz Guy
title: Norton... if you live outside the US, they want a kidney for this program!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Like many people, I don’t like having to pay triple the price for a product just because I don’t live in the USA. Norton charges $170NZ (approx $125US) for the very same product if you live in New Zealand. I wouldn’t mind so much, but its just a dam Norton download, and the only thing you get from Amazon is the key code. So, in defiance to what I feel is a blatant rip-off (not by Amazon, I mean Norton!), I decided to purchase the US deal, here on Amazon. Of course, when I came to put in my key, it wouldnt work. No real surprise there! I contacted Norton, told them the issue, and asked if I could get a key replacement. I mean come on, its only a dam key… no skin off their nose. The helpline told me that it wasnt the issue, and that they could sort it out if I let them take over my comp remotely. Long story short, this went on and on for nearly two hours. At the end of which, I was told… wait for it… “you have the wrong key. Yours is for a USA product only!!!”A few days of stewing over this, I decided to download the product again, but using my VPN, pointing at Florida! Viola…. it works. Downside is, had to do the same for my MAC and android phone (there’s an app for that.Yes, I know it was my own doing, however, I’ve been a Norton customer for… well, since the 90’s. And I am peed off that they try and rip people off like this, depending on the customers geographic. Things here in NZ are expensive as hell, without companies like Norton trying to dip their bread in our gravy. Next year I’ll be looking at alternatives to Norton. That is, unless they stop being so greedy!

author: Frederick A Caines
title: What you need to do if you have an existing Norton product!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I wasted over an hour trying to figure out how to use my new Norton product key. You can't renew your key by logging into your norton account! you need to log into norton.com/enroll to use your key. You will have to enter your credit card to activate your product and agree to an automatic renewal at $99. However once you get through all this crap you can sign back into your regular account and deactivate automatic renewal. Don't forget or you will pay $99 next year vs 29 from Amazon! If you try to activate your new key through your normal Norton account it will only give you the option to Renew from them. What an obvious deceptive practice of making it difficult to buy elsewhere. This may be my last year with norton! Hope this helps save you some frustration.

author: Cain
title: wait for a great sale I've picked up the Norton for 5 computers ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've been with Norton Antivirus for as long as I can remember. Possibly 23-25 years.I have heard that it causes bloat etc. I've never experience this program.I find it fast at and light. I've tried all the alternatives only to quit them before the year was over andreplace them back to Norton. I haven't switched in years.In all these years and 4 computer. I've never had virus !! coincidence? absolutely not !In the last few years this product have become easier to get with no physical product needed.1: wait for a great sale I've picked up the Norton for 5 computers for under $20.002: purchase it as a downloadable product.3: use the activation code when needed ,Here is how this works:If I purchase Norton via Norton they will charge me around $65.00 more or lessso I ignore the warnings that you Norton is about to expire, etc.because.. I have the Amazon product purchased and just waiting for me toadd the new activation key into my current product.NOW.. don't update your key too quickly OR you will lose any days leftif you have 20 days left on your current Norton and you add a new keyyou will lose those 20 days. .. and now another great thingif you do that and Call Norton they will fix this for you.I simply wait until the last day, add the key and I'm set.great deal, great product !

author: Tricia Bonaiuto
title: Remember to turn off Auto Renew!!!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Great product, but make sure you go into your online account with Norton and turn off Auto Renew!  It always defaults to ON. The Auto Renewal price is ridiculous.  Bought this one for my dad, but have Premium on my computer and Auto Renew just came up for $106 while Amazon sells it for $39.99.  The setting is hidden.  You have to expand the subscription section to see where to turn it off.

author: Train man
title: What I don't like are the many pop-up "hints" and advertisements
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I bought this because it was cheap ($20 for up to five devices per year through Amazon) and I was sick and tired of McAfee's high cost and quirks.  So when McAfee ran out this year, I got the Norton instead to try it out.  It's okay.  Seems to do the job well but has its own quirks, too.  What I don't like are the many pop-up "hints" and advertisements, some even having soundtracks that play when the pop-up opens.  I use my computer to record music and shows a lot, and once in a while these stupid pop-ups advertising some Norton something or another come up with sound tracks to them and ruin my recordings.  I'd give 5 stars if they'd knock off the stupid pop-up ads, especially the ones with sound!

author: Josslynne
title: No thanks, Norton.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This product is supposed to protect 5 devices.  After downloading it to one device, it will not allow installation to a second, third, fourth or fifth device, instead giving the message, "Already Activated: The product key you entered has already been activated."There is no discernible way to contact Norton for support of this issue, unless you pay a fee for support.  I finally resorted to tweeting to them to find a number to call a human being, but was re-routed to the same static FAQs style forum, not a person.  This happened to me when I bought a 10 license program last year and it only let me download to 5, so shame on me for buying Norton again.

author: Between You and Me
title: Have used Norton products for over 20 years, and zero disasters
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've been using Norton products for at least 20 years, and I've always purchased the comprehensive suite because virus protection alone is just not enough for safe browsing online, no matter what anyone tells you. My computers have never had viruses, malware, Trojans, or any other problems. Norton checks your downloads for problems, as well as your emails, and this software includes a firewall, which is like building a virtual wall around your computer.I know that there are free anti-virus and internet security programs out there. But the expense of having a professional try to restore my computer, if it would even be possible, is just not worth taking the chance on a free product. Norton backs up their product with a guarantee. More importantly, Norton backs up their product with years of experience and constantly monitors the Web for new problems, of which there are thousands. Generally I do not allow software or programs to update themselves without my knowledge, but I have Norton set to automatically update the software. I don't want to take a chance on anything attacking my computer. And now we have to worry about our smartphones and tablets, too.I find Norton products easy to set up, to renew, and to understand the control panel of options. I also like that Norton can do quick scans of my hard drive, or intensive scans that scan every item. I am all in favor of saving money. But my computer security will never be an area in which I cut costs. And buying it on Amazon is the best place for the best price.

author: Amazon Customer
title: IF YOU RELY UPON DRAGON & MS WORD PLAYING NICE TOGETHER, DO NOT EVEN THINK ABOUT INTRODUCING THEM TO NORTON
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: As antivirus software the download version of Norton is very good... BUT it installing it has rendered my new Windows 10 laptop incapable of using Dragon Naturally Speaking with the latest version of  MS Word. Installing Norton introduces some software conflict that causes Word to crash while being used with Dragon EVERY time you attempt to save the document, and all data that has been dictated in the session is lost. Dragon & Word worked together flawlessly on this machine up until I installed the Norton software, and then immediately began having this problem. I had been using Dragon version 12.5 and tried upgrading to v. 13 hoping that would solve the problem, but no luck. I have been through every setting of the Norton software attempting to correct this but nothing has worked. I may try uninstalling the Norton software & see if that fixes the problem.  I have used Dragon & Word together for more than 8 years across many versions of both applications and have never encountered anything like this. SO IF YOU RELY UPON DRAGON & MS WORD PLAYING NICE TOGETHER, DO NOT EVEN THINK ABOUT INTRODUCING THEM TO NORTON. Very bad software Karma!

author: uglypony
title: Might be good software, but naggy on Android, and auto renewal is bad, children.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I get antivirus software for piece of mind. This is my second year with Norton. It may be saving me from viruses and other malware or it may in the future. I can't say for sure since nothing has turned up yet, which is fine with me. I can say that Norton, particularly on my Android devices, is incredibly naggy. It scans and scans and scans. I assume they know why. And maybe it should, I don't know. What drove me nuts is the "Norton Clean" portion  on my 32gb phone. In three years I've accumulated @20Gb of storage. But in less than a year, Norton found a total ofover  100Gb of junk files and other cleanable stuff. How did I not max out without it? It supposedly found 1Gb of junk files"  nearly every day.  Then there are other notifications and emails. Nag nag nag. PC, not as much. I recently renewed, but for  PC only.  May go back to Lookout for tab and phone. My bank uses Norton, obviously a much more complex and customized version ( I hope), but I figured thats worth something. One more thing. Like some others I've had; Norton automatically puts you on " auto renewal" then promptly punishes THEIR CUSTOMERS who dare to continue service, by auto billing 2-4 times what you can you can get here. Sick policy.  Turning off auto renewal; they make it sound like you will be cancelling your service with them.  Amazon has very reasonable price, cheap even. So yes, in the end, I did renwew. But I got to tell ya; It was VERY close-  just by an angstrom or two.

author: writerholic
title: They no longer make entering a key code easy at all
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Warning to anyone about to renew with Norton using a key code. They no longer make entering a key code easy at all. When I tried to do it the usual way, it told me to finish on the home page. I had to search the home page for a place to put a product code since it was almost hidden. Long gone are the days when you can find it on the renew page. After I downloaded it, it did not renew. I spent more time attempting all the Help suggestions and still no renew. It said I only had a trial version loaded and to renew now. I came across a note on one of the help pages that said some key codes are invalid and cannot be used. That scared me a lot since I spent the money to buy a key code already.I tried doing the entire process again and still it did not renew. I tried looking for another way to try to load my Amazon Key Code and I stumbled onto one and tried it. The third time looked different so I was hopeful. After this one loaded it said I was updated for another year. I wish I knew where I found that last key code entry page so I could post it here. I think once you download the software and activate your key card you have to do another step that they don't tell you. I was so frazzled at that point that I think I found it entirely on accident, but I believe I had to register it.It's a mess, but I wanted to warn everyone that it is not easy to use a key code anymore. I'm sure Norton wants everyone to buy from them and that is why they are making it harder to use a code from elsewhere. To be fair to Norton, I could have done this during a time when they are changing the site or doing the process differently, maybe they plan on posting clearer instructions for anyone who wishes to use a key code from another company, but I get a feeling that's not the case.As for the software itself, in the past five years I've never had problems with Norton. I always felt protected and secure. It ran in the background silently and did not slow down my computer. It warned me about security issues and blocked a few attacks I received. I will see how this new renewal does this year and edit my review accordingly. Unfortunately, I do not plan on using Norton next year when it expires again. I don't like companies that do not care about their customers and I will be more than happy to go to someone who wants my business and is more honest.

author: OSL
title: Norton Security does what it says, which is protect my Windows computers from viruses. I use it on Windows XP-Windows 8.1
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I first got introduced to Norton, due to my initial Windows computer including a free 30 day subscription of Norton. After subscription  expired, I renewed it. That was a while ago. Ive been purchasing Norton Security since it was called Norton Internet Security (insert current year). I use it on several Windows PCs and notebooks. The operating systems of my computers are Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7, and Windows 8.1. Norton works great on all of them. It doesn't slow down any of my computers. I've never had a Virus on any of my computers. Norton does what it says, which is protect my computers from viruses. I just renewed it Today by punching in my new product key code.To insert product key code into your Norton, simply click on the Norton Security icon on your computer. Click on "Norton Help Center." Look under "Account Information." There should be a link that says "Enter Product Key." Click on "Enter Product Key." Then copy and paste product key from your amazon order history (digital purchases). You will be renewed!Don't renew from Norton unless their deal is lower than Amazon. The best time to purchase Norton is around the Holiday season (4th quarter) and from Amazon. You get the best deal around that time. Plus, with Amazon, and around the Holiday season (4th quarter), you can get their 15 month exclusive version of Norton Security. I didn't get it last year because I waited too late to renew (since I had 3 extra months remaining and didn't need it until now). Now it's unavailable in 15 month version. I'll be sure to get that version Holiday 2018 so I can get three free months.

author: John K. Hayes
title: The software would not install on my XP xomputer
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This is crazy. If you have a Window 7, Windows  8 or a Windows 10 computer, you can get the freebie Security Essentials from Microsoft. It seems to me that you would likely only buy this product if you plan to use it on a XP or Vista computer. I bought this software to use on an XP computer. When I tried to install it, I got an error. The error message told me to call an 800 number for help fixing the problem. I called the number and the gentleman that answered the phone was good to work with. After about an hour, the gentleman told me that for $99.99 they would fix my computer so that this software would run on my computer. Not only did I waste the money on the software, I wasted an hour on the phone. I hung up at that time.

author: Scott
title: Norton makes it difficult to use product code purchased from Amazon.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Product code was delivered from Amazon via email immediately. However it was very difficult to use the now purchased code to update the license on the Norton website. The Norton website kept wanting the user to purchase a new license even though you had already purchased a product code from Amazon. The instructions provided on how to enter the new code did not work. After 25 minutes was able to find link to screen which would allow use of new code.

author: Robert McGee
title: Be careful
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Be very careful ordering this Norton Software from Amazon. I had a bad experience that could have resulted in being scammed or my computer being hacked. After ordering the software I got an email that said it was from Amazon with installation instructions for the software sending me to special Norton site.  Upon entering that site I “fell down a rabbit hole” and ended up talking with a lady who conned me into installing a screen control program and then told me I had a bad computer problem and needed to talk with their technician. I experienced a similar situation a few years ago and became suspicious. The lady said she was a Norton rep. I immediately hung up and scrubbed the screen sharing program and called Norton directly. The hacker called me back for a second try. The nice lady at Norton installed my software and cleaned the computer of all malicious software. Internet posts suggest this can be a problem for both Norton and McAfee. There is another 1 star post here with a similar story. This occurred on 11/28/18.  In the future I will be ordering security software directly from the publisher.

author: xzr1tv
title: Great product - Great price - much better than automatic renewal
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This is a GREAT product.  Every year, I order the 'instant download' of the new subscription code. Installation is a simple as COPY. ..go into product. Click on Help. Click on "Enter Product Key" and then PASTE. But if you can stand the nagging. wait until a day or two before expiration date, to maximize the duration.

author: The Glide
title: Bait and switch? My error? I think I may have been sucked in THIS REVIEW IS ABOUT THE SALE..
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: THIS REVIEW IS ABOUT THE SALE, NOT THE PRODUCT.Norton gets 5-stars across-the-board, but the sale was either bait-and-switch or an error on my part.  Maybe my eyes deceived me, but I think not!I bought this product on a cyber Monday, or black Friday, or something like that, deal.The page I thought I bought it from (picture attached) said it was for 15 months.I installed it, went to my subscription page at Norton.  My subscription is set to expire 12 MONTHS NOT FIFTEEN MONTHS from the date of installation.But who's complaining, right?  At $20 for 5 devices, it's a good deal, just not the one I thought I was going to get.I installed it, and on my subscription page at Norton it only shows 12 months remaining, NOT FIFTEEN.S

author: glenk
title: Giving me problems with Macbook
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I picked up some bug in Safari that redirected my internet to other ad-based websites automatically.  So I purchased and installed this on my Macbook using Safari.  Its scan showed I had no problems, but the redirect persisted.  Also, it's extension ("Norton needs to add the Norton Security Extension to Safari," says the pop up window) was scary.  It warns that it will be able to see passwords, credit card numbers etc.  Maybe this is nothing, but I'm not tech savvy enough to not be anxious about it.I started a chat, as the 24/7 phone number for Norton support disconnected after the automated voice answered every time I called.  In chat, we ran the scan again, nothing detected, again.  Then, the chat helper suggested clearing my computer's history.  That fixed the redirect problem.Now for the final straw, I resumed my online searches, but I got Safari error notice saying Safari couldn't connect to page.  I was trying to go to Yelp.  So I tried several other web addresses--same message.  I've already spent far more time with this software than any other I've ever installed.  It didn't fix my initial problem, and now I have a greater problem.  If I eliminate the Norton Extension, I can once again visit any website.  If I add it, which I'd prefer not to, I cannot connect to multiple safe websites.  And Norton says, "You are not protected on Safari until you install the extension."So I googled the issue and found, I am not alone.  Many believe this is not a good security program for Macs.  I'm tired of dealing with it.

author: Mr. Cynical
title: Excellent price. Cancel auto-renew!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: If you are a current subscriber to Norton, be sure to TURN AUTO RENEW OFF! I forgot to do so and ended up paying full price for another year on top of this discounted license. Customer support used this Amazon key to extend my current subscription.Also, be aware of change to subscription type! My last product renewal cost $112 for 1 year. Customer service downgraded it to Deluxe, and then added the extra 1 year from this key. However I was still paying $112 for 1 year of Deluxe I stead of $35 or even the standard $49.99. I has to explain in several ways that the value is different and that I should receive a refund or another 1 or 2 years of service. After some time, the agent got their manager to refund half. By that time, I was simply glad to get something back and then gave up.Norton has been the only product I personally use, since 1997. I have had others on workstations and servers, and they are always getting in the way. Nothing is more frustrating than  compiling code when Kaspersky or McAffee decide to bog down the storage drive. I would never use anything but these 3 products; I know way too much about cyber security to trust my personal data to anything else.

author: Sharon Russell
title: Would Not Install- crashed my computer
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've been a Norton customer for years, but this "instant download" was very problematic. It crashed my computer SEVEN TIMES. Finally, I went directly to Symantec tech support, and even they couldn't download it. It froze and crashed my computer just like it did when I tried.  UPDATE: Apparently, this file (Version 5.14.0.133) was released less than a week ago and had less than 5 users. That might explain the bugs in the download. In a last chance effort, I went back to the Norton site and, on my TENTH attempt, I was able to successfully downloaded it. Although this was quite an ordeal, it's still better than being gouged by Norton's sneaky Automatic Renewal for twice the price. They've got a good product, but they really ought to stop being so shady.

author: Nachi
title: Geo Restricted "International" Product!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Have been using Norton for almost a decade now. Usually buy the one with multiple devices over past few years. It used to be helpful as it protected my devices and could also share with parents in different geo area. This year onwards Norton has started a geo restriction feature. This product not only has a restriction on installing in US but apparently as per my conversation with their support - You cannot run its Live Update outside US. So basically you are NOT PROTECTED with latest updates while you travel. In this day and age I find it dumb to geo restrict your product! Whatever the sales strategy the execution is inconvenient for clients. DO NOT buy if you travel a lot. Protection is good but thats expected. Geo restriction earns it 2 stars

author: M Clark
title: Great product but marketing needs to be replaced along with their connectivity software.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Nice product - easy to tweak the firewall.  The virus scanner is wonderful, the firewall is easy to work with. Easy access to tech support is a plus!Issues I've had:1. when renewal came up, I got a nag screen almost daily on each of my 4 systems for a month telling me my subscription was running out.  that is about 4 screens almost daily that need to be manually closed.  If you renew through norton, the subscription clock resets to 365 days, not 365 + how many days before your subscription runs out.2. The subscription  on the norton site cost for me (norton 360 to norton security deluxe) was 101.00 dollars.  I purchased the update on Amazon for over 50% less.3.  Occasionally, Norton will bring my systems hard drive resources to 100% used, meaning my system locks up while I am trying to work.  Longest time was over an hour.  Called customer service on this issue.  Very friendly CSR using chat window- gave her access to my computer using a norton service tech tool.  Over an hour later, I gave up - she could not work due to connection dropping every couple minutes.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Best Protection for Computers, Smartphones, Tablets, etc.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: What more can I add -- year after year Norton is rated #1, or very close to it.  It has been protecting mine and my family's computers for probably over two decades; and none have ever shown signs of being infected.  We use it on our smartphones and tablets, as well as on our computers.  And Symantec works hard to keep it that way, providing free 'special updates' when a particular new and virulent virus is found.Something of note -- whenever Symantec produces an update for this product, it is provided at no cost to all current users*, so you can always be running the latest version.(* However, in order to be fully protected you need Symantec's database of viruses, etc., which of course they are constantly updating as new potential threats are found.  In order to receive these updates, you MUST HAVE an active subscription.  You can acquire or update your subscription annually by either purchasing a new copy of the product, or by renewing it directly with Norton.)Lastly, I have often found discounts for Symantec products like this one, sometimes they were bundled with another vendor's product.  This year, I found Amazon.com to have the best prices; and Symantec is producing multi-user offerings, like this one, recognizing that individuals, as well as families, have more 'devices' now needing protection.

author: BananaMcGee
title: I've been pleased with Norton for many years.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have used Norton Internet Security products for years. When we bought our first computer, in the last century, we were offered a free anti-virus product. Shortly thereafter, we got a virus on our computer, so I started looking for something better. I found Norton and we have used their products ever since. There are so many new viruses found every week and I really do not think Norton, or any other product on the market is foolproof. I have used some other versions of Norton, and I was not as pleased. One year I even tried a more deluxe version, and I went back to this basic internet Security. I purchase a new version every year.I prefer to use the download version, and I like ordering through Amazon for several reasons:One is that it is the full licensed version, not a cheap replica and not a used version.Another benefit is that I can re-download it to my computer is I have to do a system restore or if I replace the computer. I think the basic version is allowed to download on five devises now. It used to be three devices and that was enough, but as our family’s internet protection needs have grown so have Norton’s coverage.Also, I don’t have to keep up with a box. My code is stored in my Amazon purchases and I can re-download whenever I need to. One year I purchased directly through Norton and lost my product code and couldn’t find my password to login to Norton’s website. It was not a simple thing to just reset my password, but a real hassle.One year I ordered the wrong product, and Amazon allowed me to change it to the Norton version I wanted. That doesn’t usually happen with any company that you purchase downloaded products through. For me, Amazon makes it a no risk purchase.Finally, and probably the greatest incentive is the cost factor. Amazon sells the same great Norton products at a greatly discounted price.As I said, I don’t think there’s anything perfect in the internet security world, but for many years I have been pleased with Norton and plan to continue to use their product.Norton Security Deluxe - 5 Devices [Download Code]

author: Stacey
title: Save yourself the headache and buy something else!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Wow. I tried installing this on my laptop. It would not let me do it. It turned out that because I had Symantec, I couldn't install Norton unless I uninstalled Symantec. This seemed silly to me since Symantec was free and already on my computer whereas Norton is a yearly subscription. So I said okay forget it. A few weeks later I decided to reinstall windows and when I did that, I lost Symantec. No big deal, I thought. I have Norton. I went to install it and again it wasn't letting me. Every time I would try, I would lose my internet connection. I get a hold of a customer service representative. Of course I can help you with that! She has me install a different version. Tells me no way will this kill the internet connection. Well of course it kills the connection still but you need the internet to finish the install. So she keeps clicking over and over (it didn't break our connection for whatever reason) to finish and it keeps giving the same error. Finally after the 3rd time she clicked it and again, shockingly enough, nothing happened I got fed up and said forget it and ended the call. I would give it 1 star except I was actually able to install it on my cell phone without an issue.

author: Angela L. Davis
title: Norton has been reliable for me
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Ordered Norton because I have always had a great experience with Norton customer service when I have needed it.  This download took a very long time to install this time - not sure why.  My partner did not have the same issue and it may be because I uninstalled the old version first before installing the new version (which you used to have to do with previous versions - last one I purchased was 2014 and then just renewed automatically for 2 year subscription - went for more economical Amazon purchase to renew this time).  My partner left the old version on his PC and it automatically updated with the new updated version install.  I installed Norton Security Deluxe on my PC, (older) Samsung cell phone and (newer) Samsung Tablet-A.  I had to log into my Norton account after installation to have the "full" Norton Security Deluxe features to show up on my cell phone (namely web protection, with is not included with the free Norton Mobile).  Scanning occurs for all devices.  You have to pay extra on the mobile devices for extra protection on unsecure networks (I have not taken advantage of the free 30-day trial yet0.  The scanning drains the battery on my cell phone but it is an older Samsung phone so that may be more of a phone issue.  Overall I have had better experience with Norton over McAfee (have not tried others) for service and protection as well as customer service.

author: Darius
title: If only I had known...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I am a USA citizen living in the Philippines (retired) and bought this software in order to protect my laptop.  After going thru all the hoops to get the the point where I could download it, and waiting the very long time for it to download and install; I received the pop up that the Key amazon gave me was invalid for this region.  Norton does not have the Philippines listed.  I now am faced with the prospect of requesting a refund.

author: Cassandr L. Miller
title: Installation Time was 2 days!!!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This was installed on a new laptop when my 10 year old desktop stopped working. The installation needed a lot of help from online techs the first day and took late morning through most of the evening until my eyes got too tired to work any more. The next day I started at 9 AM and stopped about 1600 but it was not completed. I completed it and checked it out at about 1900.  What I have now is unrecognizable as my computer. A lot of names and functions have been changed and I'm learning a new computer system from top to bottom as well.  I plan to get another security program (on Disk) as soon as possible. I was a Sr. Systems Computer Engineer for more than 40 years specializing in operation of hardware, software, documentation and testing with document creation and/or modification.  I would not recommend this program to my biggest enemy.

author: Aztlan
title: NO virus protection for devices. Only protects computers.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: iPad and phones will NOT be virus protected.Norton will only protect PC's and laptops from viruses.The (5) device is misleading cause all you get from a non pc device protection is if you lost phone or iPad and backs up numbers all of which you can get for free using other apps.I am only using now (1) device out of (5) since I don't need 5 computers yet.Norton has gotten very sloppy on the Norton Vault and they do not update those sites which the vault does NOT fill in password login info right, even after repeated reports.The price keeps going up while the Norton quality goes down. I've used Norton for many years and now it's time to find something else.

author: JR233
title: How I downloaded & Installed this
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I read some issues with some folks downloading via Amazon downloader (which I never liked from way back and don't install it) and others who followed the drop down instructions on the Amazon order. Instead after I purchased the Amazon Security Deluxe download & copied the key code. I then went to Norton Site (where I have an acct already) and logged in. I forgot exactly where along the way it asked for the new product code but when it did I gave it my new purchase code, then to a page which tried to get me into Auto Renew program which I choose "Do this later" since I did not want Auto Renew. Then it took me to the download page of the stub installer which I downloaded. I then ran the downloaded stub (from my downloads folder). The install went off with no problems. It un-installed the 360 and for the most part held my previous 360 settings on the Security Deluxe install when I checked them.This was on Win7 and then later (same key code) on another Win10 computer I also went to Norton sight directly and renewed that device but the Win10 install was a bit less informative along the way but that could be win10 and not Norton. Have two installs and they both gave me the extra day, showing 366 days on subscription.

author: R. F. Busby
title: Norton and I have had a decades-long love/hate relationship
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton and I have had a decades-long love/hate relationship. Anti-virus software is a fact of life. Only an idiot would try to use virtually any form of technology without it (even kitchen and laundry appliances are now vulnerable to computer viruses).For years, Norton provided a stable product with better abilities and features than any other in the industry. Unfortunately, the money-obsessed MBA Morons (redundant) with their short-term focus got hold of the company and it has lurched from one product name and business focus to another with far more concern for "monetizing" (ripping off) their customers than providing a dependable product and corporate culture to back it up at a fair price.There are a couple of new players aggressively moving into the U.S. anti-virus market (at least one pointedly implying that Norton now offshores most of their work and employees) and I hope they bring Norton down from its monopolistic perch.

author: Art
title: Lack of syncing of product codes to my Amazon and Norton accounts.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I downloaded Norton's to three devices no problem.  However, I have two more devices to download to.  Norton's message is saying I have a different account from the one I used to buy on Amazon and is refusing to allow the product key to be used by my account.  And even the other Norton account I use is not allowing me to log in.  Contacted Norton tech, and they did a remote access, trying to send a reset email to my other account.  (S)he said it might take 5 or 6 hours, and it has been about 18 and no reset.  Ninety minutes of contact down the drain. And I will have to contact tech support again. Norton fail! If they were not rated the highest by Consumers Report--no way I would have bought their product. And remember some outfit hacked their source code a couple of years ago. Oxymoron of a cyber-security outfit.

author: Ed W
title: DO NOT renew through Norton
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Have used Norton for years and overall like it but beware of renewing through Norton instead of buying each year. As subscription was ending and since I had it installed on multiple computers, I made mistake of renewing through Norton because it wasn't that much more expensive than a new subscription and updated all computers in one step. When you do that though you are agreeing to an automatic renewal the following year at 3 times the price of just buying through Amazon. And good luck disputing the payment and trying to get your money back. Lots of complaints online about this and how Norton/Symantec manages to continue to get away with this is beyond me. If you're going to use Norton, save yourself the headache and just buy new each year from Amazon.

author: mawruk
title: Money lost. Clearly states "Supported OS: Windows 8 ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Money lost. Clearly states "Supported OS: Windows 8 Windows 7 Windows Vista Windows XP  Mac OS X 10.8 Mountain Lion  Mac OS X 10.7 Lion  Mac OS X 10.6 Snow Leopard". BUT, my OS is 10.6.8, and my mac keeps saying "Safari can't open the file......because no available application can open it." I went to download page and it states this version is for 10.7. Only buy if you are using it for a PC.

author: LFP
title: Norton's for me...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton usually doesn't let me down.  Everyone now and then I get free software from buying a new computer, laptop, etc and I curse the free McAfee or whatever else came with it... so when I'm spending my money... it's Norton.

author: HeWhoReadsALot
title: Very difficult to use.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I uninstalled it after a month. As a computer user of many years I had serious problems configuring this the way I wanted.  If you take the default and alert yourself to anything, it comes up constantly.- The "Safe" icon next to Google search results is very distracting so I turned that off.- It constantly wants to alert me to my media server Plex trying to get access.  No matter what I do I can't seem to keep it going consistently.- Navigation and adding/removing applications to authorize is very cumbersome.- Scans are nice, but never say 100% clean, because it alerts me to "viruses" which are actually popular software applications.  There isn't any way to get it to acknowledge these as OK.And so on.

author: Korbmann
title: For me is the best
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have always used norton with firewall protection and it has worked perfectly but there is something that has only happened to me with this new purchase and is that for some reason, suddenly, it does not let you disable the firewall or the auto protect and the solution of Symantec is Norton Removal Tool and I have had to do it 3 times.I want to clarify that I am using Windows 10 Pro x64 and does not have a month of everything installed, in fact the computer is new and I just bought it three weeks ago and everything works fine except for this "bug" from Norton.For the rest I have no complaints, no computer renteliza, offers excellent protection (I just disinfected the pendrive of a friend), custom settings for each application is easy to do and really works.

author: micah
title: I know better, but i needed help
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: When you renew subscription wait until the last day as product does not add to existing days.  Do a test,  if you get the Norton icon to renew subscription process takes 20 seconds.  If you don't and have to go to Norton setup (as with the second installation).  Find somebody who is willing to help.  I had to go to Symantec to install.  What a joke. Technician asked me a simple question, where did I buy my program?.  When I told him Amazon he requested my permission to install remotely.  I know better, but i needed help, so I allowed him to assist.  In the end he showed me a lot of system failures that prevented installation.  However for lifetime warranty at us$299.00 a technician 3 would fix my system.  Don't fall for this.  I was prepared to do system recovery and waited two days.  By some miracle got the renew window as installed my sons security in 20 seconds.  Did not have to system recovery.  With Microsoft's firewall security, I wonder if he needed additional security support.

author: PICTQ
title: Install only - More in several months
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Installed on 3 machines (2-Win7, and 1-Vista), with different results on each.  1st, beware if you have McAfee2016, because you must be online to uninstall.  McAfee was a train-wreck to uninstall on the Vista, and Norton on-line(faqs) and chat line were both time-eaters as usual.  Eventually wiped back to a checkpoint, and got a 'special' McAfee uninstaller, and it is working nicely. It slowed both Win7 machines, and must conflict with explorer2 on the other as it it actually WORSE than the BSOD of old.  When I r-click on a folder, it goes to never-never land, and does not return.......reboot......usually wth the power switch.  It did tell me it caught some mal-ware, but of course, it's what it may not catch that is the problem.Changed review to 2star because Norton tech help(chat line) is terrible.  They read off a script then tell you to review a FAQ that you already looked at.  Also, quite intrusive on operation

author: loyal customer Bill
title: Renewal from an Amazon purchase went well
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have used Norton for several years.  It seems satisfactory, although some other systems may be as good.  I have noticed, however, that Norton prices are all over the map, and they will hit one with their highest prices if one "auto-renews" from Norton itself.  I bought this version on Amazon to update an expiring subscription, and the reason I am giving it a maximum rating is that the product code went right through, renewing my present Norton.  In past years, it was more difficult.  As long as Norton easily accepts renewal purchases from less expensive 3rd parties, I will stick with Norton.

author: JG526
title: Norton Security
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have been using Norton Security for years and have found it to be an excellent product that is user friendly.  Less than one minute after placing my order on Amazon, I received the Norton product key code.  I already had Norton Security on my devices and just plugged the key code into my current Norton Security and it instantly added the one year.  Quick & easy.My only issue with Norton Security is how it plays with the latest addition of Firefox.  I no longer get the search results safe site "green/gray/red markers" when I do a search from my Yahoo home page search box.  This feature still works properly in Google Chrome.

author: MikenzCO
title: NEW for 2018 in your FACE daily PopUps...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: i have 11 months and three weeks left on my 15 month subscription and the ENORMOUS popups are every day often several times a day. this issue began plaguing me last week. worst for me it totally disrupts my concentration, focus while working. there is no way to disable this other than to uninstall the product.yesterday while working once again front and center one of their sales popups but this time it resulted in me losing time, work (their popups cover 20% of the screen area) i wasn't certain what the last item entered in the string series was so i had to do it all over from scratch. i lost part of the days work let alone the stress,.. but it all comes down to greed imho.a few years ago bitdefender began doing this same type in your face popup ads months before it was time to renew. their product forums were filled with angry long time users that when faced with popups chose to leave in droves. i will be going with another vendor when this subscription runs out, assuming i can tolerate their ads for the next 11 mos.

author: Kate
title: Beware of scam !!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Purchased a product key yesterday and attempted to download the product this evening.  We got a message that said that there was an error in downloading and gave us a number to call for technical support.  We called and connected to a loud call center, the first two people had accents so think we could understand what they asked us, when we asked them to repeat themselves, they hung up. On call #3, the gentlemen asked for a name, then asked if we worked for any government agency. We said no and he proceeded to tell us that he need to connect remotely to our computer to address the problem.  It in no way felt like a legitimate Norton help center. It set off warning bells to both my husband and myself.  Buyer beware. I'm glad I didn't pay more and I will not be trying to use the 4 other licenses in case it is bad software.

author: Chummy
title: Does NOT Secure iOS and Android Devices
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: While the description clearly states, "Norton Security Deluxe secures up to 5 PCs, Macs, iOS & Android devices - Instantly download and receive your activation code to be protected in minutes! This product is 2018 ready!" be aware this product does NOT support iOS or Android devices.  Norton now requires Security Premium at a higher price to secure mobile devices like smartphones and tablets.

author: Sunny
title: NOT GOOD!!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've used Norton for many, many years.  I read the reviews after purchasing and installing (dumb mistake) because I was confident of what I thought I was buying.  You can't trust Norton however.  I have only used Norton with the "backup" feature in years past.  After the installation I tried to see when backup occurred, nothing mentioning backup at all anywhere.  NOT GOOD!!!Trying to install the new Norton when I have a current version with 5 days on my previous version proved not to be so simple, and I do like simple.  Finally went to [...] and entered the product key which then allowed me to install the product.  Then I noticed the 5 days I had on my old version just vanished??  What's up with that?  Norton just stole my 5 days, just like that.Trying to talk with someone with Norton is like trying to talk with the government, except they are in Pakistan or where ever, Mars maybe.My advise, proceed slowly, read everything, don't be in a hurry, read the reviews, especially those with low marks.

author: x_diver
title: Auto-renew is complete crap
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Auto-renew is complete crap.  Their web site just hangs.  I did an online chat with a customer service rep and all he wanted to do was remote into my machine to poke around.  Read that again.  A security firm has customer service people that want you to allow them to remote into your machine to poke around!  Their web site hangs and this is the best that they can come up with.  Given that renewals is a vital function to finances of Norton, you'd think that they'd have a seamless solution.Furthermore, the Microsoft Malicious Software Removal Tool finds things that Norton doesn't.  Give it a try.

author: Ahmed Reda
title: Grate product
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
