body: Grate product.I'm using Norton for many years now and it never disappoint, so I bought the newer version and been using it for long time now.Pros:1- Easy to use.You don't need to be a security specialist to use or understand it.2- Fast.It checks for viruses and security threads on the hole system fast.3- Easy on the hardware.When you running scans or doing something with it your device will still run, so it doesn't use the hole memory or processing power of your device so it won't be accessible like some other programs do.4- Multiple scans available.You can check the system files, the hole system or specific folder or drive.5- Not just antivirus.It's also an internet security program, so it stops security threads and online problems that can harm you.6- Analyst.It analyse files and programs that you download and remove it if it content any harm. Also "File insight" it's a feature that show you haw many users using this product so to help you determine if you want to use the file and if it's safe or not.7- Always protecting you.When the device is idle it runs a system check so your always safe.8- Versatility.You can run it on many devices PC, Laptop or cell phone and you can get buy it ones for all this devices.9- Many more.Many more feature available likeSave for your passwords so you don't need to remember them.Check website on Google search before you enter them.You can get the added backup to backup your important files and never lose them.Cons:I don't think of any problem with it.So I defiantly recommend it.

author: xiwaeo
title: My PC has Norton Antivirus Software.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I am very happy with my Norton Security antivirus software. My PC is running fine (so far). This was an easy transaction, I ordered this Product from Amazon. After payment transaction then the software was downloaded to me via an email. I clicked on link in email and was able to enterproduct key for registration of the Norton software.All of this took less than 30 minutes and upon completion of product key and registration I was able to open app and look over the new line of Norton Security software. Everything is going smoothly, I was able to install on my Apple iPad also. Very happy so far. I would recommend this product to any Amazon shoppers/ consumer.

author: Da' need
title: Beware!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Took many attempts to instAll this product.  Kept getting all sorts of error messages. Did not work on my iPhone either. Then to make matters worse now my laptop won't even turn on. So I replaced the battery thinking that might be the problem/ still not charging or turning on.  I am going to take it over to Best buy to see if they can figure out what is wrong.  This HP laptop is not that old maybe 3 years old.  I will take this Norton product off my computer once I am able to turn it on.  I am on the 2nd replacement battery and will charge overnight.  Hope that it works.  Then see what Best buy techs say!

author: William E.
title: Lame.  Never purchasing Symantec again.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: They now force you to open an account, for a product that you already paid for. In other words, hassle, collecting private information, which is something you should not have to put up with.  And there's no reason they need this information either.  Years ago you bought the software, installed it, used the key that came with it, then that was that.  Now it's all this.  And I had so many issues trying to get this installed for a client because of their online account demand, I just decided that's it, I'm not calling them wasting 40 minutes of my time on hold dealing with an issue that Symantec created, so I'm uninstalling it, returning it, and going with another product.

author: Michael J. Kohler
title: Great Virus software
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I did not use Norton for several years after it become a resource hog. I had used Norton from the early 90's in the days of DOS up through the 2009 period. I got a deal on this from Amazon and decided to try it, I was surprised at how transparent it was. Norton has kept a number of viruses from my computer and has not effected my day to day computing. It has a easy to use interface and lots of choices to adjust for making it personal. I have had it a month and I think it is a keeper!

author: Husker
title: Don't Give Up....Worked Great after Reinstalling.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Don't give up.  After purchasing product I immediately installed Norton Security Deluxe on 2 Windows 10 computers.  The installation on my Windows 10 HP Stream went well and laptop performance after install was excellent.  The installation on my Windows 10 desktop went well but the performance after installation was horrid.  I uninstalled the Norton and reinstalled the antivirus solution I had been using.  Hating the thought that I might have wasted good money on an inferior product I decided to give Norton Security Deluxe one more shot on my desktop computer.  So I uninstalled my existing antivirus and reinstalled Norton Security Deluxe on my desktop computer.  What a relief!  Performance on my desktop was superb after the reinstalling the Norton product.  So don't give up if your performance is poor after the first installation of this Norton product.  Give it another shot...what do you have to lose.

author: Siegfried F Sanders
title: TANSTAAFL - Free is usually not, better to pay and get what you really need
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: After arguing repeatedly with CentryLink about my "free" Norton Anti-Virus, I gave up and bought my own security.  I downloaded that same day, quickly installed on three machines, and in all spent less time restoring my peace of mind than one phone call to CenturyLink.  It has performed well, has warned of questionable sites, and already quarantined some viruses.  Well wort the cost for the peace of mind

author: JK2363
title: Couldn't be happier!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have always used Norton on my computers and very happy with it.  My Norton Security had just expired so I did not renew my subscription at the $80+ Norton price!  This is fabulous and at a great price.  It was easy to download following the instructions given, (do NOT click "renew" within Norton if you have it, but rather choose to enter the new Code that you will receive with this software).  After following the instructions, my existing Norton did indeed update, and showed that I now have "364 days left...." etc.  All of this worked perfectly.  Since this Deluxe version is good for up to 5 devices, I also was able to download Norton to another PC, and that worked fine as well.  As I said, I have used Norton security products for years now, and Norton indeed saved my computer many times from malicious code, and other malware, etc, without slowing down my computer.  I highly recommend Norton over McAfee.  Security software is a MUST if you own a computer, and Norton is the best!

author: john
title: RIP OFF TOTAL
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: slowed down pc, did not find 53 items that were harmful to pc. does nothing don't waste money. Way to go if you want to waste 15 minutes for search to load.  Bought lots stuff from amazon, this by far lets say end of the universe is the worst product, wasted 25 dollars from disabled vet, shame on you.

author: vball4fun
title: Switched from McAfee Total Protection - detected virus McAfee didn't
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have used McAfee Total Protection for years. Decided to do some research this year and ended up going with Norton. We have Windows 10, Windows 7 and Android phones. Install was easy. My experience so far: Norton drains less battery on my Android phone doing daily scans than McAfee and it caught virus and trojans during its initial full scan that apparently McAfee didn't on one of the Windows PC. For that alone, glad I switched.

author: AURELIUS
title: This software wrecked my computer!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: My computer was running fine with mcafee on it but my subscription expired so I thought I'd try norton. I used the mcafee removal software to remove mcafee. Everything worked fine. I installed Norton. Almost immediately I noticed my computer was opperating much slower and freezing at times. I waited a couple of weeks, partly because I din't know if norton was downloading update files, and partly because I just did not have time to deal with it. The computer never got better. It was annoying me so bad I was cursing out loud. I contacted norton, they said they needed to remote access my computer to see what was going on. Their tech poked around my computer for like an hour and a half.  He asked me to see if things were running more smoothly now. They were not. He said that there was nothing else he could do, he recommended I buy Norton Tune-up. So I checked, Norton Tune-up costs an additional $50. I did not want to spend more money when I could get a different antivirus for less!! So I uninstalled Norton, but my computer continued to run slow. The damage was permanent! The only thing I could do was remove windows and reinstall it. I knew the partition Windows was in, so I backed up any important files in that partition, then used "Kill Disk" to erase it. Then I reinstalled windows. Now windows was running right again.... Just to be sure Norton was the problem, I reinstalled it. My computer started freezing up and acting sluggish again. I uninstalled Norton, and this time my computer went back to normal. I bought a new subscription to Mcafee and installed it and everything continued to work properly. I contacted Norton again to let them know about the problem, and see if they would refund me, since I can not use there software. They said they could not.Bottom line, this software wasted $30 and serveral hours of my time. I will never buy another norton product again!

author: Lori C
title: Norton Antivirus also includes a computer tune-up
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Faced with numerous choices of antivirus packages (and having consulted Consumer Reports for advice), we decided to purchase the Norton product.  I have been having problems with my computer recently (randomly slowing down and taking forever to respond to commands) and have tried numerous things trying to diagnose the problem.  For many years, we owned Norton's products especially because they included tune-up functions that had proved very helpful in "cleaning up" our hard drive and increasing the speed and efficiency of our computers.  The other packages currently available may or may not have these capabilities, so we decided to go with the product we knew would deliver that extra function.  Unfortunately, the program has not found the issue with my computer but is nevertheless performing well.

author: Amazon Customer
title: My favorite
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: My favorite protection.  Buying it through Amazon was easy and fast.  I left it in my inbox until I was ready to use.  In my experience with Norton, I've not had any virus issues.  But I do also have Malwarebytes installed on my computer too.  Many recommend against that (two protections) but it makes me comfortable.  I work from home and my computer's safety is crucial.  That said ... I would never use anything other than Norton - it's been wonderful ... and buying from Amazon saved me from surfing for a deal.

author: Mark
title: a good deal. had some problem installing because I am ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: a good deal. had some problem installing because I am an existing customer of norton with active norton account.i need to login to my account first on the laptop/pc and run setup, the setup will allow entering new key #, then it will remove other norton products existing on the same laptop/pc, followed by the purchased product install, followed by window restart. The whole process can take up to 30, 40 minutes, so patience is the virture required.

author: John C. Deshong Jr.
title: Could not install Norton downloaded via Amazon
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I was unable to download the Norton Security Deluxe from Amazon. When it started the download and ask me to enter information, the block would disappear as soon as I touched it with my cursor. I talked to 2 different chat support people at Amazon, but they were unable to help.It is my opinion the problem is not with Norton but is with the Amazon download process.

author: CZ
title: Software works well but pop ups became too annoying for me.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This review is for the mac version. Norton has a several-year history of annoying pop ups that have presented themselves in many flavors. These became so cumbersome for me in the last version that I eventually decided to uninstall and not renew. Previous pop ups would eventually give you the option of "Do not ask me again", but this is not the case anymore at least for installation of the toolbar. There are many reasons why one may choose not to install the toolbar and this is something that should not be forced on the user. It's a pity, because the software works relatively well otherwise. It's time for me to try a different vendor.

author: LE
title: Most annoying of all
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Top rated by Consumer Reports.  Unfortunately, it doesn't seem to offer any intuitive way to get an in-depth look at its scanning logs.  After a scan, I always seem to get 2 "threats" that are "fixed".  What were the threats?  Where did they come from?  Should I be concerned?  Most annoying of all, Norten seems to think that I bought--oh, sorry--rented this software so that they can constantly interrupt my work with adds for their other products.  Once is enough!  Where is the just-say-no button.  Hmm, I wonder if they sell a pop-up blocker to block themselves.  Summary:  according to Consumer Reports, Norten is the best product, overall, for fighting malware, but it is extremely annoying.

author: Fuzzbean
title: Installation cleaned out previously infested laptop!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: My daughter continued to use her newish laptop online after the 30-day or 90-day McAfee anti-virus expired, and wow was it loaded up with ransomware or something. All these junk windows kept popping up rapid fire and I could not even get to the Norton site using the Edge browser. That crap even had the gall to install its own icons on the desktop, and apparently saw me trying to reach Norton and started showing me fake "Norton Assist" pages. Finally I shut the laptop down then restarted and tried again with Chrome and was barely able to log in (to my previously paid account) and download and install this Norton on her machine. Well it took another restart and Norton's Power Eraser to finish the job, but we rescued the laptop from that episode without professional help. My co-worker had the same thing happen at about the same time and ended up taking his somewhere and paying $85 to get it cleaned out. I've got the Norton on 4 computers so far and if my wife gets out her mothballed laptop it will be 5 so we are getting our money's worth out of this even without saving that $85. I've stuck with Norton for a few years now and feel more comfortable with it than McAfee. I will say initial installation did seem less than perfectly streamlined when I bought this this year and it was slightly different from my last year's product; Norton's right hand did not seem to know what the left hand was doing for a bit there... but no big deal. It seems a much better deal to purchase a product key code here on Amazon than to just agree to whatever renewal deal Norton automatically offers you, but that's life.

author: Texas Liz
title: Bad business
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: While I've been pretty loyal to Norton in the past, never again. Twice in the 8 months since I put it on my latest PC, I've been invaded by viruses that required professional removal. This time, after the removal, I uninstalled Norton myself and then purchased another security software. BIG MISTAKE doing it in that order. Let me warn you to not uninstall Norton. Your computer will be frozen, couldn't open anything from my browser to my word processor to my picture manager. Could not open a single thing except the new, other company security software that I had downloaded. I should have allowed the new software to do the uninstall, but I was ignorant & put the cart before the horse. Took the professionals two days to get my PC up and running again. No more Norton for me.

author: inCatnito
title: Norton Security Deluxe - 5 Device [Download..
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Call me old fashioned but I prefer a disk to download a program from, but anyway.  So far all is ok.  They've seemed to have added a count down to keep track of how many licenses you bought.  So on one of the screens Norton tells you how many of the versions you've used compared to the number of devices you have a license for.  If Norton can avoid telling me every month that my trial version has expired, I'll be really impressed.  (I never bought a trial version of Norton, not ever).

author: Dodgerz23
title: I switched back to Norton
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: It's been awhile since i've used norton, it took a moment to adjust to their layout, but after a day i learned it. It's more user friendly and not as much of a resource hog as it used to be. I'm sure there's plenty of other security programs, but i'm older now and i don't have the time to stay up researching each one into superfine details / best for games / best all around. Norton has always been trustworthy highly rated. It's been a few weeks and i'm still very happy with the move back to Norton.

author: SG
title: Absolute best price ( $29.99 ).  I ordered download product Key... Thanks Amazon
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This is the best price I could find anywhere.  I was able to purchase 3 download product keys.It's true that if you still have days remaining on your subscription, adding the product key will cause all additional time to be lost and only 366 days will be added.However, if you call symantec ( log into your norton account, click on support, click on contact us ), then call them...Ask Symantec to MERGE the product key subscriptions...I once had 41 days left, I added 3 subscriptions ( 366 * 3 ) + 41 and now I have 1,138 days left ( they took one day away )...

author: Amazon Customer
title: Works!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I would have given it a "5 star" but it was a little confusing to load.  The title was a little misleading because it said that it would automatically renew, which I thought it would install automatically (which was wrong).  How to install should be made to stand out more.  Otherwise it was easy to install after I finally figured it out.

author: sneezy
title: If no satisfied results then I will expect a refund from Amazon ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Ordered this for 5 computers... previous Norton download was a 10 device 360 that seemed to work as described...Norton (through my account) giving them the code for this item purchased through Amazon. .. is giving me a full circle B.S. scenario strictly by computer (no phone calls yet) as if that would really help either. It appears that Norton wants to continue the previous set up at their new automatic price and disdains any downgrades purchased from Amazon (and their vendors?) Time will tell in another day or so....If no satisfied results then I will expect a refund from Amazon and l kiss Norton off into the sunset...Doesn't even deserve 1 star IMO

author: Santeria
title: Almost Adequate, but not as effective as it once was
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: It is good for what it is at the moment. I have used Norton products since the 90s and a few years ago, I had severe concerns with the "Vault" and these things were never answered. Basically, I wanted to save my information locally, not in the vault, however this is not an option, which I find to be a problem, especially with the downtime of the vault. The vault now is supposed to be the repository of the ID and Password collection, similar to what I now use with KEEPASS. Breaches of the cloud storage areas are now more common, but to shut off an option that was convenient to me, and was, I felt, more secure on a local device or drive, is not the best idea. The rest of Norton's capabilities are quite adequate, but the iOS coverage of the iPad air and Mac air is totally lacking. I have got more quality AV, malware and security with ESET. So, if you are happy with Norton, then go with it, but just realize that there are other products out there that do a better job.

author: Danny Laird
title: Good, but annoying, therefore a trade off!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: So after using this security software for the past several months, I have come to experiencing what some people have complained about.Okay, so the cons are:- Popup promotions of additional services such as Lifelock, and other addons- Some of these popups by Norton / Semantic cannot be disabled, and therefore, it continues to be annoying like once a week.- Sometimes the popups doesnt display correctly and there is no simple way of getting rid of it, therefore, it gets in the way of what you are doing on the computer.- If you are a developer and you have a binary application that utilizes the internet, the security tends to find some way to block the application. That is good, but admin with control of settings, I should be able to add this to exceptions but even after I do, it still gives me problems.I am coming from using Kaspersky, and by far, still Kaspersky is the best experience I have had. It sucks, it’s I have to risk privacy potentially just to have less annoying security!?The Pros are:- It detects malware outside of zipped containers. (Shouldn’t that be a con? I haven’t notice it detecting malware within zip / tar / iso, etc.)- Stays up to dateAnyways, sorry, but even though I was trying to get away from Kaspersky, I also did not want to go to Norton because of my past experience with using it. But if I was able to disable some of the con features included in this Norton suite, then I would say that it is as good as Kaspersky. So if you are looking for a security suite for you computer(s), please keep in mind of these cons before buying. If you think unwanted promotional popups regularly is not annoying to you, then this is the security suite for you. You will still be protected by a good detection system, and that is the important part.

author: wecmg
title: Difficult
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: In past years it was easy to renew my subscription by buying a new product code from Amazon, clicking renew on the Norton app and entering the code..  Seems Norton wants you to auto renew through them and they have made it a very convoluted process to enter a code obtained from another source.  What a pain in the neck!  And, it is just as hard to add other devices onto my 5-device subscription..  For a long time now I have considered going Linux Ubuntu and this has furthered my resolve.  Great work Norton!

author: Jes
title: Good solid program
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I bought this here because it was cheaper than Norton.com where it's made/sold.  I like this program because once you turn off the bloat ware built into it, it simply works in the background doing it's job.  With the ability to put it on 5 devices makes it better because all are consistent with their AV/Internet security protection.  If you've read about all the AV/Internet security products out there they're all getting to be bloatware, so I chose the one where I knew I could turn that off and the product was good.  If you really want to you can stick with MS built in defense systems which I don't trust and yes I do work in IT.

author: Joy K. Noll
title: Not as Good As Advertised
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I put this on my laptop at the advice of someone who was supposed to be "fixing" some problems. After he "fixed" said problems and left, they came back within two weeks. I had to get someone else, so I used a site where you explain what's wrong and get detailed quotes from prospective employees. Every one of them advised me to uninstall Norton because, "it slows your computer down." This, before being hired. The man I chose strongly suggested this again once hired. There were problems, but he was able to fix them remotely.

author: Avid Mystery Reader
title: Highly Recommended - Have used for Years!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have used several different Internet security software packages including McAfee and Kaspersky but I always come back to Norton.  I usually purchase from Amazon because (honestly) I get the best prices for the product.  I have several computers and so this one with the 5 devices is a good value.  I find the software easy to install (most of the time) and certainly easy to keep updated (with automatic downloads).  I also find that the product keeps me safe (at least as safe as one can be) and every month I get a report on all the different "invaders" that the program has protected me from.  I like the vault that keeps my log-in information available to me as well.  The only problem this time (and I am not sure if it was because of my recent update of Windows operating system that caused it) but I could not seem to get this online product to download.  I called Norton and the issue was resolved (but it did take a bit of time on their part).  I have high Internet usage since I teach online so security software is essential.  I think Norton is a bargain and I recommend it highly.

author: Steven K.
title: Easiest and most cost effective way to renew your Norton Subscription
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Chose the digital download option, which allows you to know it is genuine.  Purchased with code ready to use in under 5 minutes for me.  I believe if you have an exactly 5 device subscription and apply the code, the 1 year will add to the existing time you have remaining.Took away 1 star ... In my case, I had an existing 10 device subscription and was only using it on 5 devices.  So I purchased this 5-device subscription instead.  The 1 year overwrote my existing 4 weeks remaining without any real warning.  Had I known, I would have waited to the last day before expiration before applying the new code.

author: Madame President Shay Sharpe
title: For some reason, it was a nuisance to install ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: For some reason, it was a nuisance to install this time. I had to call Norton support, in the middle of the night and have their tech take control of my computer for about an hour, in an attempt to install the product. The tech had to erase all the cookies off my computer and restart the computer about 6 times before she finally got it to work. Since then, I've been receiving non-stop messages saying my computer is at risk even though I keep running the scan. I tried logging into Norton and contacting support again, but online it says I don't have an active Norton product. {Sigh.. I have clearly purchased this item!}  It's exhausting!

author: Chris
title: Don't like how Norton has changed.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I really,really don't like all the add on extensions to your browser and I like using Google search.Nortons replaces your homepage with Ask safe search.My Mother is a senior and really doesn't like technology and change.When I put Norton on her Laptop she was very unhappy that her browsing experience was dramatically changed.I removed it because of that.Do yourself a favor and do the trial before purchasing.I used Norton before and it was not such a change on my browser.

author: Ocean Rich
title: Great for your Desktop and Laptop but not your phone or table...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: It is the number one anti-virus software for me. It has always kept my COMPUTER secure, interception viruses, Trojan Horses.BUT- DON'T DOWNLOAD TO YOUR PHONE IF YOU THINK YOU ARE GETTING VIRUS PROTECTION----YOU ARE NOT! IT JUST BACKS UPYOUR PHONE AND HELPS YOU LOCATE IT IF LOST. VERY MISLEADING!BUT- I will always have it on my laptop and desktop computers.

author: Kontoboy
title: A trusted product that will address all your PC, Laptop, IOS and Android needs in a single, easy to use package.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I'm a long time IT security professional (CISSP) and have used this is the product for years for my personal laptops, computers, phones and tablets.  Works on Android, IOS (iPhone and iPad) , Windows.  The five license package is a bargain and is easy to install from the email link.  You can run the default set-up and pretty much forget about it once it is installed, or tweak a wide array of settings to deal with you personal preferences and needs. Nice features like VPN, email and web browser support and add-ins if you choose to use them.  Integrates well with Windows.  I purchased this from Amazon since it is a trusted source.

author: Fallible Human
title: Very nice!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This is WAAAAY cheaper than buying it directly from Norton. Just keep in mind that you will lose any remaining days you have left if you are upgrading, so be sure to wait until just before it's about to expire. If you already have this and are just renewing, you don't have to install anything. Just click on "renew" at the bottom of your Norton window until you get to the screen that says something like "I have a keycode" and just enter the keycode you got in your email when you bought this.

author: Jackson Bailey
title: This product is pure crap and so is the supposed "customer service".
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I tried using the product and it failed on two different computers using two different platforms. To add insult to injury, Norton utilizes Indian customer service. Anyone who has ever attempted to interface with these people know that you're dealing with individuals who have a toenail's grasp of the English language. Further, they rely on a manual to help them rectify issues. And that's an issue in itself because they don't have greater familiarity with the product. To make matters worse, they always ask if they can get into the customer's computer remotely. Don't let them. I made the mistake years ago of doing that and the rep damaged my computer so badly that I had to buy a new one. No joke! When customers ask for their case to be escalated to a higher level of support, they tell you that they cannot do it unless you allow them into your computer. B.S.

author: markb
title: I am very pleased. Norton no longer hogs resources like it did ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Returned to Norton 4 years ago after being with AVG for 10 years. I had originally left Norton because in slowed down my PC. After returning, I am very pleased. Norton no longer hogs resources like it did in years past. It is robust in it's protection. The tools to free up resources and delete hidden temp files is very helpful. I feel much safer in the hands of Norton than I did with AVG. Glad to be back.

author: Vivien
title: I will not be ordering this item anymore. Time ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I will not be ordering this item anymore.  Time and time again I end up finding out that there is an error which means either I have to restart my pc which does nothing for the Norton by the way so that it works again.  Usually I end up deleting and reinstalling which takes time that I don't normally have.  What worries me the most though is not knowing when it stops working which means viruses can get into the pc which is by far more expensive than a pc.

author: Al Gosztyla
title: Works great for my devices
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton has been providing protection for my devices for many years.  I have a great deal of confidence in the Norton product.

author: DaisyMae
title: Some confusion with this purchase
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I had a message after 30 days that my subscription needed to be renewed and had expired.  Not sure what happened because when I logged into my Norton account, the account showed that it expired in a Year from date of purchase.  So I'm changing my negative review to positive as I am now able to update my computer and extend my subscription without additional cost to me.  Hopefully it was just a glitch.

author: Tanner
title: After reading reviews of various antivirus and security products in ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: After reading reviews of various antivirus and security products in PC Magazine and elsewhere, I decided to continue using Norton Security. It performs at least as well as other security leaders and what clenched for me is that it outperforms most others in terms of firewall capability. That is a key aspect once you are sure your files are infection free. I team it with real time (premium) Malwarebytes protection and based upon my research and past experience with these products, I think this layered combo is hard to beat.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Coverage is only for 361 days -- not for 1 year as advertised
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Although the product photo says that this is a 1-year subscription to Norton Security Deluxe, when I installed the license key on my two computers, I received a message on each stating that I now have 361 days of coverage.  I already lost the 5 days remaining in my previous subscription because, as it warns, it does not add the new subscription period to any existing days.  However, I do not understand why the new period is not for 365 days -- which is 1 year in my understanding.  I'm sorry that I could not get back to this screen to take a screenshot and upload to this review.  But I did see this message when I installed it on each computer.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not easy to install
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Not easy to install ... 25 digit alphanumeric password and then a clunky interface.  So clunky my wife cried fu__ _t and gave up installing it on her cell phone.  It took me most of an hour to install it on my laptop, but the learning curve slopes down.  Second laptop was 45 minutes, and third no more than half an hour. It seems to do its job well enough, and for five devices (if you can install it) the price is right.Norton should do more to facilitate installation, and they should offer plenty of free telephone install help.But I have voiced similar complaints about Norton products for years.  At least now they don't offer money back coupons that required so many steps that every other year they denied my refund claim ... despite the presence of the bar code from the original package.Norton's better than nothing, and reasonably priced if you can figure out their Byzantine instructions.And I have no clue as to who might be better.  McAfee tries to upsell you and makes uninstall difficult.  Only time I've been hacked I thought Kaspersky had my back.This must read like a Russian novel ... there is so much sadness here, as in life on the internet.  Good luck!

author: Exgolfer
title: challenges  with Mac High Sierra and be careful as getting any refund if it doesn't work is likely impossible.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I am updating my post as Norton help chat was able to fix my problem but what a pain.  their site kept indicating that my version of Mac OS was not supported and to use it on another device.  it took over 90 minutes for their tech to fix on their chat line taking over my laptop remotely and manually doing the install.  it works fine now but I still wonder about the amount of hassle to use this software with Mac High Sierra.  no longer pursuing a refund but also note that it is damn near impossible to get a refund on software purchased from Norton through amazon.  Amazon doesn't offer the choice of getting a refund and Amazon and Norton says they cannot entertain refunds on software sold on Amazon.  Shame on both of them.  Robbed over three hours of my Sunday trying to get it to work, then trying to get a refund and then endless time with the service tech from Norton.  hard to call this experience deluxe.

author: Howard Carson
title: What a hassle!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've used Norton for maybe 20+ years so I hate to change.  On the minus side, it just seems to use so much of my CPU and Disc resource.  But putting that aside, if I started with a five star rating, I'd subtract 1 star because every year I have to Google how to get my license -- I can't figure it out from the main screen.  And then, if I try to purchase a license from Symantec at a discount, it signs me up for annual renewal at a rather high price.  So deduct another star for that.  So 3 stars because it aggravates me so.

author: Lisa S
title: Easy to install
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Easy to install, everything worked fine and gave clear instructions.  I had no issue with any codes or anything like that.  It uninstalled my old norton 360 and had this up and going in less than 20 minutes.  So far it is working exactly the same as all my previous versions/years of owning and using Norton antivirus protection.

author: Stephen C. Holtzman
title: Great Support, Great Product, Great Protection
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have been using Norton on my Mac for many years. When I had to renew I purchased this package and installed it but came across a major issue, I could not activate the code, always an error. I called Norton Customer Service and they remotely accessed my Mac and worked on it for over six hours and finally had it working. I watched the process and was amazed at what they were doing and what I learnt at the same time. I am very impressed with the service I just received from them upon renewal.As for the security, over the years I worked with many multinational companies and was surprised at how many virus's they had on their systems and how many the Mac caught! I had to inform the PC Techs at these companies that their systems were infested. I will never doubt the effectiveness of the Norton product and very pleased to have it installed on my systems.

author: Chris V.
title: Norton Makes it Almost Impossible to Figure Out How to Renew with Product Key
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Product is fine but shame on Norton for making it almost impossible to find the place to enter a product key to renew your subscription.  Norton wants to increase profits by getting you to renew directly through them because (1) the price is higher on their site, (2) they keep all the money instead of sharing it with Amazon.  If you try to renew your subscription using a product key used here by clicking on "renew" you just keep landing at the Norton Store where you can buy a renewal from them.  They have removed "I have a Key" or any mention of product keys from that place.  The instructions here are Amazon no longer correct.  You have to go into the "help" on your Norton product and look in the lower right corner for "Enter Product Key".  Ridiculously hard to find.  Had to find the answer on a product forum.  As for the protection, I've never had any problems or issues.  Product updates regularly and seems to provide solid protection but I'll leave it to computer experts to assess the quality of protection.

author: HT Guy
title: Yes, it works BUT
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have used Nortons for lots of years.  Wish they had not removed the back up software from this version of Norton Security.  Does an excellent job but is hard to set to scan external HD.  It also will not remove a nuisance virus that came out over 6 months ago.  I had expected better.

author: IT guy in Lakeside
title: What a GREAT deal !
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: What a GREAT deal !This was an Amazon Deal of the Day for $19.99 - 5 PC , Half the price I paid to renew last year !  Plus, I really like the Identity Safe Password Vault. Very convenient.  As an IT guy, I use this to protect my home computers. Mostly unobtrusive, and it doesn't bog down the processors. I highly recommend this.  If you currently have Norton on your machines, wait till the last day of the license till you renew with this. Norton starts the 1 year licensing period when you activate the license.  If you activate early, you lose that time, Norton does not add it on the new license period.

author: Jay
title: No Protection from Ransomware
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton increased licenses from 3 to 5 whereby I don't need 5 licenses.  I just need two.  However, the product no longer protects against ransomware.  Norton is trying to intentionally make customers upgrade to the more expensive product.  Terrible client service.  Why even offer an internet security package without Ransomware.  This will be last year using Norton.  What a bait and switch.  I am terribly disappointed.

author: Jed B. Zimmerman
title: I liked it better when you could download directly from Amazon
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I liked it better when you could download directly from Amazon. For this product you have to download directly from Norton and they want you to agree to automatic renewal with an active credit card. Also, I do not believe that any new software was added, just an extension of the old.The bottom line the price was cheap and the service continues.Thank you amazon.

author: Oregon Wolf Pack
title: Easy to install.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: After uninstalling Norton's I would get popups from Norton's. Oh wait, I uninstalled it? After spending 2 days hunting for all files left after uninstalling!!!, I'm still waiting for another message from Norton's???  Would not transfer my passwords but assumed it could take control of the rest of MY computer. Hope I have Norton's out of my life. Getting a refund, despite their 100% guarantee satisfaction, didn't work either.

author: Idaho Customer
title: Norton IS installation is extremely frustrating
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton IS install is very poorly done.  I like the product itself, but when you try to do the install, it tells you to do something and the link they say to click on is not there, or they try to get money out of you after you have purchased the product already. I finally went into a chat session and the guy was able to renew my NIS, after 30 minutes.Then, when I tried to install the product on my iphone8, they again tried to get me to pay.  I finally deleted the app off my iphone8.

author: ShopperAR
title: It was more of a resource drain than I liked but still a good product for protection
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I hadn't used Norton since 2005. It was more of a resource drain than I liked but still a good product for protection. Fast forward to 2013 and I went back to it. PC hardware has caught up. Fast present day quad core cpus versus 2005's hyperthreading, and Norton is far more optimized, at least that is my take on it. Runs smooth with no issues. Customer support from what little I have had use for is fast and helpful. Most security software packages leap frog each every year or two and testing labs have varying methods so it's really hard to tell exactly which product may offer you the best protection. This one lives up to expectations so far. Recommended product.

author: Antony Steele
title: Impressive Internet Security Software and Utilities.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have been impressed with Norton Security over the past few versions, or since around 2010. It is a lot different than the awful Software they had in the late Nineties. As a current user, I saw this on Sale here on Amazon for a great price, and so I purchased the License to use when my current subscription ends. I hope it goes without saying that whether you intend to use Norton, or some other Internet Security Software, (McAfee, Kaspersky, Trend Micro, etc.) that it is very critical in today's Internet that you do use security/anti virus software to help protect your computer. The current Norton Security Deluxe is quite powerful, and has stopped websites that hijack your computer in it's tracks. It also has some great tools to help keep your computer running well and up to date with the malware/virus/bad website definitions. Well worth it.

author: Miguel150
title: Norton Security Deluxe (2017) for 5 Devices is the best Internet Protection that I have found and use
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton Security Deluxe (2017) for 5 Devices is the best Internet Protection that I have found and use.  Plus, Amazon.com gives you the best price for it.  If you already have Norton in your computer, once you purchase it (choose the download now option), open your Norton program, click on "Renew" and just enter the new Norton Product Key, and you'll be updated. But, be sure to wait until your Norton license expires before renewing it so that you won't lose any of your remaining days from your old Norton license.

author: Paul E.
title: Still the best!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: As Norton has always been, this is great security software. I've been using Norton products since before Symantec bought the company (when Peter Norton still owned it), and I love their products and would not use anything else. One of the absolute best things about Norton Security is it's spam tagging. I've found it to be at least 99.99999999999999999999% accurate (I think I may have lost one or possibly two legit e-mails in the more than ten years I've been using it). It absolutely amazing. I just set a filter for the "tag" it puts in the subject line, and ALL my hundreds of span per day go directly into the trash folder. The only thing that would make this software better, is if it automatically emptied my trash folder, too.

author: Buckaroo
title: I used to like Norton. Things have changed.......
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton has worked well for me for along time.This was a good deal for 5 licenses.UPDATE: Norton no longer protects that well.Its OK. But the changes they have made in their marketing, are annoying.Support is terrible.They always want to control my machine remotely to fix problems.I am talking to a person in another country, who I do not know.It would be dumb to give a stranger access to my computer.So, the one time they emailed my the "solution" to fix my problem, it did not work, nor make sense.I'm a tech, I can fix computers. Their support is TERRIBLE and useless.Its a shame, I've been using it for many years. I don't think I will continue with them...….

author: Pat
title: Norton is "Region" locked. I am US Service Member ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton is "Region" locked. I am US Service Member living outside the US on a US Base with a US address, but I cannot activate my product because my IP address is of another country. I addressed my concern to Norton, who only offered the help of pointing me back in Amazon's direction. I understand this is a digital product so its harder to return, but I will be asking Amazon for a refund. Its my first time trying tocome back to Norton after a 10 year hiatus (before that I and my family were loyal customers). Will not be returning after this incident, considering my job is global, and Norton is region locking their products.

author: The Admiral
title: Painless and brainless install for a great product!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: We've been using Norton for many years and it has always done exactly what it says it will do.  So this purchase of the 5-device Norton Security was a no brainer for us after I bought a new computer.  We are keeping the current subscriptions we have for my old PC and her laptop but this was a really good deal since it is covers both of our cell phones and her tablet (still need to find two more devices...).  Can't beat that.  The install on every device was truly painless and brainless.

author: Cocozelle
title: Good Anti-Virus software at a competitive price
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This Norton product seems to work well enough, and updates are easy. A full, comprehensive scan needs an online connection to run, and on my new desktop running Windows 10, takes almost 2 hours to finish the scan. A quick scan can run offline, and takes about 10 minutes to finish.This was an Amazon Special, and was supposed to come with a "15 month" coverage, but when I installed it, I found out that it would only last for 12 months, instead of the advertised 15 months.

author: C. Mackie
title: Best Anti-virus application out there
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I am an IT consultant with over 25 years experience.  I recommend this to all my home and small-business clients.  Some "computer experts" will claim that it takes up a lot of resources, or that it is not as good as other anti-virus/security products.  Neither is true.  I benchmarked my own computer both before and after installing Norton Security Deluxe, and saw NO appreciable difference in performance.As for the "not as good as other products," I can't tell you how many times I have seen problems with other anti-virus applications, especially the free ones.  I have only seen one situation where Norton had a problem - for some reason, it locked down access to shared files from the local computers.  And that was an easy fix.

author: Canasanafranasan
title: PICNIC
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Every year every product changes name and type, so go get the free trial of this version on Symantec site, if you never had Norton (or use a different email or sign in) (you get one free month trial) it will automatically download and install and remove old version, then sign in. With our phones, we merely needed to sign into Norton and voila, it extended. Id imagine the other pc's will have to do the same, download free trial and sign in and done......So buggy as heck to rid of the old and in with the new (thanks Norton for being so difficult and different endeavor every season/ learn from comment, no defensive replies please) but otherwise, good ole tried and true Norton.....ps-remember, antivirus is only as good as the user (PICNIC)

author: Arnieman
title: Good, thorough, and easy to use program.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Used the program for years, and found it accurate, thorough, and both easy and intuitive to use.  Installation, however, is both cumbersome and confusing.  Perhaps if you buy the program directly from Norton and use its help to do the installation it would be easy, but if you buy it from a third party reseller be prepared for some difficulty.  On the bright side Norton's customer service is very good.

author: Jack B
title: This is an excellent anti-virus program!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: You always hear a lot about new viruses that are developed and infecting computers. I spend a lot of time in my business collecting information from the internet. So far I've had no issue with viruses due to the effectiveness of this Norton product. I have purchased this product many times over the past 10 years and have never had an issue with virus infection. I will continue to purchase this product based on its past performance.

author: William K. Cunningham
title: Install Triggered an Error Code
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: When I wrote the product code to install this product, Symantec wrote that they accepted it, but could not install it as it was code containing letters they didn't use anymore.  I'm sure that I can find a way to install it with their help, but this shouldn't have happened.  I need to install it on two computers, but will not be able to install on my tablet or phone.

author: bigjon
title: Excellent product
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have used Norton or over 20 years.  Just installed the latest version on two PC's.  You need to un'install the  old version first, then download and install the new version. Should take 1/2 to 1 hr depending on the speed of your connection and your computer speed. Everything installed fine and is working perfectly. If you are not computer literate, get help.

author: James L.
title: Still the Greatest
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have used Norton for many years and I always shop around for the best deal before I renew annually.  Purchasing through Amazon was easy and the most economical.  The product downloaded instantly after purchased with no issues.

author: Robert G.
title: Great Security software for you and your family.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I can't ask for much better than this for the price I received it at. I was able to install it on my computer and some family members as well with the 5 available devices. It takes care of all of my computer security needs with an attractive, easy to navigate, control panel. It offers some extras like the Norton Security Toolbar for your internet browser. That browser plug in is bloatware for some, but for most who would like that added level of security while browsing the internet, it's a nice added feature.I personally don't use the "Performance" aspect of this software. I do have this software installed on my parents computer though and it helps them maintain most basic performance issues without having to download more software.

author: Hoosier Eagle
title: Great virus scanner, very bad subscription management scheme for multiple devices
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I had no problem downloading and installing the application on one device immediately following my purchase. Good luck installing the application on subsequent devices! The process is needlessly confusing and frustrating. I will not be using Norton products again in the future. It is hard to believe that Norton has not deliberately made the process for installing the application on multiple devices difficult.

author: jchadwickh
title: Annoying pop-ups to install browser extensions that slow everything down, and spam emails.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This product, once installed, will keep throwing security pop-ups to install Norton browser extensions.  They will not go away.  These browser extensions do nothing but slow your system down.  I will be looking for another vendor when my subscription runs out.--Update - spam emails from Norton.  I didn't pay for an anti-virus subscription to get spam emails!

author: Gorgehiker
title: Protect Me Norton!!!!!!!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I am a bit surprised that this doesn't seem to slow down surfing at all.  Most other programs for security have had noticeable issues with slowdowns.  It was a bit of a hassle getting this version installed over the previous year as I went from a 10 user factor to this 5 year item.... Tech support got me going pretty quick once I contacted them so it wasn't a big issue... just a hassle.  I'd buy this gem again.........

author: Geomancer
title: Works without issue
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I know Norton is popular to hate on, being as its one of the oldest and most popular anti-virus programs out there.All I have to say is, for the most part the program works without me even having to worry about it being there. My only real negative is on occasion it will throw up a popup message. Most eventually (after you dismiss it a couple times) give an option to never show it again. When you get close to renewal time though, it nags you daily.That aside, it doesn't interfere with anything I do including playing games. That's all I really want in an anti-virus program.

author: Mikeyman
title: I regret buying this product.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I ordered this and when I went to download this and put my product key, I've got an error saying that key has been redeemed successfully but set up could not be started and suggested to call a certain number. I tried the number but the menu keeps repeating itself: press 1 for this, press 2 for that etc. etc. after more than half an hour of attempts to get in touch with someone I gave up. To me Customer Service is horrible. I am really frustrated and I wish I can get my money back and buy a disk with the software that I can rely on. This is very frustrating...

author: AngelaNewLife
title: Windows 10 s will not allow me to use Norton Antivirus
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I clicked on the deal of the day laptop for $199 and your system said hey people that buy this laptop also buy this Norton Antivirus...I said oh yeah I should get that too I'll need virus protection....well the laptop has windows 10 s and will not allow Norton to run on it or anything else besides what it comes with.  It already has windows defender too.....I feel a little bummed that this happened.  Norton anti virus works great I've used it before...I like the laptop anyway since I only need it for a certain project.

author: lkirwin
title: I've been using Norton for years!  Very simple to install and NO it is not automatically renewed if you press "Skip this step!"
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have been using Norton for more years then I can remember. I have never had any problem with any computer using it. It catches, fixes and alerts you to any security issues.  This was very easy to use.  I already had 360 installed on all our laptops.  All I had to do was hit "renew subscription" then enter in the key code.  From [...] I logged in using my other devices,  and added it on them.  Very simple and easy to use.  It automatically uninstalled the old version and added the new.  Some people in the reviews said it was "automatic renewal"...all you have to do is press "Skip this step"...very simple! They obviously did not click that, because NO credit card is required!  This was very simple and easy to use and works great on Windows 10!

author: Mystery Reader Fan
title: Product support is HORRIBLE
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I made a mistake in buying this product. I wanted to buy Norton 360 Security Deluxe. I admit that I had a lot of problems which ere probably my fault, but the product support is HORRIBLE. They said that they cannot up grade me. I would have to just buy the other product without a credit for my purchase. After being on hold for technical support for over an hour I just hung up. I then talked to someone again and she said that someone will call me in an hour or two. They did not call me back. I will not do business with them again.

author: ChippyTheChipmunk
title: I cannot recommend this product enough
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I'm really liking the 5 devices and the new version. Plus, when the download went on sale for around twenty, Amazon was kind enough to credit me the difference - basically to price match, if you will. These days, you'd be very foolish not to have some kind of virus protection on your PC - and Norton has been around a looooong time - so I trust them to keep my machines running virus free. I cannot recommend this product enough. If you renew early and lose a few days, just do an online chat and the rep will add those lost days back to your tally. IMO, look no further... Norton is the best. I would, however, compare prices on e bay - as they've been known to have software prices much lower than their Amazonian counterparts... just be careful to choose a reputable seller with 100% rating - or as close as you can get... and don't be afraid to get the download version... I've been using download codes for several years and it has never once failed me...5 STARS!!!

author: J. Baroni
title: Great Product EZ upgrade
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have been a Norton customer through most of their history. They were not always the best and rightfully gained a reputation as a resource hog and complicated user interface. That was around ten years ago. Since they continually receive "best of" and "editor choice" awards I went back to them years ago and have never regretted it. I had 2015 360 installed and had no problem renewing through the Amazon process. I have had a Norton account set up for decades and it is through them that you update. Once you have purchased and added your download version to your Amazon software library you simple click on the link "how to redeem this product" which gives you a link to Norton and lists the few steps required. Norton takes over from there and recolonizes your current version and removes it. Yes you have to be patient and let it work and respond to a few prompts and reboot once but it is simple and straight forward process that may take fifteen minutes max. Don't forget to run live update a couple or three times after the install says it is finished. I had sixteen updates and a patch then one more update. In the past I always found it cheapest to buy my Internet Security when I purchased my income tax software because invariably there were rebate offers that essentially made it free after jumping through all the hoops. Cost of printing and postage and sales tax excluded. All that required was inserting the new product key. Tried inserting the product key from my Amazon purchase this time but that didn't fly.

author: R
title: Excellent price to renew
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Excellent price to renew. I had a previous Internet Security product installed, and a subscription renewal would have cost $53. Buying the Deluxe product through Norton was $38, therefore at $19 this was an excellent price to extend my subscription and get an updated product. I've used Norton for about 18 years and have never experienced any problems. As other customers have reported, if you already have a previous product installed, just enter the product key. Any remaining days in the old subscription will be lost, but if you contact Norton customer service they should add those days. I am really satisfied with my purchase, definitively my best Black Friday deal this year!

author: Maxine Wood

types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I Purchased this software to install on my PC, Kindle Fire (2) and Android phones (2); down load to PC was easy. Software wouldn't download to Kindle Fire devices, that's when I learned that Kindle Fire won't run this software, I was told by Kindle Support person that it wasn't needed because of the built in "protection" on the Kindle Fire devices. Next, tried to download to Android phones, wouldn't work on either device, called Norton Support, CSR spoke very poor English, tried to follow his directions to no avail. Still haven't been able to download software on either Android device, now over 30 days since I purchased the software!

(2061)i have been using norton since 2010 but this is the first time this has happened to me in the region i'm in. please explain how to resolve this

title: poor, then good customer service

body: This system would not download. I had all McAfee elements removed. author: jbanjo
title: FEEL SAFE ON THE INTER NET

body: Super easy using the download version.  And the best price I could find anywhere.  I have been using Norton products for many years now and I have never had any problems. If you want to keep your computer safe and not have to worry then don't hesitate to buy this product!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great Service But Price Could Be Less
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have always been a fan of Norton and have used it for many years. I am honestly amazed at how prices have changed. I used to get the highest protection from Norton for only $20 on a disk and now I need to pay about $50 for an online link which doesn't have everything Norton 360 had. I don't know if I will change to something else but I would say that for this purchase I had a pretty good experience. The links worked pretty well, but I'm disappointed because I only have 3 computers so I didn't use the other 2 which is a waste. I do like that I have it saved on my amazon account if I ever need to download it on something else. I want to say I will definitely buy again if the price goes down or if I can't find anything better.

author: Disregardless
title: Faster than flushing a toilet!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Pretty sweet!  I had a previously installed version of Norton Deluxe on my machine and it was expiring.  I bought the key code and received it electronically.  Then I went to Norton Deluxe on my pc, hit help, hit "Enter Product Key", did as instructed and et voila, back in bidness.  All done in less time than flushing an Australian toilet (wait, what?) -- terrible analogy but you get the picture.  No muss, no fuss; good for another year.

author: LMG
title: Wow, great price for a great product
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I had used Norton Internet Security for many years and decided to try the 360 last year which was okay but expensive. I didn't want to spend as much again this year and was happy to find this 5-device Security Deluxe on Amazon for twenty bucks, and since it is pretty much the same as the Internet Security I used to use I jumped on it.  I love it for our computers but was disappointed to discover that it does not provide the same for your cell phone and/or tablets so keep that in mind.

author: Kim St. George
title: Amazon - Unclear download instructions
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: The product is fine - I would give it 5 stars.  The Amazon purchase experience was terrible - zero stars.  It was not clear on how I get the 'download' once purchased.  It led me to believe that I needed 'Amazon Assistant' on my Firefox - so I put it on.  Then it lead me to believe that I needed 'Amazon Games and Software Assistant', so I put it on.  Finally in the fine print I found that neither of these were needed.  The download is not done through Amazon but a Norton account must be set up and it is downloaded from there.  It then took me time to research how to remove 'Amazon Assistant' and 'Amazon Games and Software Assistant.BAD JOB AMAZON - I don't like unneeded software on my computer

author: Mark
title: Don't buy this expecting to install it on a US ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Don't buy this expecting to install it on a US computer that happens to be in use on a trip abroad.  Norton blocks the install abroad and product license is void outside the USA.  Their customer support response on this matter was "buy another single use license" when I just paid for one.  Shame on them and typical of how business policies aren't about what's fair for the customer.

author: P.F.
title: What's not to like...Nortons is a top rated security program
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have been using Nortons for years and it has done its job.  I routinely surf the web and occasionally I have gotten a warning from Nortons that either the site was dangerous or that I had some form of virus or other malware and it has routinely taken care of it.  Also it checks downloads for safety.  I have no issue and nothing but good things to say about my experience.

author: L. Smith
title: Not Compatible with iOS
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: The product advertising is completely false.  Norton does not work with iOS products, it will not allow you to download or activate.  When I contacted their customer service this is the response I got: "Scan/AntiVirus feature is not compatible with iOS devices...."I was astonished since the first sentence of Norton's product description is "Norton Security Deluxe secures up to 5 PCs, Macs, iOS & Android devices...."

author: D.N.
title: Better than most.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Became sick and tired of the so-called "anti-virus" software available. Some even have their own product specific "Pop-Ups". Really annoying and they wanted to use a lot of the system resources. Just like bloat ware. Tried this out of frustration and found out that it operates nicely in the background, no pop-ups or frustration. Still uses more system resources than I like but less than so many others. So far, so good.

author: Buzz Saw Murphy
title: Great Price, Secure and Easy to Deploy...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have always preferred Norton over other software brands. I like this version because of the multiple devices. I just switched over to an android phone and wanted to ensure the security of my device. Norton protects me and my devices from malware, and viruses, as well as fishing attempts.I bought this from amazon even though it was priced $5 less at my local Staples. I went with the amazon version because I didn't have to deal with the mail-in rebate, and with it being a digital download, I was able to access the software quickly, vice waiting for something to show up in the mail.

author: Taylor A.
title: Smooth as Silk Purchase
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Smooth as silk purchase. Just took e-mailed product key sent by Amazon and cut and pasted and renewed old subscription. Elapsed time from purchase till e-mail receipt with product key and renewal, three minutes. Even Norton support recommended purchasing this way to save money. Three days left on my previous Norton subscription were added but I don't guarantee it because people on these boards say otherwise. In previous years I've had to contact Norton to get unused days added back.

author: Joanna D.
title: 5 devices is skimpy, buy the Premium version
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This is the latest revision of Norton Security. I've used several others including McAfee and Trend Micro but I think I'm standardizing on this brand out of familiarity. The Deluxe version handles 5 devices. I'd really suggest you use the Norton Security Premium - 10 Devices [Download Code] because you can fill up 5 devices quickly (desktop, laptop, your spouse's--there's three or four, kids....) and it has a few more features for not a whole lot more. In retrospect, I should have bought that one but Norton can be confusing to buy. I should knock off a star for that confusion, but over all, I can recommend this software. As it is, I've rated it four stars because really, the Premium is the one I should have bought for a few bucks more. If you cover your phones and your tablets, you'll need 10 device capacity, no doubt about it.I also should knock a star off for installation: I broke a regular rule of mine--de-install before installing new, but I followed the on-screen directions and it didn't say to do that. However, as I was upgrading from the 2015 and a different version (I had premium before, see how confused I got?) I should have de-installed. To upgrade from 2015 to 2016 SAME product (ie deluxe to deluxe or premium to premium) you don't need to de-install. It's hard to remember what you did previously and the words "deluxe" and "premium" are easy to confuse.So I had to chat with the tech support when my install ground to a halt. I couldn't proceed. Something seemed wrong--and it was. The chat person (possibly out of Palo Alto) was absolutely marvelous. We stepped through the re-installation after de-install by having her do remote-PC and at several points, watching the chat for when you have to re-enter your password (encrypted) because the tech can't do that, nor should they. It did take the 45 minutes she told me it would, and afterwards, my install was perfect--because it was handled by Norton. I give five stars to the tech support chat and no stars to the installation protocol, which should have checked for previous versions and suggested de-installation.I did feel kind of stupid, but then last week, I did a flawless hardware malfunction diagnosis and repair on my same laptop so I guess "D'oh!" and "Woo-hoo!" canceled each other out.Bottom line: Unless you have to save that six bucks, buy the Premium. You will be happier. Check previous versions of anti-virus. If it isn't the same product, de-install the old product before installing this one. I actually believe that would apply to competing software as well.

author: Evan rv
title: be aware
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I am happy with the Norton product.  I downloaded this product and when I went to install it I got an error message and a phone number to call.  The party claimed I had a Trojan and the only way to install the Norton was to purchase a 5 year Norton for $300 and it would contain Trojan protection which he said Norton would not.  Found out that it was not Norton!  A real scam. May not happen to everyone  However I will never download Norton on line again.

author: BobM
title: Nothing is perfect but Norton does pretty darned good.  Loaded well.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Seems to do the job nicely - loaded fairly easily on two of my computers - one with Windows XP and the other with Vista.  Both computers are SLOW and you have to be very careful to wait while things happen behind the scenes.  If you get impatient, you may goof up the process by clicking when you shouldn't.  But once you wait it out, things came up and I was back in business. Can't speak to how good Norton is but I have been using it for 15 years or more on several computers and only lost one when a Trojan horse snuck past Norton.  I do know it has stopped a couple of attacks on the Win XP machine.

author: Golden Gater

types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: My 5 star rating is not only for this product (it's kept my current systems malware free for the past few years) but also for the many Norton products I've used over the years ever since I bought my first IBM PC in 1983 and learned how to program.  Peter, if you happen to read this, thanks for the 'utility' of your many useful products over the years.

I started with a chat on the website and so no noise in the background to make the conversation hard to hear.This was much less expensive than buying directly from Symantec and you only have to use the key code if you are renewing.I recommend this product.
