author: loolin
title: NOT TRUSTING NORTON AT ALL!!!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I am not happy, bought a new computer for my husband and tried to download this as per the instructions.  There was an error code so I called support as instructed.  He logged into my computer to see what the problem was.  He is telling me that the computer was already infected prior to downloading Norton!!!  and ALL of my computers at this particular IP address will be infected.  He then says it will cost $199.99 to fix it. WHAT!!!! I told him I had just gotten the computer this afternoon brand new and I will just return it for another one. He then proceeds to tell me that any computer "I have on this IP address"  will be infected.  Well I am on my computer, ran a scan and it is just fine.  I downloaded to free Avast program on the new computer, ran a scan and it says its protected.. So I don't know who this person was that I spoke to but it was at Norton.com/setup as instructed on the receipt from Amazon!!!!!!!  Beware

author: Bookwormgirl
title: Works just fine.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've been using the Norton Internet Security software for a few years now.  The only time I've ever experienced problems with the download was last year, using the CD and product key code, it was a little wonky but it was straightened out by Norton tech support.  This year is a the first time I've re-purchased a newer version using the automatic download via Amazon.  Here's the process I followed:1. Go to Games and Software library.2. Note the product key code, log into your Norton account, input key code.3. While logged into your Norton account, it will automatically search for your existing files.4. Removing and updating your existing Norton files will take approximately 15 - 20 minutes.5. Once your files are updated, you will be asked to re-start your PC.6. After restarting your PC, the Norton download manager will initialize (including new Norton files), this will take approximately 15 minutes.7. I followed up with performing a full system scan (it can take up to 45 minutes).  I'm running Windows 7 (home premium version), the action center (flag icon on task bar) will periodically show firewall disabled messages as the new software is updating and initializing.8. PC is good to go!All told I spent about 90 minutes waiting for all of these tasks to finish.  Grab a cup of coffee and sit back.  I've spent years interfacing network software and the key is: be patient, don't rush the software.

author: Crystalstale
title: Norton - What Happened?
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have used Norton 360 / Norton products for years.  I purchased this program and was told by my computer tech that this version is sucking up my  memory (computer kept going into Safety Mode).  Long and short it is making my computer think I have no memory left when I had a full 8 plus gigs.  I had to uninstall, restore my computer back to factory setting.  I went with another product recommend by someone else.

author: Mary Bennett-Meyer
title: Great, dependable product!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Easy purchase, used for over four years now.

author: Mary
title: One Star

body: I wasn't aware of automatic renewal.  Tried to cancel when I found out, without anyone telling me how .Next day tried to install, message was given not enough room with Sierra.  So my Mac is 4 years old and running fine. I do not wish to remove Sierra .

author: Joseph F. Kranski II
title: Norton Security Deluxe subscription.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device

So I'm very pleased that Amazon carries their Security & Virus Downloads- on their Website. Thanks to Amazon; I'm "good to go" with their Products & Deliveries of Them.  :)

author: Sean Sinclair
title: This application is great and i trust that my computer is taken care ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This application is great and i trust that my computer is taken care of. I've never found these security applications to be very visually appealing applications and this is no different. Hard to have fun in computer security I suppose. That being said, I can always understand what is going on with my computer and there is nothing wrong with the application or the functionality. It simply gets the job done.

author: RanchMan
title: I'm pleased with the product
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've been a user of Norton security products for 15 or more years and I'm a fan.  Lots of criticism in various places about how Norton slows down systems but my systems are fast enough so if that's occurring, I don't notice it.  And they're effective -- I do a lot of research and see many different websites, but have not (yet) been infected by a virus or malicious code.  I'm been warned away from numerous websites as dangerous, so I heed the warnings.  Overall, I'm pleased with the product.  Only negative is it incessantly nags you to add browser bars and mobile phone protection apps.

author: MarleneLouise
title: Serves the purpose.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Have used Norton for years after failing at trying a few other brands of security which were just too complicated for me.  I have limited knowledge of anything to do with computers.  It's not that I am so new to it all, it is that I only use my PC for certain, simple tasks.  This serves my purpose well.

author: Kris A.
title: Powerful, but slows down the computer
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton Security Deluxe is a very comprehensive security program and does a good job protecting my computers.My greatest concern is that it is very resource intensive.  I found two of my devices have slowed down considerably with the addition of Norton Security Deluxe.Norton recommends installing several add-ons that also use lots of resources.

author: David Morris
title: I just want good Anti Virus that's not too resource intensive
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I still prefer NIS as opposed to their 360 package...  These keys work to extend subscription without having to convert to "Security Deluxe" version.  I just want good Anti Virus that's not too resource intensive, file and folder exclusions for scans, silent mode options for when specific programs are working.  I HATE the identity safe since Symantec decided to make it exist only on the cloud.  I used to use it, but now use Password Memory by Code Aero for that, and have it blocked by the firewall (just in case).

(2061)"If they were a region problem ...just say up front. Now I have a practically useless  Norton Security Deluxe 5 Device ....Thanks

I ended up just giving up in frustration and now will have to find a new anti virus program.  WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY....A

author: Amazon Customer
title: Conflicts with Mac OS Mojave caused a full system crash
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Unfortunately this antivirus protection program (AV) creates conflicts within the Mac Mojave OS. In my case it deleted the OS and rendered my iMac 100% inoperative. I had to call Apple Tech Support and spend a good amount of time reinstalling the Mojave OS. Apple's technical support person told me that this conflict is a known problem, that this specific Norton AV program for Macs does not work. Since I cannot use it, I need a refund from Amazon for the $25 that I spent to buy this AV utility. I do wish I could use it - but cannot. Despite the disclaimer that refunds are not accepted, I fully expect you to honor this refund request.

author: Kris
title: The price keeps going up, with less licenses. ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: The price keeps going up, with less licenses.  And forget about buying straight from Symantec as they charge 3-4 times as much depending on the day.

author: Donald
title: Great Internet Security Software
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have been using Norton products for over ten years now. This the first time I bought this software as a digital download and was very happy with how easy it was to download and install. Over the years I had also bought Norton Security Deluxe with a key card and always had problems downloading and installing it on other computers. But not this time using the digital download. The only drawback, as with any software that has updates, it sometimes causes conflicts with Windows.

author: Paula808
title: Love multiple license
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have used Norton for a couple of years and will continue to use it unless something changes drastically.  I have tried other programs and this works well for me.  We have multiple computers in our home between desktops and laptops and the fact that this is licensed for 5 computers is a big plus. Several years ago I left Norton and tried other software because of issues with Norton and my computer.  I have not experienced problems with this latest version so will continue to use Norton.

author: RG0647
title: New subscription verses renew the old version
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: My previous subscription to Norton antivirus was expiring and got the typical daily warnings from them each day for a month.  Since it was far more economical to buy a new version than renew, that is what I did.  All I needed to do was use the new license number provided in the new purchase and I now had another years worth of coverage.  There was really no new download, just continuing the current version with new daily virus updates.  If you choose this method Norton will continue sending renewal messages for quite a while, it appears they don't know you replaced the old version with the new one.

author: John Difool
title: did not work on Mac OS X El Capitan 10.11
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: In the description it said that this "Norton Security Deluxe – 5 Devices – 1 Year Subscription - Instant Download - 2019" would work on Mac OS X El Capitan 10.11When I went to norton.com/setup into my Norton account I got this message:Device not supported Norton does not run on this Mac operating system. I spent an hour trying to chat with Norton Customer support before giving up. Amazon Customer support was much better. I appreciate that Amazon gave me a full refund because I was unable to use the product. I would buy this product again (next year) if this issue gets resolved.

author: Lance M.
title: Excellent Price, Beautiful Interface, Top-Notch Security!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I'm throughly impressed with Norton Security Deluxe. First, the price offered here on Amazon is excellent - a significant discount off purchasing at retail outlets or through Symantec. The interface is easy to use, and has a variety of scan options + settings to adjust the firewall and application permissions. The online administration panel is great for checking on devices in other locations. All in all, after evaluating several anti-virus competitors, I'm happy to have chosen Norton Security Deluxe by Symantec.

author: Robert J. Mcgrath
title: Best security package
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've used the newer Norton Security version for two years. They no longer call it 'Security Suite' just Norton Security. On desktop, laptop, tablets. They finally got the memory overhead and resources use down. I have NEVER had any kind of infection. I do back up Norton with Malewarebytes. If you MUST have a free virus package use Bitdefender FREE. I buy Norton one year packages on sale. Just have to be on your toes. My latest on Amazon was one year, 5 device, Norton Security Deluxe for $19.99. I never pay full retail.

author: JenS
title: Norton is the best!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've been using Norton for quite a long time now and it never let's me down. I've always bought the CD, so that I could have the software if anything goes wrong. The last two times I've bought this software, I've used the download option. Not only is it cheaper, it's faster and super easy to install on all my devices. I've finally decided that the actual CD is unnecessary, especially since I have high speed internet. I highly recommend this product.

author: Linda Joy
title: Great Software
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: SO glad I found this on Amazon and didn't use Norton's auto renewal (at a much higher price).Installed fine and working just fine too!HINT - I bought it at the low price, but waited til my current software was about to expire in a day or two, before INSTALLING IT......so I get the full 365 days use of product before I need to renew again.

author: Mark Magill
title: Stable, well-known, feature rich, long-established and well-developed product at a good price.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have been using Norton Antivirus for many years - ever since Peter Norton started his utilities company and later antivirus. It has never disappointed me. False-positives are extremely rare as are viruses that are missed. Granted, no antivirus can detect 100% of all viruses all the time, but this one comes as close as I'll ever need to get. It's a great product, and to get a 5-device license for so little money is an extra value. Only thing I would say is this: Don't buy it directly from Norton/Symantec, come to Amazon. The OEM price is much higher for the same product. I had always thought I should get the best price for a renewal from Norton, but that's never been the case, so I wait until the last few days of the license and buy the next one here. I've tried MANY other products over the years as a researcher, but for my own use I always come back to Norton.

author: Joseph D'Agostino
title: Great Antivirus, Inconsistent Pricing
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I feel very save having Norton protecting my system. I've been using it for years. The only issue I have with Norton and/or their distributors is they keep playing around with the price. Last time I found an awesome subscription on Amazon, 15 months for $19.99. This time, the best I could find was with Norton themselves, 12 months for $31.98.

body: I have put this on two devices, and it is great. Very easy to use.

title: I purchased this download instead of renewing last years Norton ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I purchased this download instead of renewing last years Norton because the renew subscription is much more expensive. In process of installing the new Norton download I had to type a product key to activate the program. Here's the ripoff-- The product key provided does not have any characters in it, but when I tried to type in the product code a dash would appear even though I didn't type it in, making the product code invalid. I couldn't take the dash out it no matter what I tried. It seems that Norton put some sort of a command into the download that does that and I could not correct it. They do this to discourage buying the new program rather than renewing. I could not get a refund because I bought a download. I bought a Mcafee program. I don't think I'll be doing business with Norton again.

So my advice Use Microsoft and Hp updates and never ever  call number that comes on your computer screen.I do not think you need Norton at all.During the time I was using Norton Deluxe hackers could get to my computers.

author: Chet

body: A good security suite with an easy to use menu.  I've been using Norton for several years and the software has improved significantly.  It is no longer a major drain on system resources although an exception exists with MS outlook, I especially appreciate the identification of safe web sites when you are using a search engine such as google.

author: POCO

types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I am definitely not a computer guy, but I know Norton works! Where all the problems arise for other reviewers is beyond me. I installed this product with the help of my IT son, on 4 different computers, his included and we were off and running in no time. Easy, I'm glad my son was present..... Norton is great and this was a better price than renewing with Norton? Go figure. Save money and get it, Easy! I am sorry for others frustrations, because I know first hand how that can be, but this works, works well and is priced right. Stay protected. You can do it!

body: I have used Norton for 20 years and am very pleased.  It always ranks in the top five in year reviews while others come and go. It take a while to figure out what has changed, but once you have it, it goes quickly.

author: Fitz

types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Does not add to existing days, it completely restarts your subscription which wastes what you have left. The only reason I noticed was because I noted the days after redemption. This is scummy business practice, just like when Norton AUTOMATICALLY charged me FULL PRICE last year without my consent which I had to argue with them about to get a refund and why I purchased this early to avoid a repeat event. Horrible experience with company.

author: W. Rowe

body: I only buy this each year I need to renew my license with Norton.  Works on Android as well.  Tho you need to put it on a regular computer first.  There will be a window to "add device".  Then log in to your Norton account and it is done.

author: Photog
title: Have tried them all
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Symantec-and myself-- have been around for a long time. I have tried almost everything out there, and I kept coming back to Norton. I had a lot of holes and risks with the others, ands the others took up huge amounts of resources. They were constantly updating, being short-sighted in risk assessment. Norton security simply runs in the background and does it's job. I don't look at prices and compare Norton with other's prices. I get what I pay for. For 45 years, I have only used HP equipment; and for as long as I have known Norton, I have only used them.

types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have used Norton for years but now it does not catch as much as other Anti-Virus and slows your computer down. Bye bye Norton, it was good while it lasted.

author: I.M. Abignerd
title: Priced right and seems to do the job
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: It's good, but software should do it's job without unnecessarily interfering with my computing experience. I just hate the nags to turn features on and register for this and that. They aren't horrible, just a bit annoying for me. I disabled the firewall component because it blocked my ability to use Remote Desktop within my home LAN. I guess I could have simply told it to allow Remote Desktop to run, but my whole network is protected by a security appliance with a commercial grade firewall, so in my case that part is essentially redundant.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Seems reliable
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I purchased this to replace my 2013 version of Norton 360 after having a problem I'll not go into here.  But after this problem I was running security scans from various programs and found Norton 360 was only to be found on an old backup of my hard drive.  I don't know why it just disappeared.  But, I like Norton enough to stay with their products.  I've had a lot less problems with Norton than I've had with various other net security companies.

author: abc
title: Have always found Norton Handy.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: For protecting the investment of your personal data. Good web sheild for when the unexpected happens. Have been using norton for years. Good buy for 5 pcs, i use it on all mobile devices and my pcs in home. Will buy again for the software firewall side of things.

title: Solid Protection

body: I started with Norton 360 which in turn  became this product. Though it does not due everything that I liked 360 for, once it is installed, you can stop worrying. That's what I truly value. I do use other products in addition, but this is my mainstay for protection from the outside.

author: Joseph Knoernschild
title: Highly recommend
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton has been my go to antivirus for many years as they outperform the competition; this is if you can find the actual reports showing actual lab testing vs. the typical reviews you will find where they don't actually look at the antivirus ability but at other features that don't actually protect your information. I think the value of this 5 pack is well worth the price and am happy with my purchase. I also don't notice issues with the software running or bogging my system down.

author: V. Ling
title: Easy to install
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton Security Deluxe is easy to install. It bought this as a renewal. However, I found out later that the renewal price on the Norton app is the same as this price. This tool has a dashboard that shows you the state of how secured your system is, and you can fix it just by clicking a button. Easy enough!

author: Michael Becker
title: Amazon had the best price!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: If you've never purchased Norton before, it's well worth it, especially at these prices.  This year's version installs much quicker than last, I was able to install on three laptops and a phone in just over 30 minutes.  I've had a Norton product on one of my computers since 2005 and have not had one virus.  When you have kids, now teenagers, on a computer, this is a MUST HAVE!!  The only downside to Norton is they want to charge you full price if you're "renewing" your product.  I've never understood the concept of that, I guess a lot of people just don't pay attention and auto-pay the next year.  Don't do this!!  Purchase new every year and you'll save at least $40-50!

Just waiting for this year to run out then I'm back to my normal security software. Sometimes the deals are too good to be true.

I recommend this product over other brands. This is my opinion others my disagree but to me it is a great product.

author: S. Wallace

body: Norton Security Deluxe is a big program but it does keep the bugs out of your computer.  Keeps it cleaned up and running faster, and is more secure than any other program I've tried.  I've gotten other programs that offer a lot but don't deliver.  I'm sticking with Norton.

body: This product is a no-brainer. I have used Norton consistently for the last 10 years and it's the only product (I've used MacAfee, Kapersky and others), that has kept my PCs--and now phone and tablets--free from viruses. The best!

author: DP
title: Norton Security - Trusted Protection and NOT a Resource Hog
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've never been disappointed with the Norton Security, being a long-time user including back to the days of Norton Antivirus being a resource hog, and now that is not true.  Installation is a breeze and uninstallation is usually easy as well.  Features I'd really like to see added to make this a 5-star product:  (1) Right-click option to easily add a program to the firewall blocking rules and (2) A provision to export all firewall and antivirus settings so they can be imported on each PC where Norton Security is used.

author: JC
title: Good, but Going Downhill
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton seems better than the competition, but I am getting tired of it constantly nagging me about "unknown" software, which is in fact safe. It also is very annoying about forcing you to install their worthless web browser toolbox, which is probably just used to they can steal and sell your personal information.Oh, and it's nice how they charge loyal customers $70 to renew, or you can just buy this again on Amazon for $40 again.

author: RG

types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: The purchase was easy and I installed it that same day.  The issue I had was not with the Norton Security Deluxe but with the Norton site.  The instructions at Norton site and it took time to find instruction on installation of the update.  It was a great deal and the update worked great.

author: LH Shops
title: GREAT BUY!!!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This was a great buy on Amazon!  Almost half price and it is good up to 5 devices.  Downloading and installing was easy and it seems to be working just fine.  Norton offers up help if needed with the installation, don't be afraid to buy it.  I have used Norton in the past and it was good, except I thought it slowed down my computer so I stopped using it for the past several years and now decided to try it once again and I am happy.  Thanks Amazon!

author: slz
title: THis is a great price deal (though I only needed 3 licenses)
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Have used Norton for over 15 years without any problems.  THis is a great price deal (though I only needed 3 licenses).  On one other laptop, I tried McAfee but when it ran it slowed the laptop down so badly that I could do no work.  Deleted McAfee, installed Norton, everything is fine. The Norton scans can run and I can still get work done on the laptop!I like the settings in Norton much more than in McAfee.  More flexibility in timing of scans, etc.I highly recommend Norton.

author: kae
title: Not like former versions where instructions were clear and each step ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Download was not user friendly, had to guess during process.  Not like former versions where instructions were clear and each step was prompted.  Product did not properly load as a result, had to repeat process three times before computer recognized updated software.  Second computer recognized software as 30 day trial so had to repeat download twice.  Even after it appeared download was completed correctly, started receiving notifications that software had expired so it appears update did not sync with manufacturer.

author: El. M.
title: Awful on my laptops
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I installed this Norton product on 2 laptops, uninstalling AVG, which I had used for many years.  It caused my newer laptop to operate more slowly, & the older laptop to be unusable!  I uninstalled Norton, reinstalled AVG & both are working well.

author: bigwev
title: Spam generator
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton will spam you and will not leave you alone. They will send you application based spam to sell you more stuff. The firewall will not remember the settings and will keep asking you over and over again..I will never use the product agin.

author: Curious Wanderer
title: Inexplicably and intermittently kills internet connections with my Mac
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: With Norton installed on my Mac, the Internet connection intermittently and inexplicably drops. The only solution is to forget the network and reconnect. With norton uninstalled this doesn’t happen. Disabling the firewall doesn’t help this.

author: Dissatisfied in Thousand Oaks
title: Suspicious download process/website.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Had difficulty getting into website to download then got call from someone claiming to be support person who proceeded to suggest that he could help by logging into my computer.  Very suspicious.  Decided to not download Norton.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Uses downloader, avoid!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Don’t buy this, you have to install the Amazon downloader that won’t install on 2 different computers! If I would have paid attention to it I would have ordered key only and would be working now, but instead will have to buy again the fight with Amazon to get a refund! And of course no customer service from Amazon!

author: carl
title: And if someone isnt up to setting these settings right it isnt the greatest.. So i did alot of research and ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I orig ordered Kaspersky Internet security 2017,, but wasnt a big fan of it.. To many settings to set for security. And if someone isnt up to setting these settings right it isnt the greatest.. So i did alot of research and bought Norton Security Deluxe. Alot easier to set and forget.And then i added SpyWareBlaster, ( FREE)  and these two together work great in protecting me..And also i add malwarebytes free..

author: tac
title: Better customer service then I expected
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I am working overseas. I have purchased Norton products from Amazon before and they worked just fine. This time I have a valid license, but it won't work here in South Korea. Norton isn't being helpful at all. Passing the puck to Amazon.Update Norton just provided a new key that works in my area. Much better customer service then I expected. Pleasantly surprised!

author: Andrew
title: A few issues
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Great product although there are two concerns:1) Occasionally Live-Update will fail and it takes multiple re-boots and attempts to get it to download and install properly. It doesn't always give an alert that it has quit working and you are unprotected.2) To update in advance of your current expiration takes a call to customer service and wasted time to get the new year added to your remaining time.

author: Jimfl47
title: I like Norton
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton is Norton. If you think Norton is great you will love this product as well. I like Norton and I feel confident that is protecting my computer from the bad guys that want to hurt me. You get what you read and see.

author: Smash
title: Meh
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I'm annoyed that this keeps getting more and more expensive and the product changes to something else every year. Why buy a subscription when a brand new product is less? It often makes my PC runs low, take over and does things I don't want it to, it started removing files and giving only vague explanations as to why. I've used Norton for well over a decade and while it might still be one of the best it's also a P.I.T.A. and over priced.

author: Maurice
title: Protector
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I'm impressed  at how affordable a top of the line virus protector is

author: Arch Hughes
title: Seems to be very effective.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: With the evil that Kapersky was involved in, this is looking like a better and better purchase decision.  I use it on my server that runs an HTTP service and it is frequently reporting attacks coming from various vectors.  My world would be much worse without this. The black hats are ruining the world.

author: Randy Curti
title: Dependable Anti-Virus Protection at a Great Price
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've been a long time User of Norton Anti-Virus Software for years & have never had any issues. I installed it on my PC, Laptop & Smartphones & it's Interface is easy to navigate & has automatic virus definition updates to protect you against attacks. The first thing I install when replacing my devices & a must in this age of internet security.

author: doug's review
title: Wasted over an hour so far trying to get this ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Wasted over an hour so far trying to get this loaded on the first computer. apparently Norton has a problem if you already had Norton and you are just trying to renew it through Amazon. Apparently should have just gone direct to Norton because I have been looking for ten minutes on how I return this and Amazon is making it suck.

author: Semi Biz Traveler
title: Perfect. The only star I held back is not ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Getting the upgrade from Amazon saved me at least 50% vs. Norton's online upgrade. This is the way to go. The whole process was a breeze. Buy the upgrade from Amazon. The license key is stored in your Amazon account's games and software library. Open the Norton Security application on your computer, click 'renew', then click 'I have a key', next copy and paste the key from your Amazon library. Voila, one more year of Norton protection is activated. Perfect.The only star I held back is not for Amazon, but for Symantec for trying to gouge me for almost double the Amazon price, when I first went to their website. Thanks to Santa, I came to Amazon to double check. Now it's really a useful Christmas gift to myself ;-)

author: John Chladek
title: Norton's protection must have.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Great price for peace of mind. Been using Norton's now for twenty years and it's been great protection for all twenty years. They keep my computer running great and safe from threats out there.

author: JustMyTwoCents
title: Better value that renewing subscriptions online.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This product works as expected. Have been using Norton for a long time.I prefer buying Norton from Amazon because it is a better value. Paying retail price from renewing an existing subscription is too expensive.

author: Windedhiker
title: this has been better on my mac than I've had on a PC
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: My father loves the internet and is constantly going to sites in other countries. He's a history buff, so he's always going to obscure sites without realizing where he is actually going. Till one day when he got a virus, and that's when things changed. It took a few different products and attempts to clean his machine, but Norton took care of it on the first pass. Unlike my past experiences where Norton would slow down my machine, this has been better on my mac than I've had on a PC.

author: Lance Shreves
title: Follow the process exactly as it states.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: The key is not accepted on Norton under my account. My previous Norton Security is expired and it asks for another key code. When I put it in I get a message the key is not good. I am sure this is a simple problem but I don't see anyway on Amazon to fix it.Updated: I did get it to work on my PC and my MacBook. Still can't get it working on my iPhone but it loaded fine and I had no problems. I was trying to add a code to the currently installed Norton that had expired which it would not take.

author: aj king
title: Buy it for the people whose computer you're always fixing. Appropriate pricing on Black Friday / Cyber Monday.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: It's Norton. Decent protection (I wouldn't call any of them good). They have 24/7 staffing with some person from across the world to remotely fix you issue(s) for you. Sometime I more tech savvy than their technicians and their techs may say "I understand you issue" when they clearly have no clue.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Most people hate Nortons because of resource hog
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Most people hate Nortons because of resource hog. That was 2009. The reason Me, an IT tech loves this product because I do not have to maintain the software or make Nortons do its thing. Nortons does all of its things like Scanning, Cleanup all the good stuff while your NOT using your computer and if its scanning while you get back to your computer it will stop. As An IT tech I dont have to touch it and make it do its job. It does it on its own

author: Jack UpstateNY
title: Great product, if you're computer is relatively up to date.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I was looking for an Antivirus for my Mac and this was on sale for a substantially reduced price on Amazon. If you're not familiar with computer antivirus programs, the first thing to be mindful of is will it require a lot of CPU? essentially that just means will it use up a lot of your computer memory. Norton has been known at times to use a lot of computer memory, but if you have a relatively up to date computer you should be fine. I find this program very useful, the ONLINE download that I bought gave me no problems when I entered the key code in. Also, it lets you use it on 5 devices. Awesome!

author: Adi
title: Versatile functionality and cheap price
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Got it a very cheap price (Thanks, Amazon). Does the job. I also like the fact that it has file cleanup and disk optimization. The vault is a redundant feature for me but I do appreciate all the extensions for my browser. Wish they had the safe search feature with Google and not Yahoo (I'm just biased!).

author: Steve Austin

The price for me is the key for a 5 version...$30 or less is my striking price..never have found a good price on it at the box stores...

types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have have used Norton products for years and have never had a problem. But search for your best price because it will vary from site to site. Found the best price here on Amazon. As others have mentioned, don't activate the new key too early or you will lose your remaining time. I waited until the last day, downloaded and activated the new key without a problem.

body: When attempting to install a scammer said I had a problem with my computer. They offer to repair for $500 if they could take over my computer. I contacted Norton with fantastic service

body: Norton Security is a great product but I was disappointed that the Amazon Software Download does not support Windows 10. Who would have guessed ? Go to MyNorton.com and key in Product Code.

author: Amazon Customer
title: BUY YOUR NORTON HERE ON AMAZON AND SAVE 65 DOLLARS!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I suggest you get your Norton Security right here on Amazon.  If you buy it here, you will pay less than $40.00.  If you automatically renew through Norton, you will pay over $100.00.  Make sure you undo the automatic renew option if you already have Norton Security, and if you can't go to live chat and have them do it.  Then, when next year rolls around and it's time to upgrade to the next year's model, get it again on Amazon and save a bundle.

author: tachi1
title: I like Norton's performance & tools.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have had years of good experience with Norton and continue to do so (knock on wood!)  I got this 5 device download even though I only had two devices I needed it for. The time (the yearly subscription to the service) begins to count when you initialize the first item. If, a few months later, you add another item, that item's subscription is based on the first item you initialized, not on when you installed it. Something to keep in mind.

author: techie
title: Just added Norton to my new notebook
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: And it was as simple as could be.  Copied the 6 month old installer from my desktop and was surprised that it completed installation with no issues.  Why that was became obvious when I opened the application and saw a 1 day subscription.  No problem.  Clicked the activation link, logged into Norton, and it was done.Everything should be this easy

author: Lauren K.

types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I do not plan to renew with Norton when my subscription expires. This new version no longer has a backup feature that was included in the product two years ago (I did not know that until after I renewed my subscription). Overall. the product seems to do the job but there are other products out there that are highly rated and have more features.

author: C Souza
title: Would never buy this again Way to hard to figure ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Would never buy this again Way to hard to figure out how to install. I have purchased Norton many many times before and have never had this much trouble. If I could return I would.

author: Leonardo
title: Keeps spamming me
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This product is supposed to scan for viruses, spam and adware. Now I get spam from Norton with offers to buy more services. It pops up whenever I turn on my computer or open the browser. The irony is baffling.

author: JSantos
title: Norton deluxe security
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I switched from TrendMicro to Norton since it was on a special and I have heard good reviews on it.  I finally installed it on my XPS laptop, my tables and my phones.  Norton is working great on my tablets and phones but not on my laptop.  It takes about 3 to 5 minutes to boot up and once it does, it works fine.  I even installed Norton power eraser and it worked OK.  Still slowing up my laptop and my laptop keeps freezing now.

author: JimD
title: Painful to install.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: VERY painful download process.  Part of it may have been because I had another brand of virus protection on my laptop when I tried to download this but it totally did not work.  I had to call Norton support and let them remotely take over my computer.  It was nice that they solved it but it took a lot of my time still.  It seems like it should have worked better.  My laptop is working better, however, with the Norton installed and the other brand removed.

author: Korol
title: It Works!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Despite reading some negative reviews about a instant download, I decided to try anyway and I am so glad I did. I just needed to renew my Norton subscription. I only had one more day left. Amazon comes through once again for something that I needed!  The process was so simple and worked perfectly.

author: cwglindn

body: The standard Norton Security system with five devices.  I use the codes for my phone, tablet, computer and laptops.  I never renew this product as it is often goes on sale at amazon, especially during November / December and tax season.  I like Norton and I have been using their products for over 10 years.

author: F Pare

types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I am very accustomed .to Norton Internet security.  It has worked better for me than other anivirus products.  I was especially impressed when I received special support to remove some malware that ws identified by the standatd product by not removable.

body: After installing the software, I lost ALL internet connection on my MacBook.  Tried playing with the firewall settings and it did not work.  After uninstalling the product I had connection again.

author: JMN
title: Don't like it
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I just got Norton. It has messed with the response time of my computer and created shutdown issues as well. While I'm sure it is a fine product in many ways, I don't like it. I should have stayed with the product that came with my computer. It's too late to get my money back now, though, so I'm stuck with it.

author: AG
title: NORTON IS THE ABSOLUTE BEST!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I had been purchasing McCafe for years.  Finally decided to take a plunge and change.  Norton is 100% better.  Buy through amazon and the set up will be so easy.  No hassles.  Working extraordinarily well and for a price that can't be beat.  Go Norton ... and Go Amazon!!!

author: Ruh Roh
title: I like how simple it is to install
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I like how simple it is to install, it's also not bad on resources. The cons however are with threats. It seems to do an OK job at detecting them, but it doesn't always do a good job at dealing with the threats. I've had a two occasions where it would detect which I had to reinstall to resolve the issues.

author: Ralph
title: The Best PC Internet Security Software available today!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: When, in the past, PC security software was unbundled, I did try other antivirus software.  Doing this I found it difficult to mix and match antivirus software from one supplier with the firewall from another.  I always chose to buy the firewall rather than use the one supplied by Windows because I never felt the one included with Windows was good enough.  After security software suppliers started to integrate the firewall, antivirus, antispam, etc. into one product, and after much research, I decided that Norton Internet Security software was the way to go and I have never looked back.  This product does it all and does it very well.  It's easy to install, easy to setup and if there is a toggle that needs explanation the help section is there to explain it to you.  I have used Norton Internet Security for many, many years and will continue to do so as long as I use PCs.

author: Scott
title: Crashed my computer 3 times.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Totally crashed my computer 3 times.  Had to restart in Safe Mode and removed it.  It has just booted up ok now, but we shall see if there is further damage.  Buyer beware.

author: Lisa S
title: Good product
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Very happy with Norton antivirus. I've had it for two years now and this was to renew for my third year. My computer hasn't had a virus and still works like it's brand new.

author: W. Gardner

body: i was running out of subscription to Norton 360 and the price quoted by Norton for a year was $179.  this came on special on Amazon a week before my subscription ran out $19.99.  Same product, more features and works on more devices.  The only negative is Norton has outsourced their customer service to India (sounds like at least) their reps are hard to understand now and someone in the U.S. is out a job.

body: Very easy and much cheaper than clicking the Renew link on your pc.  Just input the new subscription key into Norton and it quickly updates giving you another year of protection at a great price.

author: narbie
title: High CPU usage unacceptable
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Extremely high CPU usage constantly by the program -- even when not scanning.  This makes the program, and even the computer, pretty much unusable.  (I have Windows 10 and 16gb of memory)  This problem has been reported to Symantec by many customers for quite some time.  Still no fix.  I was a Symantec customer for many years ... but no longer.  There are no refunds on software ... so it's money down the drain.

author: wardbeldare

author: Tanto

body: Norton has always been good for me. I’ve had issues with others.  Once you pay your activation codes comes shortly after. Login to your account and update the activation code update and you’re good to go.

types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This was a renewal and it is much cheaper and easier to just buy directly from Norton for $29. Be prepared to jump through numerous screens and enter the key code through the "Help" feature on your installed Norton on your machines.

author: bella bella
title: Can NOT Install if out of the USA
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I purchased Norton when I was in Mexico for a month, as my version expired.  After I purchased it, I was made aware that it CANNOT be installed when I was in Mexico.  Not only did my computer go unprotected, but I lost one month of my subscription, even though I didn't install it.  Norton should make it clear that it has to be installed when you are in the USA.

author: Bill Short
title: I downloaded this software, restarted my iMac, and ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I downloaded this software, restarted my iMac, and the previously well-behaved iMac would not reboot, even in safe mode.  Over $600 later, and 2.5 days at the computer shop, my computer now works again.  Only after buying this did I see many warnings NOT to use Norton for Macs, it is not needed, and is "buggy."  That last is an understatement.  If you have a Mac, don't buy this.

author: K. Brandeiz
title: Good Protection From Illness
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I only have 1 Computer, but it was cheaper to buy this 5 user version.  It works great, keeps out the "bugs" and keeps my computer running smoothly.  Of course, I will wait until the very last day to renew it, because it doesn't add days on, it starts at 365 days.  I have not figured out how to add on the days left from last years - so far so good, the gap never let in any problems.

author: FirstFrontier Florida

types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device

author: Amazon Customer
title: Very pleased.

body: Works great. Fixed my computer. Easy to install and I have troubles following directions from packages. It scans automatically when the computer is turned on now. No delay or anything once it's turned on. Must run in the background and doesn't stop me from doing what I want. Will def order from here again next year when my subscription is up. So much cheaper then the other way.

author: Pamela K. Jones

Going to Norton now and won't be back to renew with Amazon. Even though the product code went in Norton kept saying to renew. Sometimes a bargain isn't a bargain.

author: Amazon Customer

body: It works fine if you don't travel. I bought it when I was living in the US. When I tried to enter the product key, it said it was regional and only applied for the United States. Unfortunately, I didn't aware it. This message wasn't shown on Amazon product page. It was in the Term and Condition (Usually, I didn't read it).I called the customer service and I was asked to contact Amazon, and see if Amazon can give me a China area product key. (it won't work when I finish my trip and go back to the States.)I don't suggest you purchase it if your PC/Mac will be used in different countries, otherwise, it is good and light weight.

title: This does not work with Windows 10 EDGE. Use Internet Explorer or whatever..
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've used Norton products on my computers for a long time, so I was glad to get this on sale. There is only one caveat I would place on this. Unlike all the other products I have used, this caused a bit of a problem after I installed it. Something to keep in mind if you are using Windows 10, is that this WILL NOT WORK WITH the 'EDGE' internet function. It even tells you that it won't work with it. I upgraded from Windows 8.1 to Windows 10, and I didn't care for using Edge, so I kept using  Internet Explorer. However, Edge was still in my taskbar. I would advise 2 things before you download/install this. 1) make a RESTORE POINT and back up your files, and 2) Remove EDGE from the taskbar, and do not use it after installing this. Maybe Norton will fix this problem in the future, but nothing so far.

author: vlv
title: Phone/Tablet protection is not included but takes away one of your available devices. Disappointed.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: The product itself is great, for a desktop or laptop. Norton has always protected my computers from viruses and is easy to setup. It is also easy to manage and set preferences. It is always scanning or providing warnings about websites. Runs in the background on my laptop and doesn't interfere with anything that I am doing or working on. The problem is, as almost every other reviewer has already mentioned, that it is advertised as security for your PC, Mac, smartphones, and tablets. This is not true. It is a full version of Norton on PCs (and probably Macs, I do not use a Mac so I am not completely sure), but on smartphones and tablets it is simply an app that can back up your contacts and help locate your device. Installing it on your phone/tablet takes away one of the five devices allowed, and it is pointless. I have an iPhone and it already backs up my contacts to the cloud and has a 'find my iphone' feature. There is no security for your device at all.If you buy this product, just be aware that it is only for a computer. I would pay the $19.99 just to protect my computer, but it is very disappointing when you believe that all your devices can be protected, and they are not. The description needs to state that smartphones and tablets are only getting a pointless app. Instead, it claims to protect your device if you pay bills on it or use banking apps. I would give it 5 stars if it just was listed as for computers, because it does what it claims to do in regards to that though. And it is much cheaper on Amazon than on the Norton website.

author: Alexander White
title: Too Many Issues since Windows 10 still not resolved in June 2016
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have Norton security on 4 windows 10 desktop computers and it has repeated issues on all of them. Namely, every time I try to do a live update or run a scan it’s a 50/50 chance it won’t work. Norton’s initial solution to this longstanding problem was to uninstall Norton then reinstall. That worked for a few live updates, then back to the same issue. Now, after a lengthy wait, a screen pops up notifying you that Norton found a problem, but fixed it. Really! Sometimes it now works. Sometimes not. Sometimes a reboot gets it working again. Sometimes not. When this occurs, are you protected and just not able to update and scan? Or is the problem deeper?  Who knows, but the problem, in my case, continues on multiple systems as of 4-24-16.Another issue I have been having with Norton, is that an upgrade to bios or a change in motherboard often leads to the license disappearing, and requires purchasing a new one. For these reasons, I am fast losing my enthusiasm for Norton products.Fullow up on 6-20-16In my ongoing experience, with 3 new Windows 10 desktops, Norton appears to be unable to work RELIABLY with Windows 10. It works for a while, then it goes “missing in action.”  At this point left click, right click, do what you want, to the Norton icon - it does nothing. No way to live update or scan. Is it providing any protection.? No way to know. Eventually, if you wait long enough a popup appears telling you Norton has a problem. Yes, I know that. That’s why I’m researching a different product. The end result is always an Error: "8504,104,” which requires a reinstall of Norton. I have lost track of how often I have done this reinstall. This fixes the problem for a few days. Then it’s back to square one. By now, 6-20-16, don’t you think they should have fixed this? For this reason, and due the fact that Norton has not indicated whether or not Norton Security is actually providing any protection when this Error: "8504,104" is occurring, I am lowering my rating to 1 star.7-11-2016: Once again, I turn on my computer and Norton security is not working! I go through the whole rigmarole one more time. For those not familiar, here it is:Run the Norton Remove and Reinstall toolIf you have Norton Family installed, uninstall it before you run the Norton Remove and Reinstall tool.1. Download the Norton Remove and Reinstall tool.Save the file to the Windows desktop. On some browsers, the file is automatically saved to its default location.1. To open the Downloads window in your browser, press the Ctrl + J key.2. Double-click the NRnR icon.3. Read the license agreement, and click Agree.4. Click Advanced Options.5. Click Remove Only.6. Click Remove.7. Click Restart Now.After the computer restarts, follow the on-screen instructions to reinstall your Norton product.STEP 2Except, the reinstall feature does not work. So no Security – again. I go back to Amazon, and reinstall. And then have to reinstall all the security updates, with 2 restarts required, including one to fix the vulnerability the FBI recently notified us of. Is this any way for your security suite to work? If you think so, they buy Norton, but then do a lot of praying. Because 2 or 3 weeks from now, I will be doing this all over again - unless Norton decides to put out a product that RELIABLY works.

types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Doesn't work as a renewal. I have Norton security on 4 PCs. The authorization code that came with this package does not work to extend an existing license. Follow a link to get a correct code, which doesn't happen. Instead, it leads to an automated process where the old Norton software is removed and new software installed. Then there's a complete system scan. The install and scan are quite time-consuming, so don't wait by the computer(s) to finish.This is the second year that I've been through this process to save a few bucks with a discount offering. Next year, I'm planning to ignore the holiday deal and just click the renew tab, pay the extra $40-50 or so, and hope for a smooth, time-saving extension.

author: R. Ault
title: What it does, it does well.  What it DOESN'T do may be more crucial for some.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've been a Norton user for a long time, off and on.  For a while, starting about 10 years ago, I had swapped to one of the free antivirus utils instead, mostl;y because I'd noticed that what Norton was doing back then was eating up  too much of my system's capacity; when Norton 4ngaged, the whole mess slowed to a dead crawl.  Starting about four years ago, though, they improved their software a heck of a lot, and the system hit is far less now.  Unfortunately, the malware makers have been getting better at hiding their bombs inside email attachments, and the current Norton product often takes two to five days to find and neutralize those threats.  However, since I'm a suspicious old dude who has been around since before there were computer viruses at all, and I've got a well-honed sense of caution about attachme6nts, the hazard to me is near zero - as long as I never let anyone else use this system.  If Symantec can get that delay between emergence and detection down to something more useful, I'll happily upgrade this to five stars.  Until then, however, the fact that it routinely fails to catch an entire category of threat means that I really ought the be giving it three stars or less.

body: I loved Norton and used it for many years.Now an annoying RED BOX pops up on my Windows 7 Home computer every 5 minutes chastising me about my open WI-FI in the countryside.  We have it so my retired mother can connect devices to the internet.  Every 5 minutes I have to close this box that says UNSECURE WIFI.It's constantly spamming me to get ANOTHER program downloaded and installed to my computer, NORTON WIFI PRIVACY.And to think, I am a fool who paid for this option.  Most annoying software I have ever used.  Will never trust company again.DO NOT BUY IF YOU USE YOUR COMPUTER MORE THAN ONCE A DAY ON OPEN WIFI, IS MORE ANNOYING THAN VIRUS.I can't even close this box because it's not compatible with custom sized fonts.NEVER AGAIN!

author: Jack
title: After a long conservation I found out that my computer had a possible infection of some kind with some bad drivers and that thei
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: First I am not a computer expert. I ordered Norton Deluxe for my computer for 5 computers as I have for years. I tried to activate the software and got a error message. I called the phone number to Norton. I ended up in India as usual. After a long conservation I found out that my computer had a possible infection of some kind with some bad drivers and that their system would not accept data from my computer. I was also informed that I needed to have a certified Microsoft Tech go over my computer every 60 to 90 days to keep it running properly.They could remove the problems from my system for $200. I requested to talk to someone in the US. I was transferred and it sounded like I had made it to someone I could understand. After a couple of minutes I was back in India again. This one was a supervisor. After another conversation about my problems and asking if I was a senior I got a price of $150 for 5 machines for a year. I will not recommend Norton to anyone any more. This is the first time I have run into anything like this. I tried to activate the software on another computer that had 10 installed by the factory and it will not load. Evidently they have blocked the code. It is to late to ask for a refund from Amazon. This another hard lesson. Be careful when buying Norton. There seems to hidden charges.

author: Mike
title: Beware of Symantec tech
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Have used Norton software for years and have been happy.  Now a problem.  Downloaded this software for my son.  Would not install and gave a number to call.  They called and appeared to be very helpful.  Let them access the machine as I had done in the past.  Then told me that the ip address had been hacked and that they could fix that for $200.00/yr or $500.00 for 5 years.  Said no and would have my IT people look at it.  Called my internet provider and they checked and said there was no issue.  Have since learned that this is apparently a ploy for unscrupulous middle men to reap big dollars for a product that is simply not needed.  Amazon was great.  Immediate refund and said they would be contacting Symantec to investigate.  Luckily we were disconnected and they called back and my caller ID got their number.  When I looked up the number that they left it appears as a support number for at least 10 major companies (Symantec, ASUS, HP, etc.).

author: Bob McClure
title: Potential SCAM
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Purchased this for my laptop.  Followed directions to install. After inputting the Product Key, my computer screen said there was a problem with the installation and provided a phone number to call for assistance. I called and an individual answered saying he was Norton tech support and would be happy to help me with the installation. He said he needed access to my computer and I allowed it. He indicated that my computer had a number of viruses and malware and stated that he would need to clean it before he could install the Norton software.  He also indicated that this was not a. free service and would at a minimum cost $150.  I foolishly told him to go ahead. Bottom line, after 3 hours he said my computer was now cleaned and Norton was now installed and working. He then went into a sales pitch for additional coverages available. The additional features sounded good so I wrote a check for $400.  Later I started wondering about this transaction so I called Norton directly and found out that the whole thing was a scam. Norton could not do anything to help me out. Neither could Amazon. Very expensive lesson. If you buy be aware of the possibility of getting caught in the scam.

author: Rico Jimenez
title: Long-time product user and IT professional
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I'm an IT professional of almost 20 years. I've used Norton Security for several years now and have not been disappointed. This product has minimal impact on system performance, unlike some antivirus programs that can bog down your system. It also provides a great level of protection as we've remained virus free (though I will admit, I've drilled good internet and email habits into my family). In addition, this version will perform "tuneup" tasks on your PC. I don't find them to be of any harm, but honestly I wouldn't care if they were removed from the program.I find that buying from Amazon is the cheapest way to renew my subscription. Just be sure to wait until your existing subscription has expired or is about to expire, as new subscription overwrites your existing one, and you'll lose any remaining time you had left.

author: Randy
title: Using this purchase to renew existing subscription much more difficult than in past years.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have been using this product for many years, purchasing a new product key from Amazon instead of renewing directly with Norton, understanding fully the consequence of losing a few days of subscription by not waiting until the expiration date, but this year it has been much more difficult to do this.  Previously, you could bring up the Norton screen, click on Renew, the click on "Have Product Code", simply enter the code and within seconds, your subscription was renewed to 365 days.  That option no longer exists.  When you click on Renew, it directs you to their page where you have to purchase it from them.  I contacted Norton, and they told me to sign onto Norton.com/setup and enter the product key.  At that point, it goes through and entire download and installation process.  I have not yet figured out how to get it on to additional devices since it is a 5 device version, but I suspect that same process of download and install will be required.  This is a big pain!!  I can't believe a company as great as Norton has stooped to this level to try to force you to buy directly from them.  Very disappointed.  I certainly hope the security and protection is as good as it has always been.  I would really hate to change to something else.  Not cool!!

author: Avid Reader
title: Great if you hate your computer.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This product is just awful. I have been using it for over 2 months now and don't think I can last the other 10 until my year subscription is up. It was a daily special for a great price and my McAfee was expiring in a few weeks so I figured why not, the timing is great. I didn't have a problem with McAfee, but I figured most of these products are about the same. HAHA. No. The biggest issue is about the Live Update. First off, it doesn't do it automatically even though it's set to do to it automatically. Secondly the automatic scan is a quick high level scan. I figured how to get a full system scan set up to run weekly. Third is a huge problem that combines the first and second issue. If the full scan starts to run and the latest updates aren't install not only does your computer freeze up, but the dreaded blue screen of death hits. And they know it's a thing, it's on a ton of forums and their solution is to make sure all the updates are installed before running a full scan. Errrr, why doesn't the automatic update do it's job and then this entire problem goes away?!  How protected is my computer not knowing if the antivirus software is current? The quick scan running in the background doesn't really do anything if it's not scanning against the most current problems.  This product is awful. If it were free you should still run fast.

author: Emile Amirsaleh
title: Scare tactics and constant pop-ups
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I guess it works because I don't have any viruses.  It mostly runs in the background which is nice.But they constantly have stupid pop-ups that come up to tell me about new threats.  I have this software on all of my computers, so imagine dismissing a pop-up on one machine, I have to do that same thing on all my other machines every time Norton pushes out a new pop-up.The latest one is the worst, regarding the Equifax security breach.  They say click here to check if you've been breached, and then they try to sell you LifeLock.  Using scare tactics to get you to buy crap you don't need that has NOTHING to do with antivirus!  Highly inappropriate and will be filing a complaint.Again, aside from this crap, the software is nice.  It runs mostly in the background, does not take up much resources, and does not need any attention from my side.  I use it on my work computer and laptop, as well as my home PC for gaming.  It just works well in all environments.

author: Modulin
title: To renew: Click "renew" in Norton and paste code
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: For another year of Norton, no need to pay high rates with Norton's renewal service. Sign up for a Norton account form within the application (you should have done that long time ago during installation anyway), buy amazon's code, copy it, open the Norton program's window, click "renew" and click "I have a code to enter", where you paste the code. Done! The days remaining fill up by a year. Beware: Wait to the last day BEFORE renewing, otherwise Norton steals your remaining days; refill is always only at 366 days, no matter what!

author: J, Carter Watts
title: Never Buy Norton Products.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: It is difficult to describe softwear for a computer. It seems to either do the job or doesn't. I bought this product as I had good luck with it in the past. However, it was the last Norton product I will ever buy. I tried putting this on my computer and got a warning that there were issues with my ip address which had a Trojan on it. This was due to the Norton not doing what it was supposed to. I called the number which was supposedly Norton and they got into my computer to see if they could fix the problem. I was told it would cost between $150.00 to $499.00 to fix it. I told them that being on a fixed income I did not have that kind of money whereas they dropped the whole idea and left the computer without returning it to the state it had been in. I could even get Windows to work afterwards. I blame this entirely on Norton for letting the Trojan through and if it was a scam, for allowing it through. I will never buy another Norton product, not that they care. Cost me a computer.

Now they are holding my laptop hostage and I am forced to buy a new one.  I work hard year round just for someone else to rip me off.  There are crooks everywhere and just when you thought you can trust a supposed to be trustworthy company......

types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've been using Norton Anti-Virus since 2011 when I got tired of my hard drive crashing and having to replace it. I finally realized my laptop was getting infected with viruses and causing it to crash. I have a brand new laptop now, but the old one still runs fine because I never had a problem once I installed the Norton.This particular version allows you to install it on up to 5 devices. It works great and I love having the sense of security and peace of mind having it brings. I especially love the little message that pops up every now and then to let me know it has completed a scan, or it has blocked a vulnerability. I highly recommend it.

author: G
title: A little protection with a heavy helping of spam.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This Norton product has become spam.  I'm sure it provides a fair amount of virus protection which I did give an extra star for.  But the way-too-frequent nags about installing things I DON'T WANT are extremely annoying.  When I tell it NOT to install one of their other plug-ins or programs, I should NOT be nagged about it every day!  No matter how many times I click the "Never ask me again" button, it still doesn't listen and nags me again the next day.It also requires a restart, it seems, with every update to the database.  This is just poor software management.  The core engine should not be changing that much just to access new virus updates.  The older versions managed a much better balance between requiring complete system reboots and simply updating the new virus definitions and letting you continue to work without constant updates to reboot the computer.So you get (hopefully) a fair amount of protection at a very high price of annoyance.Time to look elsewhere for a good virus protection program that doesn't require so much 'maintenance'.

author: Jinkc
title: Would be worth it if I had 5 devices to protect.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have always wanted professional security for my laptop and mobile devices, but didn't want to spend a ton of money for it. I have gotten by with free software. I always felt like I was missing something and felt uneasy about the security I was receiving. I saw a deal on Amazon for Norton on 5 devices for $20 for a year. That was a great deal that I couldn't pass up on. The software itself is easy to use. I like that I am able to add my cell phone as well. In the end, I don't see much benefit to having it on my phone. It just tells me everything I use is a risk. In reality, I probably only need this on one device and would have rather spent $5. However, it was the same price for 1 device as it was for 5. As of now, the price is back up to $40. I personally would not purchase again at $20, so I definitely wouldn't recommend $40. If you have a lot of devices you need protected, this may be worth it. For the average person that has 1 computer and 1 cell phone, it really isn't. There are tons of free options out there that do just as good of a job.

title: Norton Buyer Beware!!!

body: HUGE MISTAKE to buy this product. Purchased Norton Security Deluxe for a new desktop. Computer was working perfectly until I installed Norton. I ran a 'quick scan' and no issues were identified. But at that moment...immediately..the computer stopped operating. Clicked on Google and page never loaded even after waiting 30 minutes!  Had to shutdown computer and since that installation the computer will not even reboot!! Norton customer no-service was unable to help and claimed it wasn't their problem...basically said too bad sucker!! They don't take responsibility for trashing my computer. Stay away from Norton!!!

author: rodman
title: unreturnable
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Support phone connects to techs that are very difficult to understand. Computer issues would not allow even remote downloads. Had explained I was unable to download anything. After a few attempts, they also had no luck. Had taken my pc in to retrieve pics and return it back to windows 7 after downloading 10 left me with black screen. Still issues with blue screen, with time, downloads, etc. HP support is also very poor. Tried I-Techie Solutions, for two days, no luck. Took it back to factory defaults and asked my son in law to look at it. Supposedly I received a refund for a Norton  bundle. Now I have this Norton product but no way to return it. Guess I'm doomed to eat the $40 as there is no way I'll attempt to download it. Getting the other Norton off my computer was difficult. My son in law also had a bad experience with Norton. Consumer Reports gives it a high rating but I'm of a different opinion, as is my son-in-law.

author: Edward Price
title: Great Deal To Get Norton PC Security
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have been using Norton/Symantec AV for PC's for about two decades on multiple PC's. I have tried McAfee and others a couple of times, but still prefer the Norton. Perhaps this is for subjective reasons, but in all my experience, Norton has never let anything into my machines (and I am a dangerously curious, although not gullible user). My biggest criticism of Norton is that it tries to do too much for you, giving you the feeling that your computer exists for Norton. Also, Norton would love for you to opt for the automatic renewal, in which you will get billed for full factory price (currently around $90) while they pretend to be giving you the best deal. Just buying a new authorization code (a subscription in effect) here is a much better deal, and using the code to update for another year works fine for me (I have been doing this method for several years now after waking up to Norton's duplicitous marketing techniques).

body: Ordered the software, for my APO Address.  Downloaded it, then tried to install it.  AFTER they had all my credit card info for "automatic renewal", they THEN told me "you can't activate it".  The "Chat Help" guy actually told me "you can activate your software in the US" (I'm stationed overseas with the U.S. military), "or return it for a refund, we can't activate it (CLEARLY marked "APO") although we DO have your credit card!"Useless.  waste of time and money.  Thanks for nothing, Norton!
