author: bp-tx
title: Worse than the viruses
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I installed Norton Security Deluxe about 6 months ago, and it seemed to work OK.  About a week ago, my computer started to become sluggish and barely usable. It turns out that Norton (ns.exe) would begin to run uncontrollably (37% of an 8 core i7 processor).  It would also increase memory usage to over 90% cause the computer to page memory to the hard drive.  I did some searching online, including Norton's community, and saw that Norton had this same issue earlier this year and claimed that it had been fixed.  Some online users claimed that their CPUs or CPU fans failed due to the non-stop running caused by Norton.  I refuse to spend my free time debugging someone else's software, so the easiest thing for me to do was to uninstall Norton and then install a product that works.  Kaspersky in this case.Someone from Norton may offer to "help" debug, but it is not worth my time.  Don't bother with this software,

title: Software Library is the pits

body: Software Library is the pits.  I will never buy anything from Amazon again if it involves that library.  I had already purchased Norton , which is non-refundable, so I went ahead and downloaded the software.  I am now going to delete it.  This is nothing more than an attempt to get you to buy more junk that you don't need.  There are some items on Amazon that I have been happy with but unless I can just buy the software without the library download amazon will lose that sale.I had Trend but decided to try Norton because it was a little less money.  Since I am using Norton now for the first time I can't say how good it is so the one star is for Amazon and the software library download.

author: CBHan
title: Useless (in my opinion) for iPad, iPhone
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Don't be misled: if you are an iPad or iPhone user, the ONLY thing this will do is Anti-Theft (audible device sound "scream", locate device, chat with whoever has your device) and Contacts Backup. This will NOT have ANY antivirus feature for iOS.Per my conversation with Norton Help Chat Rep before I canceled and got reimbursed:(note: his words verbatim)"1. I would like to inform you that Norton program for iOS will only have Anti Theft feature and Contacts backup feature in it.2. Scan feature is not available for iOS only.3. Your iOS device works in closed environment in such a way that it cannot be infected. No security program is available for iOS.4. Unfortunately, at this time, Apple does not provide access to Symantec (or any other mobile security provider) to the parts of the iOS operating system required to extend Norton Mobile Security features and capabilities (like malware protection).5. The Operating System in the iPhone or iPad which is developed by Apple is very secure and they do not allow access to any security program to scan their files. Hence, the scanning feature is not available for Norton Mobile Security in iOS devices."As you know, our contacts backups as well as the "Anti Theft" features, etc. are available for FREE in our iCloud, hence this is useless for iOS.Again, I'm sure it's a great product, just not for iOS users in my opinion. The product description with Amazon and on Norton's website are very misleading with the features you will get but actually don't get.

Thanks Norton!

title: Norton product and customer service is always best

body: I was having 122 days remaining on my current Norton subscription but before buying this product I called Norton customer care and explained my situation that i do not want to loose 122 days.They said they will add 122 days to my new subscription. so while talking with Norton cusomer care i bought this product and provided my new 25 digit key and they gave 488 days of subscription right away to my account. So guys before buying this product and if you are current Norton user and have XXX days remaining on your current subscription firstly call Norton customer care and ask whether they will add up the days before buying this product.

title: Antivirus without Backup Utility...WHY!!!!!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Extremely disappointed with Norton. The advertisement/explanations/photos are ambiguous. I am trying to understand if Norton wants to protect me, why sell antivirus software without the backup utility. I am not safe unless my data is backed up as well. I spent $25 on the antivirus software to find out that the backup utility is on another product that I would have happily purchased had I understood the game. Since Norton doesn't sell just the backup utility (I AM SHOCKED!), now I have to upgrade and spend $45 more. I just wasted $25 and I am EXTREMELY annoyed. But no worries, the positive thing is that this will be the last opportunity that I will be tricked by Norton.

body: Be careful with this!  If you are adding this to protect you in 2017, be aware that this particular version is NOT for Windows 10. When I installed it at the Norton website it gave me an "Issue Found" prompt that my Windows 10 system was NOT protected!  So I just spent $35 on software that does me absolutely no good for the next 366 days.  WHY are they even selling this without making it explicitly clear that it does NOT provide protection for the latest PCs and Mac operating systems?  This is upsetting.Norton Security Deluxe 5 Device PC/Mac

title: Issues with Windows 10 , norton is getting more intrusive, CPU hog has returned

body: Does not work with Windows 10. After installing on Windows 10, Windows 10 cannot complete Windows Updates successfully.  Have tried to uninstall and reinstall Norton on Windows 10 and the issue still occurs .Also this version of Norton seems to be more intrusive than earlier versions.  The only way to disable all the norton warnings is to enable all the Norton features.There is no way to control the scheduling of full system scans resulting in 100% CPU at unexpected times. Only way to clear Norton 100%CPU is to reboot.

body: It does what it's supposed to. More features than I need and occasionally this uses more CPU than I would want, but usually runs efficiently in the background. Consistent and effective give malware detections based on several well respected independent lab tests. American company was a purchase point since many products are produced by foreign companies in foreign countries. Depends what you trust I guess. Have used Norton for several years without a hitch. Haven't​ever had to use the customer service, but if you think you may need help installing or configuring, I would recommend buying software from the Symantec (Norton) website to get access to product  support.

author: Russ Miller
title: This product will not install on my Windows 7 PC
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have used Norton Internet Security and then Norton Security on my windows 7 PC for years.  This week I renewed my subscription and downloaded the latest Norton Security, and it failed to install correctly.  In addition to following all the instructions on the Norton website for this eventuality (basically uninstall/reinstall)  I have now spent over 2 hours watching Norton tech support specialist attempt and fail to install the product on my PC in remote control session where I just watch.  They are obviously following a script, because there are long pauses with nothing taking place and then a flurry of obvious steps (most of which I have already done a dozen times) followed by a reboot.None of the steps taken by two different Norton tech support specialists were successful.  I do not intend to spend another hour observing while Norton tries and fails to install their product on my PC.  I want my $ back. I am disgusted with myself for spending hours on this.

author: John P. Ouvrier
title: Buyer beware- you're buying only a 3 day trail version.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I had Norton a few years ago.  Now, from Amazon it won't load properly.  Here in the USA, paid my $40.00, followed directions, and 3 days later my Norton, that had loaded successfully says, "My trail period is up", and when I go to the site, they want $100.00 to give me a package I didn't order.  Unable to connect with them, and their operators are supposedly available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.  Another screen asked me to re-enter my code, to which I did, and it says 'my code is in use with another system'.  It's the same computer.  Now looking at all the complaints, all the answers are a generic reply, "We are so sorry..."  This is not selling the product, but charging you $40 for a free trail.  This is wrong.  Reversing charges ASAP.

author: DenisK
title: Not trusted anymore.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I hate to write this review but I want to warn customers that Symantec is locking down their product to be used in the specific geographic region. It's not advertised and you experience the issue only once you try to install and activate a licensed copy on a computer in a different country, for example on a parents computer like I did. I was purchasing a set of 5 licenses from year to year to protect computers of my family, but this year it stopped working. Symantec support offered to pay extra 25% of the product price to get a key that can be activated everywhere. Why it is not advertised on the product description that it can be used in US only. And Symantec is asking to pay more. I would call it a robbery. I'm sorry to see that vendor I trusted for so many years can't be trusted any more.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Norton protection for mobile devices is vaporware.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Don't waste time with this.  Among other things, the "Protect you mobile devices" claim is pure B.S.  I was expecting mobile antivirus for my iPad and iPhone.  Instead, I get a "Lost Phone Finder" and mobile backup.  As far as anti-virus goes, it's vaporware.  I'd have been better off sticking with Avira for my devices.On my Mac, the Norton Safe Search app is majorly annoying in Safari, and there's no way no way to turn in off.  I'd be halfway through typing an address in the address bar (i.e., amazon.com), and halfway through, the page has redirected to the MacAfee safe search page.  It also redirects the Top Sites page when I open a new tab.  I finally gave up and installed it.  I'm running free Avira on my mac now.As far as Windows, I haven't experienced the same headaches, but I don't use windows as much, and the Edge browser in Windows 10 doesn't enable some of those shenanigans.I'm gone back to running Avira on my mobile devices and MacBook.  However, I'll be looking into McAfee and other AV products.  Avira works well, but I want to make sure I have good protection against randsomware.

title: WOW! I decided to get the online version. ...

body: WOW!  I decided to get the online version.  After inserting the code three different times, I clicked on the support.  Support told me I couldn't install, because I had a worm in my computer.  The fix would cost $299.00 to cover four devices.  They worked in my laptop, and then, when they started on my desktop, he said he would call back this morning at 9:00 AM.  My Norton on the desktop has expired today.  The code Norton gave me won't work on my desktop, either.  The company on Norton support is ITT Teckbrigade LLC..  The time is 10:00AM.  DO YOU THINK I GOT RIPPED OFF?  DURN TOTTEN' !

author: Bertie
title: No interest in its customers only in their money
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I bought it in the US and tried to install and activate it in the US. Norton would not let me because they said it was the wrong product. Tried to get a refund via Amazon only to find it is not refundable. Assigned to work temporarily in Europe and needed antivirus because just 8 days until expiration so I paid for an automatic renewal - Euro89.99. Tried to activate it but was again not permitted to activate by Norton. Called customer support in US on September 20 and after saying he would give 50% back the agent finally agreed to refund the Euro89.99 in full and to install the Norton Security Deluxe I had already paid for via Amazon on my computer. It took the agent 4 hours 45 minutes WITH REMOTE ACCESS TO MY COMPUTER to accomplish this and only after charging me a further $22.99 (having quoted $22.00 mind you) and requiring that I pay this IN ADDITION to the $19.99 I already paid on September 11, 2017 for the exact same product. This company appears to have no interest in its customers, only in squeezing every last cent it possibly can out of them.

author: Charles C.
title: Buy At Your Own Peril - You've been warned!!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Friends warned me to stay away from NORTON, but unfortunately I had to learn the hard way.After installing Norton, it made its presence known by immediately attacking the software I already had installed on your PC. I'm talking about software that I had been using for years which had caused no problems. When I finally got that software restored (which took over an hour), I discovered Norton had rewarded me further by damaging several data files that had been deemed as "dangerous" which in reality represented hundreds of man hours of my personal work. Guess what? I had to devote several hundred MORE man hours to replace those files!!God forbid you ever try to install NEW SOFTWARE. Norton will severely punish you for even thinking that. It's not like PCs were actually built for using software or anything ....This morning, I reached the end of my rope after trying to run a Music Creation Software which informed me of an update. Norton determined that the update was evil and punished it accordingly. Sadly for me, the software license file got damaged and I'm going to have to pay $50 for another copy of that software. This Norton package seemed like a good deal at the time, but I've actually paid for it several times over when factoring in all the lost time, the extreme levels of irritation, and the damaged software I've had to replace.Ironic how Norton labels various files and software as "dangerous" and "evil" which actually Norton is the evil one. It's like a Trojan Horse - which is what it should've been named from the start. I can think of better names, but those would probably get my review deleted.Don't buy this software, you can certainly find better ways to waste your money - like at a slot machine or on a good drunk.

body: Oh how my computer had lusted. Its motherboard swelled with desire for the changes it had started to feel. Such unfamiliar pulsing, and such unknown buzzing. My poor computer was turned on, and I knew at that point, it was a man. I gave it, "the talk" but it spent some time with a floozy and got electrogonorrhea. Fortunately Norton took care of all of that! Now if Norton could just get me some friends so I have something other than awkward amazon reviews to fill out!

author: Melanie Bueltmann
title: DO NOT BUY! GET ESET!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Do not buy this product! Please! I was stupid enough to try to download a free game onto my computer and my computer slowed down big time. I knew my computer had viruses, but Norton detected NOTHING WAS WRONG, WHICH IS A BIG FAT LIE! I then deleted Norton off my computer, found a program called SpyHunter, which said that it removed things but it didn't. Deleted that program, and put Norton back on. My computer, a HP has been super slow, couldn't restart and was freezing up. I took it into STLOnsite, kudos to them they removed 1 Trojan, Malware and 75 Unknown programs and thankfully all of my files were still in tact. If you are looking for a great Antivirus, BUY ESET! Eset is used by schools, businesses, attorneys, people like that. So please, do your self and your computer a huge favor, and don't waste your money on a so-called 'Anti-Virus' when so many viruses were over rided by Norton.

author: Mark
title: Requires constant and very stable online connection to work, doesn't play well with satellite internet
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Even if you’ve updated the latest "live update," Norton Security requires a constant connection with the Norton server to run a scan on your computer. If you don’t have a very stable internet connection — as I don’t because I’m on a satellite connection — it fails and will not run a scan for more than a few seconds without telling you that you must reboot. I spent time with a Norton rep remotely connected to my computer and he came to the same conclusion that the software simply won't work with my satellite connection, which occasionally has minor drops, although it plays videos and allows pretty much any other online activity. If you’re on broadband, I’m sure Norton will be fine.

body: I've been a Norton fanboy several years now. Owned Norton since 2001 till this day. I renew the service yearly without a doubt. I work as an IT consultant and travel abroad almost every 2 months for about 3 weeks or more. Norton has jumped in the regional licencing bandwagon. I was able to activate the product without an issue, but even if the product is activated and I travel outside the US. The product will automatically expire and will leave my computer totally unprotected. Called Norton and they tell me that cant do anything about it. What is a purpose of an antivirus software  that wont keep me protected where ever I go? I will definitely not purchase Norton again. Keep away if you travel outside the US with your laptop!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Adding remaining days from your old subscription is easy.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This is how I have handled renewing my product through Amazon last year and this year. Once I get my product key, I go to the icon for Norton on my desktop and click on renew. Then click on "I have a key or code to enter". It will say 366 days remaining. I then go to the "?help" button on my Norton and select "get support". You are then directed to the Norton website. At the bottom of the screen, click on "contact us" under "contact support". Click on the "chat now" button under "chat live". I then ask the support person to add on however many days are remaining on my last subscription. This takes about 2 minutes and then you are done. I then go to my other devices and click on my Norton icon and it will say something like there is an updated key for this product and just click through all the prompts.

author: HiTekRedNek
title: Norton 360 Repackaged!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: What does Norton Security Deluxe do that Norton 360 does not? It offers you $4.15 worth of extra protection in hopes that you will automatically renew, and do not notice that it is going to increase anywhere from $10-20, as was the case with Norton 360. First, if you have an older Norton program, you must have it uninstalled, which the new program will do for you, but it will take up time. The interface of the program is still identical to the Norton 360 program, it features the same type of protection that was offered with Norton 360, and there is no difference in speed, options, or features that this so-called new protection software offers, that was not offered with Norton 360. Why is it that Norton, as well as Amazon, waste the customer's time with introducing the same product under a new name, with the same old features that it had before? The only thing that might be worthy, is that it is now offered $10 cheaper than it was, but if you bought it before the decrease, you are not offered a refund of the difference!

author: 38ChevyGuy
title: SCAM-maybe not
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This is  scam.  I had Norton previously installed, with at least 18 months left on the subscription. Instead of adding time on to the existing subscription as it should have, this POS uninstalled my previous version and put in a new version with only 12 months length.  DO NOT PURCHASE!REVISION: Changed from one star to four..... When I finally got time to contact Support, (they don't make it easy to find the Chat option), we determined that Norton has changed the names of their products, and I had inadvertently purchased the wrong product to add to my subscription.  When you download something other than what is already installed, the installation will remove your old product before adding the new.  My bad, but Norton does change the names of their products almost every year, so it is difficult to determine exactly what to buy.  To their credit, the Norton Support rep helped me remove my product and she installed a new (upgraded) product and gave me the correct number of days.  This whole process took nearly 1.5 hours on a chat line, however.  Moral of story:  When purchasing a "special deal" to extend your subscription, make absolutely  sure you are purchasing the correct product.  Norton:  Really, it should not have to be this hard!

I bought and attempted to update my Norton and after waiting several minutes for the application to remove my old software and install the new software, the new software would not download.  So I bought the Premiere version from Symantec directly and my software works fine now.  However, now I'm stuck with this version and cannot get refunded even though I never downloaded this software into any of my devices.  I'm not happy about this.

author: JAPT
title: Beware if you intend to use in the US and outside of the US
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Do not buy this license form Amazon if you intend to use it on Computers in the US and out of the US. Norton will not allow this license to be installed on a PC our of the US. Norton will force you to buy directly from them this same license if you want it to work in other countries as well as the US. There should be a disclaimer on the product page stating this limitation. Also, This seems to be a new practice by Norton, since I have bought this same license in previous years, and it has worked fine worldwide. Shame on Norton!!

author: Dravid
title: Region Code
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: For 7 years running, I have been a loyal Norton customer. I used my multiple device subscription to activate my license here in the US and for my father who resides in Asia. This year, it only activated my device here and not that of my father because the license is no longer valid in another region.There are numerous good security packages in the market and I have stuck with Norton all along, despite it being more expensive than the competition. But the regional restriction is the last straw. I will now switch to another security package that doesn't have the hassle of such regional restrictions. Norton, you have just lost a 7-year old customer.Separate from the regional issue, I had one month remaining on my Norton subscription in the US and instead of adding/stacking to my existing subscription time, Norton reset the clock so there is only a total of 12 months (rather than 13 months (1 +12)). Tw0 strikes, and unfortunately you are now out Norton!

author: Linda Lee
title: CHEATS!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I will never deal with Norton ever again.  This item proved to be a total failure.  I tried to load onto my desktop and I got a message that it couldn't download.  (Never have had any problems downloading anything from Amazon).  I contacted Norton and got this guy who remotely got on my computer to try to help me download but was unable.  He then went somewhere in the computer to start checking some things out and then proceeded to tell me that my computer had been hacked, etc. etc.  Then he told me that he would have to forward my problem to some technical team so that they could go in my computer to correct all the problems and I would be charged for the services.  At that point I told him to forget it.  I wasn't about to spend hundreds of dollars for nothing.  I started looking on line and found out that companies will do or say that just so they can charge you more money.  I don't believe he was telling me the truth and the fact is that I haven't had any problems with my computer and there's absolutely no sign that I've been hacked by anyone.  It's been over a year and I've not seen any problems with any of my credit accounts or anything on my computer.  My bank account shows no sign of anything happening to it, so I think that my computer was never tampered with at all.  I'm just out for the cost of the download... I'll never deal with them ever again!!!!!

author: Ric from NJ
title: You Will Lose Subscription Time
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: If this is not a renewal, then no problem. If, however, you want to extend an existing subscription be aware that this will give you a new license number so if you have any time left in your old number it will be lost as soon as you activate the new one. I only lost one month, but the smart thing to do is buy this and wait until you only have a day or two left in your current subscription, then activate the new one.If you choose to renew your license using the link INSIDE the software, time will be added to your current subscription so although you'll probably pay more, you won't lose any time.

author: Alex CK
title: Attention International Overseas Amazon Digital Downloads Customers, READ THIS
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton & Amazon changed the rules of the game with regards to regional download software.I had been a Norton user for over 15 years, and I love the productsThe review it’s not to criticize either Norton or Amazon, it’s only for you to be aware that an Amazon/Norton digital download may not work in your country.I bought the digital download of this software, in years pass I used to download it directly from Amazon, install it,  and copy and paste my key.Now, the download will not be in Amazon. There is a shortcut that takes you to Norton (Symantec) directly, you will introduce you existing (or make a new one) Norton account.Then it will ask you for the key.In my case I am on a trip in Central America, when I introduced the key, it was not validated because I was in another region.In another words, Norton it’s now region specific like the old DVDsFortunately Norton decided to help me with this problem on a browser chat, and they issued a new key for it to be valid.  But you better know what you are doing, or you will suffer.

body: I live in Egypt but my shipping address is in the USA .While buying Norton I only received a brief warning about wrong region and when I corrected my shipping address I proceeded without problems. After installing and while trying to activate I discovered that this key is only valid in the USA. After some research, I know now that there are new geographical restrictions with Norton products which weren't emphasized neither by Norton nor by Amazon. Amazon doesn't offer a refund option and Norton suggested a very complicated and lengthy return procedure that might or might not work. I just threw away 40.USD.

author: Marcus-NY
title: Symantec (Norton) is becoming a spammy, intrusive company. I am considering changing to a different product.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I work in technology and have been using Symantec/Norton for over a decade. I have found the product to be mostly reliable, but I can't say it's 100% reliable, as I've had to use other antivirus scanners/spyware and rootkit scanners to catch things that Norton has missed. Recently, this company has started an onslaught of spamming where their installed product would pop-up with offers, invites to sign up for beta products and repeated mailings staying I am "not protected" (referring to there be no installation of a subscription that they already know has either expired or cancelled and showing their are other products that I'm subscribed to that are installed and active.) This company has repeatedly demonstrated incompetence in  that despite calling and emailing them that I don't need this "not protected" reminders and to modify their systems to be more intelligent about when they are sent out (that is check that the customer is using another subscription), they still send them out.

author: AnthonyNYC
title: Norton is an Invasive, Obtrusive, Nuisance of a Program
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Was a Norton user for many, many years.  I'm done now.  In Win 10 you are forced into configuring the program the way IT wants you to.  You don't want browser protection you say?  Norton will bother you with a warning every single day.  The red "You Are At Risk" warning will not go away.  The program does not allow a user that PAID for it to configure it as needed.  YOU MUST COMPLY with NORTON'S wishes or you will be bothered endlessly by popups and warnings and little red X's.  Turn browser protection on and just be done with it, you say?  Well then, expect a Norton tab to periodically invade your browser.  Digital NUISANCE.  Call support, you suggest?  Incompetent people who don't even know the program well enough.  Ask them a simple question...they have to look it up.  Completely and permanently done with NORTON!  Looking for a program next year that will not hassle me for configuring it to my own needs.  Absolute digital nightmare here.

author: AmNoMore
title: Amazon + Norton = Massive Unnecessary Headache!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I am writing because I'm annoyed with Amazon and Norton!  I've used Norton for years with generally good results, as in, no viruses, but software that is bloated and clunky.  My Amazon experiences have been overwhelmingly good, but not today!My now-former Norton subscription expires in 2 days.  Norton tends to charge higher prices to customers at renewal.  (Why?)  This product would cost $10 more if I went thru the renewal process.  It's also set up for automatic yearly subscription renewal.  Decided to purchase thru Amazon.Everything on Amazon says the Game and Software Downloader is a must.  The Downloader would not allow an "Advanced" download, only the "Basic" which puts the files where Amazon wants.  Did  that, only to discover it was unnecessary!  Norton products download thru Norton, which is shown in tiny print in the Orders Info.Downloaded via Norton with no problem, although the process to remove the old product and install the new took forever.  Restarted per instructions.  The new Norton shows PC is AT RISK in bright red letters, but it doesn't tell you HOW it is at risk!  This has been a problem with Norton that I've provided feedback on for several years.  The "risk" is that updates are needed.  Why can't it just say that?Uninstalled the Amazon Games & Software Downloader before writing this review.  Overall wasted about 90 minutes on what should have taken 30 minutes at most!Not a happy amazon or Norton customer today!

author: Shaeyna
title: Terrible Product & Even Worse Customer Support.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This product is AWFUL. I bought it yesterday from well-known retail store. Installed in the same day. I have purchased Norton on several occasions and have also been more than satisfied with it. This Security "Deluxe" is anything but. I contacted the store and shared my complaints. I told them I would like to return it. They told me they couldn't accept a return because it is on a copyright. That is ridiculous. The package doesn't even include a piece of software:  it has to be downloaded from the Internet with a key number that is provided on a piece of paper inside the package. The "update" is equally ridiculous. The entire update time is about 1 minute or less. What can the program possibly protect with a 1 minute or less download and install. I got online to Norton via chat with my issues. They gave me generic responses that were useless. I finally asked if this program functions via the cloud, rather than via updates to my computer. I was told yes - it functions via the cloud - and I am no fan of cloud functions. The back of the box stated that the product has a 60-day money back guarantee. How is it then that a retail establishment refuses to refund the charge, and Symantec's online chat refuses to provide assistance in getting the refund, or even mentioning its existence when a customer says the product is not acceptable and wants a refund. This experience destroys any of my previous good feelings and trust in Norton Security.

author: Big shopper
title: Perpetually uses 90% of my CPU capacity!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: September 17, 2017Was able to uninstall and reinstall.It has gotten WORSE.Now Norton Security uses 83%-91% of my CPU. Has completely choked up the computer.September 14, 2017I can't uninstall it! It gets stuck on the screen " preparing to uninstall"Said it would take two minutes to do so. It is been over 20 minutes!Norton is like a bad cancer you can't get rid of.And I'm supposed to trust this incompetent bunch of morons for my computer's security?***I can't wait until this subscription expires so I can switch to another app.I clicked TaskManager to learn that 87% of my CPU is being used on "Norton security"What on earth is it doing?Nothing else can run.I thought it was temporary.  One evening I decided to let Norton security run all night hoping the CPU gluttony would end. Over 12 hours later and it was still running at over 80% CPU usage.What PC you can run with  Norton security eating up all it's CPU capacity.And I am to trust the security of my PC with such an incompetent app?

author: schaumal
title: Buy Bitdefender
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Buy Bitdefender. I truly believe that Norton is a very good security product. And, this is actually a very good deal (5 devices, etc.) if it works. It didn't work for me -- not at all. It would absolutely not install (Windows 10). I contacted Norton Support. I was told what to do. Even though I had already done those things, I did them again. No dice. The Support Rep. asked me to give over remote access to my computer. I did this (I was absolutely desperate). For more than an hour the Rep tried to remotely install the software. I watched. Pretty terrifying. After an hour, I was told that the issue needed to be "escalated" and that someone who know more would contact me "on Monday" when the qualified people come to work. No one contacted me, and, to be honest, I was relieved because I don't like giving control of my computer to someone far off who doesn't actually speak my language very well. It's uncomfortable. It seems to me that a person should be able to install security software that he/she has purchased. Right? I wish luck to anyone who can't resist this good deal, but I recommend Bitdefender. I am asking for a refund. We'll see.

author: Chuck Thomas
title: Not Windows 10 compatable.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have used Norton for many, many years and loved it.  It IS NOT compatible with windows 10. Don't listen to what Norton says, listen to those who tried to use it. Zero customer support . Firewall loads "Sometimes"  "Identity safe" loads and works "Sometimes".  When the firewall doesn't load you can right click to enable it but it's already enabled. You must click disable (which it already is) then re-enable it for it to work.  Uninstalling and reinstalling does nothing but waste your time. Not to mention good luck if you bought the download for 1 computer. You download it then need to uninstall and re-install. To bad, you already installed this product. Good luck reaching Norton.

author: knightspeed
title: Hopefully it will uninstall easily as I have read can be hard to get ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have used products from this company literally for decades but the one I bought last year will be the last.  I wanted to “wipe” a hard drive and could not find anything within this program to do this so I went to the Symantec site to find a program that would.  Foolishly I thought this would be a safe place to download software but after downloading it I found it had changed the names of my virtual drives.  I never ran the program and tried to change the names of the virtual drives back to no avail.  I started a chat with a tech and even though I related the problem exactly before we started, he took ¾ hour going back and forth and taking control of my computer to tell me that he would not work on any non-Symantec software.  I couldn’t believe it!  Also Identity Safe’s memory is getting disorientated as it will occasionally forget a login and password.  The last straw was when the program started popping up ads on my desk top last year.  Some time ago I bought an additional computer and am running Windows Defender and Last Pass, both at no cost, with fewer problems than I have had with Norton.  So when you expire, it’s Goodbye!  Hopefully it will uninstall easily as I have read can be hard to get rid of.

author: Jim
title: 3) While it is great to have multiple devices under a single license
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Straight up - - -I don't have this version of the product.Yet, I find flaws in the depiction of the capability as it operates in a personal environment.1) Beware - Windows 10 (build 1511) users. This product (at least w/Amazon) does not list this platform as a OS which is supported.2) The footprint (the amount of resources required to perform its job) has always been excessive. Other products require less resources, make the same promises and provide the needed support.3) While it is great to have multiple devices under a single license, most OEM and pre-packaged OSs provide a on-going solution to anti-virus/anti-malware products; all of which are robust and under perpetual licenses.For history:My last exposure to Norton was way back in the day, when I wanted to use what I perceived then, as a premier product for protection. The platform(s) I've always used have been MS, and the one where I went was XP Pro (tells my age). Their price for a single installation at that time was almost $500. Others of course, including MS, was giving it away for free.So, don't look a gift horse in the mouth. The on-going support for this product appears to be somewhat lacking in the world today.Just an opinion based on past experience (personal and business).Oh, McAfee is has the largest footprint of all large corporation products of this type and is the most invasive to your system; laying eggs everywhere so that removal requires a far larger time than everything else on the market (took me more than 6 hours to remove it completely from my system.)

author: David Brown
title: Do not waste your money
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I am a computer repair guy, been in the business since 1984.  Paid antivirus on modern versions of Windows is a waste, and Norton is the worst among them.  I just got done with a customer machine that took 12 minutes to boot.  It turned out to be a Norton issue for which they wanted me to run their 'removal tool'.  This tool takes an hour to run.  Then Norton re-installed, which took another 30 minutes.  After this, the customer's paid subscription no longer was recognized, Norton said it was in it's trial period.  A Norton technician took control and again ran the 'removal tool' which took another hour.  Then they reinstalled, and patched and updated Norton.  It is now working, but I cannot charge the customer for 4 hours I worked on this.  At my rate, that is 12 times the cost of this stupid product.  I run Windows Defender on all my personal systems.  It is free, updated often and quietly, and has never crashed a system.  Most important to me, it does not bog down the system like Norton products do.  Stay away from these.  Anecdotally, I met Peter Norton back in the 80's.  Nice guy but sadly has not been a part of the procuts that bear his name for many years.

author: Dude
title: Just an opinion
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Is what it is

author: Shopper
title: UPDATE: Norton refunded my money!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: UPDATE:  I contacted Norton and since I was in the 60-day money back guarantee window, they processed a refund.  Was an easy process via chat to get it done.ORIGINAL REVIEW:  Slowed my computers (a HP Notebook and a MacBook Pro) to a CRAWL.  So bad that I uninstalled only 2 hours after I paid for a 2-year subscription for 5 devices. That's right, it was so bad I just took the loss of $100 rather than keep it on my machines another minute!The slowdown was immediate and dramatic.  I thought I was back using a dial-up modem, but I was on a  75/75 mps connection!  Doing my research too late, I found forum after forum, going back years, complaining that Norton is bloated and will grind your OS to a halt. Apparently, most newer operating systems, both PC and Mac, already come with very good security installed. And if you need more, there are low-cost or free programs that will not interfere with the speed of your OS.BTW -- I purchased my copy directly from the Norton site and had a clean install on both machines.  The problem is the product.  It is just old, clunky, and buggy.  There are MUCH better alternatives out there for no or little money.

author: John
title: Too many popups from Norton Security
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: The software does its job but it bombards you with messages almost every time you use your computer trying to get you to use features you have purposely chosen not to use. There appears to be no way to stop them. I have turned off all the notifications I can but still I get messages such as that the network is not encrypted, that I am not using all the features of the product, and asking if I want to optimize my computer right now. I also get messages that the software is performing "background tasks". I turned off all background tasks. I don't want the software scanning my computer when it is idle or "optimizing" it. Seems to be no way to stop these annoying messages. It's a form of spam when you constantly have to close windows with these messages.

author: Rich Man
title: Every time I had a problem with my PC I ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Every time I had a problem with my PC I had to talk to someone in India or somewhere. They spoke English but I still had trouble understanding them, very frustrating.Then after several years Norton charges me for a new up date that I did not order, they had my credit card number from several years ago when I used Norton. I had to call the company to tell them to reimburse me plus to be safe I told the credit card company that I did not order the product and didn't want to pay for it.After my experiences I don't think I will ever buy Norton again.

author: ~anthony
title: Excellent Product. The Only complaint is can think of ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Excellent Product.  The Only complaint is can think of is the Exceedingly Horrific Documentation - which seems to be the 'de-facto' standard for almost all technology products...  Save Perhaps CISCO~!  Even the Simplest Things are not documented so you can wander for hours looking and trying... and even when you try...  you never know... if that was the correct solution or understanding or NOT...  Example:  In past versions of Norton (ie Internet Security) You could schedule "FULL Scans" and See WHEN They Were Scheduled...  as well as allow Scans, both partial Hi-Value likely attack area scans and FULL Scans to be run anytime the machine is at 'rest'  in the New "Security Deluxe 2016"  You do not SEE The Item and the Scheduled to Run When...  they have automated it .... IAm fairly SURE...  they do not say...  I would prefer to be able to SEE my Settings...  and I WOULD REALLY DEMAND to be able to KNOW - from decent documentation - what is going on with the software I paid Good Money to Utilize~!  Grrrrrr  ~anthony  With The Availability of  fairly comprehensive "AI" and "Search" there IS NO Excuse for Good to Great Full Documentation of Any Product...  NONE~!  ...and If anyone offers a decent competing product WITH such documentation I will go~!  There if for NO OTHER REASON than to PUNISH Norton and the others who so behave, even if it is INCONSEQUENTIAL...  but you never know, like with LONG DISTANCE and Pay Cable TV Subscriptions, when a GroundSwell will indeed PUNISH bad, and arrogant behavior~!

author: Michael Kerner
title: Oversecure
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: These days, it has been more of a battle of the brand name in regards to finding the right security software protection with trying to protect and help your computer. As a result, many people have chosen to pick brand names over service. While I have at one point used brands like McAfee and Norton for protecting my computer from any viruses or spam. I did because it worked well back than. But now and then, it doesn't actually work as strongly as it has claimed to have worked, and that has left more of vulnerability than met the eye. That hasn't changed, and with Norton Security Deluxe, it has had the same flaws where it doesn't work strongly, and takes too much room on my computer hard drive to where it doesn't run as smoothly as my computer once did. As a result, I removed the program, and switched back to Bitdefender which worked more flawlessly on my computer, and didn't clutter it with any faults. Overall, if you really have the office space on your computer, than you'll really want to get more of a brand name like Norton. But if you really want a product that delivers well at protecting your computer, go somewhere else like Vipre or Bitdefender.Price: DConvenience & Setup: C-Overall: D+

author: L. Bowman
title: Save yourself grief and pain - simply put: use another product
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I purchased this software via download and installed it on a less than one month old HP Pavillion notebook type PC.  About two weeks following installation I clicked on the recommended system scan (a complete scan was carried out as part of the installation).  As this process could take place with other processes running, I started Google Chrome and logged in to Gmail.  The machine completely locked up when I attempted to open my second e-mail message.  The first had been a simple text-only.From a friend who worked 20+ years in IT support laughed when I mentioned this event.  He then mentioned handling numerous help desk requests associated with just this product.  I've used the Kaspersky product for just under three years on another, desktop computer.  I had intended to delete that and install Norton as part of the five device license.  Hindsight being 20/20, I intend to renew/extend the license with Kaspersky on the desktop and cancel Norton - and install Kaspersky - on the notebook.

author: Mr. Miles
title: Norton Security - The Gold Standard Antivirus
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton Security has always been, and will continue to remain the gold standard for computer protection. I made this purchase after having a discount due to buying TurboTax for the 2015 year. (Hopefully next year the deal will be the same so I can continue with Norton!).The scans are very fast, and more than once Norton has drummed up some malware and risks that other software may have missed. You can always go with a free anti-virus, however, keep in mind that you will always be at more risk for something happening, and the updates will not be as frequent to stay at the very head of any new malware or virus' that are developed. I've never had any issues with the product, so I suppose there is not much else to say other than 'it works!'I've found that the product works for me, and the fact that this package includes 5 devices is a huge bonus!

author: JLO
title: Superb product to date. Best of the best.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Superb product to date. I've been using Norton protection since 1991, have experienced many hack attempts that Norton blocked and informed of (web browsing drive-bys, hack emails, hack email attachments, hacked files, invasive freeware/shareware app downloads, etc), and have not had a successful hack or invasion to date.As a Microsoft software engineer since '93, I currently operate 36 workstations (6 machines and 30 virtual machines), and have found that Norton has always seamlessly allowed me to work. Personally, I always configure the firewall in full manual mode, since I need and want to know what's talking.Based on my personal 23 years of usage, Norton has done a superb job, and is a best of the best type product.

author: Dave
title: Easy to Renew, Easy to Use, Easy to Update
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: There is no easier way to update your existing Norton Security software.  Buy it, enter the code, and then you have another year.  It really is that simple.The product itself is also good.  There isn't a noticeable slow down of performance, even when Norton is doing it's full virus sweep.  It has the option to just have it run at a certain time, like during the workday.  I won't be home, and it is done when I get home.  It updates often, and requires little to no interaction.  Norton also scan and new files you download for viruses.It's simple to use, and works well.  It's very affordable, and that means peace of mind can be had cheap.  I recommend Norton Antivirus to everyone who is using a PC online.

author: lala
title: LOVE  Norton!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have had Norton now for years. However I purchased a new computer last year and it came with another brand free for 6 months, so I decided to cancel Norton and try that new brand (Webroot). Big mistake, the "new brand" does not compare to Norton, my computer was super slow, gave me lots of problems that I did  not have when I had W.  I went back to my Norton Deluxe and... what a difference.  My computer immediately was fast and it stopped giving me any problems.  It can be that it was just my computer that had an issue with the change, but... I felt I needed to  review.

author: maurice
title: Rip off do not buy it
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: i tried to  download load Norton it started to download and then it stop  and a popup came up  and  told me to call this  800  # so to be able to  finish the download.  so i call  Norton Agent spoke to me  and said he would  have to enter my computer to finish install it so i said ok  and i gave him permission i  so then he tell me that i would need a upgrade to be able to download  and now it would cost me $299.00 instead of $29.99  now it seem i am stuck paying $29.99 and i can not download it  I do not see a return key with this product  { and it was not download }  so i guest i suck paying $29.99

author: nocos
title: Reduces bandwidth, otherwise light and unobtrusive (unlike earlier versions)!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I remember that time 5-6 years ago when Norton had become a massive resource hog and used to mess up PCs badly. After using the program for a few weeks recently, I am happy to say that those days are gone. Its protection is solid (Symantec, however, doesn't participate in most leading independent lab tests, such as those run by AV-Comparatives, Virus Bulletin, ICSA Labs, etc.). Norton's SONAR system appears excellent, although in terms of detection rates, the program is behind the likes of Kaspersky and Bitdefender. Symantec would argue that independent labs run static tests, but AV-Comparatives, for instance, runs a comprehensive real-world test too. This, of course, is not the reason why I no longer use Norton Security, since I like the program. It reduced my upload and download speed (particularly my upload speed, which was nearly cut in half). Tweaking did not help and I opted for another AV solution.

author: AJ
title: Avoid
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: All their products are totally focused around their ads to sell you more of their products. This is by far the most annoying security software I have ever used. To make matters worse they refused to delete my account. They will apparently retain your personal information forever! Furthermore, they told me to click on unsubscribe to stop getting their emails but there is no unsubscribe on their website or in their emails. I am done with Norton products.

author: Binary Techie
title: Great price on a reliable old friend
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Despite some criticism about problems with a few versions a decade ago, I'm glad I stuck with this. In combination with my other security measures, this has been the best protection I could get.Among other measures, I use complex randomly generated password, created, encrypted and stored with RoboForm from Siber Systems and every login gets a unique password. RoboForm has NEVER had any vulnerabilities found in its 18 year history. This can be confirmed in the database kept by Secunia.I also use Secunia Personal Software Inspector to notify me whenever ANY of my software needs a security update, and I keep everything patched and up-to-date. BTW Secunia is now Flexera Software LLC and it's still FREE.

author: larry smith
title: Amazon price not good
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I count on Amazon to have a good price but I could have just renewed cheaper directly with Norton

author: William T. Prince
title: Keep Coming Back
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've used Norton off and on for many years.  I've tried just about everything else out there, and frankly, each has its pros and cons.  Maybe I'm just picky, but I haven't found one yet that really satisfies me.  However, the fact that I keep coming back to Norton says something.  It's user-friendly, intuitive, and works pretty well.  No, it's not perfect, but it's good enough--and better than a laundry list of others that I've tried.  For most home users, it's certainly more than adequate, and I don't hesitate to recommend it.

author: Matthew Calvin
title: Incredibly Annoying Popups with no easy way to turn off
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This product worked as expected for the purposes of stopping viruses (not sure if any showed up but I didn't get any as far as I can tell). However the entire interface is stupidly frustrating and it constantly steals your attention with special offers and especially as your subscription gets close to the end, annoying reminders to renew. Once it does expire it pops up multiple times a day to nag you to renew. I am not renewing. Instead I'm looking for some other software that will stay out of sight doing its job unless I specifically bring it up. Would not recommend (though, no viruses)

author: J
title: Terrific AV Program
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've been using Norton products since the "Internet Security" version. I definitely love it and do not quite understand where the negative reviews are coming from. It's done what it has advertised to do; I have not had any issues with viruses or mal/spyware since signing onto Norton. Posted, professional reviews (from computer magazines and such) are pretty spot-on with this product; I would highly recommend this AV program.If you are not sure, I recommend their trial versions so you can personally experience. I think, especially if you're in doubt, you'll be pleasantly surprised with how smooth and effective the program is. I am using this program for 5 devices with different operating systems (-2 Windows 10, 1 Windows 7, 2 Vistas).

author: Kirke A.King
title: Unable to install
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I purchased Norton Security Deluxe (3-devices) CD at Fry's Electronics.  I was able to install the Utilities portion but could not install the antivirus software.  After three 'chats' with Norton technicians and one phone call which ended with 'we'll call you back in 2-minutes', the installation problem has never been resolved.  I'm going to eat my losses and try another vendor.

author: J. Arnold
title: I can't get rid of their relentless renewal pop-ups; Stay away!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have had numerous Norton products over the years.  They have seemed to work as well as most, but no better and they often slowed the computer enough that I went to alternatives and let all of my licenses lapse.  Then I got Windows 10.  Despite the fact that I have no active licenses, I get a persistent (as in dozens of times a day) reminder that my Norton 360 product needs to be compatible with Windows 10 and I need to update my product.  I have searched the internet for a solution and have contacted Norton help 5 times (Norton, if you're listening, three of the case numbers were 28138977, 28143884 and 28108457).  I have been very satisfied with products by Kaspersky and iolo (System Mechanic).  I strongly advise against getting tied into Symantec.

author: aqua man
title: Destroys PC performance
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: My experience with Norton anti virus is that it destroys PC performance by slowing the platform to intolerable levels. It has frequent annoying pop ups that display in the middle of anything the you are working on. The turn on, boot and scan time is slow that I have frequently picked up my phone and completed the task before my laptop is even ready to work.The PC is dead. Thanks in part to Norton.My uninstall process is currently at 29 minutes and it’s still generating pop ups telling  me to renew my subscription.I just want to open a spread sheet.So long Symantec.

author: nwsharksfan
title: Good product, horrible customer service.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've had Norton for many years. The product itself is good ... but watch out for autorenewal. My subscription was auto renewed at $113. You can't find a store that sells this product for even half that amount. I contacted their customer service department in India and was told initially that the best they could do is give me a slightly discounted rate and an extra 30 days free. Not until I quoted the Norton website (which says they provide full refunds on autorenewal within 60 days of renewal charge) and threatened to contact the BBB did they agree to give me a refund - but not before being transferred to the "floor manager" who again tried to sell me on the discount. Tip to Norton: don't rip off customers if you wish to keep them. I give 2 stars since the product is good, but established customer apparently are seen as a cash cow instead of valued subscribers.

author: German
title: Slows computer down
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I have norton installed on my laptop and it is the WORST! Not only does it keep bugging me about renewing my subscription it also SLOWED my computer down so much right after the subscription expired! Coincidence I think not! DO NOT BUY! I regret not getting Mcafee they have never let me down. FYI this is a brand new laptop never had any problems until this subscription ended!

author: Mark Allen Frank
title: As much as I would like to have an anti-virus software
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I was excited to see this being offered as part of Prime Day. I remember back on my childhood desktop running Windows XP, Norton was exceptional; however, upon installing the software on my 2016 MacBook Pro, Safari crashed and would not reopen. Opening the monitor revealed that a background program "SymDaemon" was using 312% of my CPU. As much as I would like to have an anti-virus software, the payoff is not worth it. I figure having my computer backed up on an external hard drive and storing all of my files on multiple physical drives and cloud services is peace of mind enough. I find it outrageous that this would normally sell for close to $80 for Deluxe.

author: David S.
title: ... and notifications about all the things it either doesn't like or wants to upsell you
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Popup and Notification NightmareConstantly puts up popups and notifications about all the things it either doesn't like or wants to upsell you. to.  Unless you want to spend a large amount of time each day dealing with Norton (for no real value to anyone beyond to their marketing department) don't buy this product.

author: AndrisN
title: Don't renew, buy new.
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I used to trust norton. Now after renewing i payed $99 instead of $39 for new subscription.an add on was $.9.99 for Norton Tune-Up. I thought it ok relative to $99. But its not a download, its letting someone in indea log onto to your computer and remove temp and browser history. It has to be done by calling an 800 number and enabling remote control of your computer. So I asked for a refund instead. I was transferred around to a supervisor and after a lot of music I was disconnected.So disappointed in this company. They also enroll you in auto renewal $99 now but "current price next year" , could be $200. All if bought as new would likely be $40. Also options are interspersed with tutorial pages to deter your finding them. .Next year Kapersky.

author: Strider
title: Bad Customer Service
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Customer service is horrible.  I had Norton 360 and I upgraded to this product, which is the latest product.  It took me over 90 minutes to upgrade 3 devices (computer, smartphone, and tablet) because customer service was not really sure what they were doing.  Also, I had to speak to 5 different representatives.

author: AnarchyJim
title: Constant false positives, waste of time and money
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This is constantly 'protecting' me from programs I download that are perfectly safe. If the 'intelligence' of their risk assessment is indicative of the product overall, I have zero faith in it. Mostly, it does a good job popping up warnings and dialogs (basically adverts) telling me how safe I am, which then require me to unquarantine programs and emails that are totally safe. Also, occastionally it won't let me un-quarantine them for whatever reason. Complete waste of time and money. I've uninstalled it.I've attached a screen shot of the dialog that shows:#1- It describes the risk as Heur.AdvML.C and labels it a 'heuristic virus' which sounds scary and looks like a virus name. It's not. It's a Norton code for their 'artificial intelligence'. If this is how smart AI is, it's going to be a long time before the bots take over the world.#2: the crimes against humanity that this piece of software (A video plugin from Digital Anarchy) committed that got it quarantined: Reason 1- Less than 50 people in the Norton community had downloaded it and Reason 2- it had been on the server longer than 4 months. That's it. Ridiculous. (Actually this happens constantly... usually with the same reasons)Yes, I realize I can turn off 'Heuristic Intelligence' that's buried in the settings. However as mentioned, if the level of 'intelligence' is similar for the other features, this is garbage. And given the same problems with the email scanner, there's no reason to believe the rest of Norton's solution is any better.

author: tessaje
title: i have had norton for years now, and am ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: i have had norton for years now, and am uninstalling it and going with another antivirus program. norton unexplainably and without notice removed their safe search feature (yes, i know, i can use it if i install ask.com as my search provider - never).  since then the program has done essentially nothing for me.  i've contacted customer support on 5 different occasions and had absolutely no help - canned, scripted responses ("we're working on making this better", etc.), and people who cannot communicate well.  norton reminds me of the problems turbo tax had last year, when they changed core components of the program, people were outraged and left in droves, and then they tried to fix after the fact.  no more norton, ever, for me.

author: ChuckieG
title: Good deal, with some qualifications
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Great deal. However, the product requires you sign up for automatic renewal (that costs considerably more than the original product). So you have to monitor your Symantec account and cancel your renewal prior to the time it automatically renews. One flaw (in my view) is that they have removed the Backup function (from the product it replaces: Norton 360) and you have to purchase a separate Backup program.  Otherwise, great product.

author: Big Daddy
title: Do not download Norton if you want to keep your ...
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Do not download Norton if you want to keep your computer. This program has fried my old laptops motherboard, and my 3 year old(now) laptops ENTIRE keyboard, corrupted my files, and fried my usb port. This program did nothing for years yet did everything it could to disguise as something that was helpful.For the sake of your computer, do NOT download this! This has happened to many other customers.

author: Arthur
title: Good Product, poor support
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've been using Norton for years and like the product. The one-star rating isn't based on quality of the product but how Norton does business.I had 80+ days left on my subscription when it was shown as expired because of a refund. I attempted to re-enter the key code to no avail. A discussion with Live Chat indicated that I couldn't be helped since a refund had been issued (to a name which isn't on the subscription) so I was no longer covered. A case has been turned over to the 'concerned department' but that has also proved fruitless.In the meantime I've downloaded a free virus program to get me by until I decide what product will provide me with reliable protection.Any company can make mistakes but how those mistakes are resolved defines who they are. I was hoping for a resolution since I prefer to stick with what has worked in the past but I'm at the point of writing them off.

author: FamSchultzWy
title: Not Good Luck with Android
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: It seems to work OK. You can download it to other devices. It has a feature when if your phone stole you can have it make this awful noise. Not sure what was going on, (were they hacked?) it would go on for no reason scaring the hell out of fellow employees. Had to delete it from my android/Samsung phone. (did like that when I flubbed up my password a few time in a row it took a photo and sent it to my email) maybe I will try again someday.

author: Debi
title: BAD PRODUCT!
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: My computer crashed 2 times in 2 years using this! Once it tells you to renew you subscription, they have your credit card info and they automatically use your info to renew the subscription without your knowledge or say so. It also slowed down my computer. After the second computer crash, I just threw the computer away than to deal with Norton again. I will never purchase a Norton product again!

author: William S.
title: Norton is bad business
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Norton installed Security Deluxe on my computer while I had five plus months of Internet Security one-year subscription remaining. I was notified by my credit card company, not Norton. My computer slowed down perceptively. I called Norton Customer Service and asked them to remove Security Deluxe and put back Internet Security. They said they could not do it because they had no record of my installation, but they did have a date for Automatic Renewal--which I specifically declined when I installed Internet Security. I have been a customer/user of Norton/Symantec since they became companies. No more. Their business practices are deceitful, unethical, and violate their own written contract--for one-year service. And I no longer believe their products are the best. I have learned one lesson. Keep your receipts.

types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: This product is faulty.  I was directed to a California company for “ support “ and they scammed me.  Ever notice how there are at least a dozen numbers for Norton Support.  Beware.  My support number actually flashed up on my phone when the product would not load.  I wish I had never gotten this product.  Had Webroot and it was great.  This “ deal” has cost me more than any savings and now I think I have malware.  Ironic isn’t it that your systems become vulnerable while installing  security software

author: D. Parikh
title: YOU ARE NOT BUYING THE SERVICE--YOU ARE GETTING MARRIED TO IT
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I got a mac July 2012; and was told I do  not need Norton. I have never installed it on my new computer.  Before that I had stopped using the Norton product on my Dell Computer and deleted it from my pc around 2010.  In July 2012 I took apart my pc and took it to the recycling place.  Hard drive still in my garage.  But I got a billing notice today stating that they will be charging my credit card.  In the past I have spent a long time on the phone explaining that I do not want the product, and I do not want to pay for it.  This year I disputed it with my credit card company, but Norton is fighting the dispute even though they know I have not updated the product for five years.  Now I have to pay norton or  mess up my credit.Maybe I have commitment issues, but be forewarned once you sign up for this it looks like a lifetime commitment.

author: Rickochet
title: No Internet Connection Means Inferior Malware Scans
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I'm surprised that hardly anyone has complained about the full system scan.  It claims that for it to be effective you must be connected to the Internet.  What?!  A lot of the time, malware has stops you from connecting to the Internet.  Therefore, they are telling you that their product is inferior for malware that has stopped you from connecting to the Internet.

author: Andrew Cobble
title: Want spam from Norton, then pay for this product
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: If you like getting spam, this is the product for you. Once you download it, Norton will proceed to blanket your inbox with messages that may as well be from a Nigerian Prince. "You may be unprotected!" Wait, you think, I just purchased Norton, why am I unprotected? It's because Norton has other stuff to sell, or, half the time, they just like e-mailing you garbage and reminders that you've already purchased their product. But, is that all? Of course not, this is a premium product! Every single time you turn on your computer, Norton will suggest you do something - like, download a browser extension which you have already done, and checked that you've done, several times. They don't care, they will keep sending you reminders, For Ever!

body: Let's be clear. I'm not into wasting money or people's time. If I thought Norton was a junk product I wouldn't even write this review. But that's not the case. Laboratory testing has ranked Norton as top malware detector on multiple occasions, and its value added features of great firewall plus performance enhancements make it a very useful product.  Norton is one of the (very) few premium subscriptions I buy. Divide the cost by coverage for five devices and the price is more than fair.

body: I already knew that I hated McAfee but I hate Norton just as much.  I went to load my 5 user Norton on one of my computers where my security program had just expired. Ok I am now getting frustrated (blonde here) and I am hungry so went to have some yogurt. Just then the phone rang out of the blue. They say it was Norton.  Who knows.  Hubby was talking to the non native English speaking tech person who told him to get on the computer. Husband got on the computer which is about 10 months old. Then the tech guy took over the computer and pulled up a page of "malware" which was stopping my Norton from loading.  He did ask about Windows 10 but then said nothing about it being incompatible. What he could do for a very insistent $80 was give us a program that would get rid of the malware. It felt funny. I told hubby to get off the phone.  I changed my passwords, reset the computer to factory specs (what fun) including going back to windows 8.Guess what. The norton still doesn't work and I can't get the windows defender on.  I hate this security device

author: S K
title: Crashes, Viruses, Crashes Firefox, Doesn't work on Windows 10, 8, 7, Vista, Complete Junk
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I'll make it simple. It doesn't work. It turns off and does not let you know. SEE PICTURES. I have to click on Norton several times while online to make sure it is not grayed out or red. When the bars are like that, that's when you get the viruses.They have ruined Norton. They know it is so bad because they have sent me several surveys to see what I think of their product. Have spent untold hours fixing problems caused by Norton. Norton would crash Firefox several times a day. The add-on was so bad Firefox removed it. Now Firefox does not crash at all. So if you want your computer ruined because you cannot fix it, go with Norton. If you do not want a junk computer, stay far far far away!!!! P.S. When your Norton Subscription is in the last 30 days, Norton will pester you nonstop with popups wanting you to renew. The last straw was when the popups would be in Spanish ONLY, no English at all. When your subscription runs out, NORTON TURNS OFF - YOU HAVE NO PROTECTION PERIOD!!!!!!! I'm done with that!!!!!!!!!!!!!

author: Tinkerer
title: It makes mistakes, but then makes them difficult to fix
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've had this product installed on my custom built machine for a little over a year now, and it's pretty awful. It constantly "fixes" my machine by finding libraries I've just compiled (I'm a software developer) and removing them from my machine because they are "threats". This is of course ridiculous, but I wouldn't be that upset if there was a big undo button somewhere. While you can eventually get there with a lot of clicking around, the most obnoxious aspect of it all is that it literally just trashed one of my files (while confidently announcing "we quarantined this threat! there is nothing further you need to do!"), but when I say yeah don't do that, you screwed up, please restore the file, it says, sure, where do you you want me to restore it? WTF?! You JUST deleted a critical file, why do I need to go hunt down where on the filesystem you deleted it from and tell you to put it back there?! Unbelievable. I've been living with this off an on for over a year, and I've just had enough. Again, it's not that it deletes my files because of a false positive that I find so objectionable. It's that it makes it so incredibly painful to fix what it screwed up. It's just such a shame, because this could have been so easily prevented.

body: I purchased this software directly from Norton, and it is disappointing that you can buy it cheaper every year, than signing up for auto renewal.  However, this product has never failed me.  Yes, it does slow your computer down immensely at times, but it's worth it.  I hate reviewers that complain about their experience, rather than the product itself.  The product is great, but I give it 4 stars because of the fact that Norton makes you pay more as a repeat customer.  The other reviewer gave it only a one star because of their experience getting it loaded.  Review the product, not your experience.

author: Daniel Allen
title: Tried Them All and Norton Comes Out the Shining Winner for Me....
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: I've been In to Computer's since 1993.  I've also had a "Hobby Job" fixing and consulting other peoples PC"s..  I've always have had a couple PC's,  Laptop's and Tablet at any given time..  I've used most of the most popular Antivirus Software...  I always come to the Conclusion that Symantec is the BEST...  It seems to always place In the Top Two in the PC Magazines that have  Annual Reviews of the top Security Suites.  I've been using Norton Security Deluxe, (Solely) for the last three years and I think it is the best..  It does like all Security Suites costs $45-65 dollars, but I've found that if I watch the price on Amazon or else ware,  I always get it for a sales price of under $30 for a 5+ license, before my current license expires..  At that price it comes out to paying $6 per PC per year which is about the lowest you can find for one of the major Security Suites....  And Once Again, ( In My Opinion) the BEST Security Suite...

author: Emzet
title: Pretty good
types: Platform: Download Code [12 Month, with Auto-Renewal]Edition: 5 Device
body: Current Norton users beware! If you are upgrading or extending the license of a current installation, you should wait until the current license expires. Otherwise you would lose the remaining time on your current license.This is really annoying and Norton recognize it. If you don't mind spending the time on the phone with their customer service, you can give them a call and they will manually add the remaining time of your old license to the new one.In terms of the software itself, I have nothing bad to say. I've been using Norton for years. They are pretty good - better than you would expect. The installation is easy, the anti-virus doesn't slow down your PC...If you're looking for a free option, Avast is the market leader on the open source front. And yes, they are open source and they are free.I'm using Norton only because I can write it up an an office expense.The one thing I wanted to mention is the weird amazon packaging and pricing. The price for 5 devices is cheaper than the price for 3 devices?! It just doesn't make much sense, does it?
